Category: Beauty & Personal Care › Makeup › Eyes › Eyeshadow Bases & Primers
Description: Preps your eyelid for smoother, longer-lasting, and crease-proof glitter eyeshadow. The lightweight liquid formula quickly absorbs into the skin for comfortable wear, increases eye color longevity, and creates a lasting bond for stay-put glitter that holds. Infused with Shea Butter and Jojoba to nourish the delicate eye area. Great with loose or pressed glitter eyeshadows.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Amazing adhesive for eye glitter! No fallout!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I purchased this to use for my loose glitter that I apply to my eyes. The reviews are amazing and I have found some really great E.L.F. products in the past so I decided to give this a go. This adhesive is AWESOME. First of all: for the amount you receive, the quality and the asking price this is a total steal. I have seen other glitter adhesives go over the $10 mark, which I think is ridiculous. This one by E.L.F. takes the cake.I found the following things to be true:- There is very little, if any, fallout when applied correctly- I only had to apply this once to last all day- It dries clear- The product is very easy to work withI have a little method for using this adhesive and I think it is worth sharing:1. Dab adhesive onto ONE clean eyelid with an eyeshadow brush2. Immediately apply glitter on top of adhesive with another eyeshadow brush3. Use a tissue under your eye to collect any glitter that falls as you apply glitter4. Repeat steps 1-3.It is very important to apply adhesive on just one eye then immediately use the glitter. When one eye is complete, you can do the other eye. This helps the glitter stay well before the adhesive dries and prevents fallout.I have been raving about this adhesive to anyone who will listen because it is that good. I am recommending it 100%!
I was skeptical about buying this but I'm glad i did! Its super affordable and good quality, and also got here really fast! I tried it out right away and was pleased with the results :)
Love this stuff.. Great results at a bargain price. Specially for a one time or once in a blue moon glitter users.
Loveeeeeee it! It's not messy you don't have to apply much for the glitter to stick!

I love this glitter primer!!! It's perfect and kept my glitter on perfectly!! But I do suggest you do your eye makeup first before your face because glitter will slightly get on your cheeks for those who wouldn't know.
Holds loose glitter shadow VERY well!!
I was very skeptical about buying the primer but I went ahead and j must say its wonderful it blew my mind. The glitters stuck to it very well and wasn't getting all messy. It's a must buy

So I don't use this as my regular eye primer, and I wouldn't recommend anyone do that. However, I do like this a lot for loose shadows and glitter. I found that it wore well throughout the day, but I did have some creasing on one of my eyes. Using a quality eyeshadow primer underneath helps with that, though, and the less shadow I put on, the less it creases. You have to work kind of quickly when you use this, because it dries down fast, and it's best to work with glitter primers when your base is sticky. Otherwise, you'll probably have a lot of fallout to deal with, and if you've already done your base it's the biggest pain to clean up dark glittery powder from under your eyes.I'm not sure if this product is comparable to Fyrinnae's Pixie Epoxy, but I used the e.l.f. Glitter Primer with one of Fyrinnae's loose shadows (Wicked). Granted, I used the shadow wet with setting spray, which always helps bring out duochromes, but the shadow was really vibrant. I definitely think it stuck to the glitter primer better than loose shadows do with my normal primer, and I had a lot less fallout using the sticky base as well. I'd recommend this for people who work with loose shadows, glitter, and very shimmery shadows, but not any one else. One of e.l.f.'s hits for sure, though.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: it didn't hold very well for an all day wear it could have been the glitter that sucked. For the price tho this thing is bomb ..
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Fav for real, it didn't hold very well for an all day wear it could have been the glitter that sucked. For the price tho this thing is bomb a little goes so far!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Love to use glitter on eyes? Stock up on this STAT!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I LOVE to use loose glitter on my eyes all the time; when a beauty store stopped carrying a special glitter glue I was really disappointed. The makeup line "Too Faced" carries what they claim is a glitter glue, but really it's just another regular eyeshadow primer. THIS, however, is the real deal. I can't say enough about it!! The glitter stuck and stayed *perfectly* to my eyelid without any problem!! I admit, at first I was worried that it was just going to be like the Too Faced glitter "glue", but I was happily proven wrong! Suffice to say, I'll be buying this every month!! May it be available until the year 3000---I'll try to be around to order it!  ;D  :D  :D Love, love, LOVE IT!!!!
It kept the glitter right where I wanted it without making my eyelid feel stiff or sticky. Easy to use and dries clear.
Holds very good.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: ... but I have OILY OILY OILY eye lids and love me some indie makeup
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Maybe I need some advice here but I have OILY OILY OILY eye lids and love me some indie makeup. With lots of indies you need a glitter primer so you can get all those sparklie goodies to stay on your face. I've used this with a regular primer and without but no matter what I do the darn stuff creases like a mother. I'm also not incredibly impressed with the amount of glitter this will hold on to. It's tacky and it does grab some sparkle but not nearly enough.Also, get this in a store where it'll cost you $1-2. (Target and Wal-mart both sell these in So Cal)

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: and just like everyone else already said
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: i reviewed this item, and just like everyone else already said..:ill say it again:THIS PRODUCT IS GREAT!!! i was too one of those people that was at first sceptical to buy this product becuase it was "e.l.f." brand, a lowerend brand or non-expensive brand. however, i had heard great things about the brand and this product in particular. i saw this item posted for a high price though, at around $12+(not including shipping). i was surprised, so i decided to buy it at the drug store myself, expecting a lower price there. however, i could not find the product anywhere at any drug store, so i decided to wait. finally i found this product at a lower price i think around &4-5. i had read that this item should not be more than $2-5. so i was not going to pay more than that knowing that it is a lower end brand. i have not tried this"glitter primer/glue" in other more expensive brands, but i am going to do so , in order to compare prices, and see if my primer works just as good. i am sure that i will soon see that it is just as good as the "sephora" or "too-faced" brand. i thought the product went on smoothly, and did a great job of holding the glitter or the eye shadow on. i forgot to wash this off, along with other eye makeup, and it stayed on all night. i assume that means it will stay on very well all day and all night (literally). it was not sticky or glue like, and i never felt like i was pulling my eyelids off. however, it did seem a little dry or stuck in one spot the next day because i had worn it overnight and fell asleep, probably not a good idea..Anyways YES THIS PRODUCT IS AMAZING AND YOU CANNOT BEAT THE PRICE!!!I AM VERY HAPPY

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Works Great At An Affordable Price
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was recently given several MAC eye shadow pallets for Mother's Day. I couldn't use it because of constant smearing and coming off even when using my favorite MAC primer. So I read reviews for this product and decided to give it a try. It is exactly what I needed. I put it on and then applied the eye shadow--instant success, fallout problem gone, and beautiful pigmentation. I didn't even need much product for the results. If you're considering trying this with a glitter shadow-just do it. You will be happy you did. Also, in the review section of this product you have to answer how many times a day do you need to reapply. You DO NOT need to reapply but there was not an option for none.

Lemme just say one word.. amazing! Seriously been looking for the perfect glitter primer I even tried the benefit one for 20$ n that didnt work as well as this one.. one thing I will tip especially for those who wrote a bad review or just wrote "meh", use a small flat dense brush when applying glitter that way you will have a more compact look;) when taking off it could b hard so use eye makeup remover not just water:) my go to now especially during the holidays!Source: certified makeup artist and youtube guru

I had hopped for a little shimmer with thisbut unfortunately this is just normal looking primer. However that being said this is one of the best working primers I have used. I've tried Clinique, NYC and my regular liquid foundation. None of them work nearly as well as E.L.F. It goes on a little white so you can see where you put it but it dries clear. It is also very creamy without being sticky. Speaking my eyeshadow last all day when using this whereas before it was gone within 4-5 hours. (Yes I'm using the same eyeshadow.) It also helps my lower quality shadows (Wet n' Wild) from flaking off. Over all though I do think this is a great product and I would buy this,again.

Really does the job! Glitter sticks really well, although as a few people have mentioned, you should probably apply primer and glitter to one eye, then the other. What I've noticed is that it works SO well that you kind of have to be careful how much glitter you apply! The first time I used it I applied WAAAY too much glitter, and my whole eyelid looked completely covered in glitter. If that's the look you're going for, you can definitely achieve it with this! I, however, was not, so now I'm sure to apply the glitter with a makeup sponge or something, and with just a very very light coating of glitter.Overall, great product!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: A non-irritating product that keeps shadow in place and is reasonably priced
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is a good primer for the price - I've tried everything from really cheap to really expensive brands and there isn't a *whole* lot of difference when it comes to primers.  Really cheap primers can irritate your eyes and show creasing... this product did not do that.  If you're looking to keep shadow on all day but get a primer that doesn't break the bank, this primer is for you!

So many people sang the praises of this primer, but I've used both this and eyelash glue to hold cosmetic glitter "highlighter" on my cheeks. Eyelash glue did the job far better, held up to dancing, sweat, and heat. This one... sorta kept some glitter on. I guess if you want an easy-wash, gentle eye glitter primer, this might do it, but eyelash glue killed it in long-wear (or even short sticking) arena. If you're putting glitter on your face, you can do better.

This works so fantastically.  Minimal glitter fallout and also works great for packing on pigment heavy eyeshadow looks.  Easy to remove and comfortable to wear; no sticky feeling.  And the price point can't be beat.  I used to use the Too Faced glitter glue and this is 1/10 the price and works better.

This is great for products that have a lot of glitteror the possibility of fallout - if you want your glittery eyeshadow to pop, you NEED this. All it takes is the tiniest amount and your lids will shimmer the whole night. It is quite a lot, and rather inexpensive for how much you will use. What I do is apply eyeshadow normally, then place a bit of the Glitter primer in the center of my eye (or where I want the most shine to be). I wait about 45 seconds for it to get tacky, then take a brush and pat the eyeshadow on again, directly where you want the most attention.It works like a charm!

I put this on then I apply the glitter.  This glitter stays on all night.  I use an oil to remove it.  I remove the glitter first, then remove the rest of my make up with my make-up remover. I some times use the remove to get the last traces of glitter.

First time I have ever used makeup glue and I think I hit a home run with this one! I have to apply only once, add my glitter on top and forget about it. It does not flake nor smudge and the glitter does not fall off at all during use. Quick dry time and does not transfer all over the place for people like me with semi-hooded eye lids.

This has been a total game changer for my makeup. I could never figure out how to get my loose pigments to stay until recently I saw someone say glitter primer. And oh my goodness. My eyeshadow looks totally amazing when I use this with the pigments. I'll have to continue to buy this. Definitely recommend.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I could not make up my mind weather to but it or not but I'm glad I did because I'm happy with the product
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Every time that I go out I pull this out for my loose glitter and it works wonders. I could not make up my mind weather to but it or not but I'm glad I did because I'm happy with the product. One thing that would make me happier is if it didn't dry so fast. So you have to work fast with it. But even with that you don't have to keep reapplying it and the glitter does not fall out.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: MAKES LOOSE GLITTER STAY FOR OVER 24 HRS
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: IF YOU USE LOOSE GLITTER PLEASE PURCHASE THIS BOMB GLITTER PRIMER! The primer isn't just a primer, it makes loose glitter stick and I love it! I don't even use glitter glue anymore. It is way better than the expensive competitors.

Woah! I am very pleased with this primer especially for the price. I usually use Urban Decay primers but I've found it just does NOT hold the shimmery shades with micro glitter very well at all. I bought the Moondust Palette and barely used it because the UD primers just allowed so much of it to fall off my eyes. I was disappointed. I purchased this and tried it for the first time yesterday with the green shade (Lightyear) and WOW, it stayed for 8 solid hours with minimal creasing and fallout. The color popped! I will say there is a trick to the primer, you must apply a thin layer and while it's still wet, apply the shadow/glitter, by dabbing it on the primer. There isn't much ability to blend with this primer, but that's OK, I'll use my normal primer to blend and add this primer for glitter accents. :)

However, it seems to be a good product and I think it just takes some practice.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Like so many of the other reviewers

Not only did I save some money, but the product goes on easily with a brush (I used a small concealer brush) and the glitter went right on. I wore it all day and have not experienced any fallout or any negative effects. Ladies, unless you have to have the name brand product, save yourself some money and grab this product!!!

This does exactly what it says, wow!! Tried it with my Eye Candy glitter and it worked wonderfully! I put it on my lid, then packed on some glitter. I didn't get any fall out at all, I was impressed! Package didn't come damaged and was packaged very well. Extremely excited to use this for New Years Eve!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I live this for my glitter looks!

I apply it on the eyelid and close to the lashing and have never had any irritation or issues.Great price, great company, very happy!

It works well in giving the shadows something to adhere to but it does nothing to provide an even tone base like Too Face and some other primers do. Works amazing and the glitter does not clump at all. Stays on all night without fallout. So amazing and everything it says it is. If you are using it on your eyes just a tip keep your eyes closed until you have applied the glitter and let it dry a little to prevent clumping in the crease. Other than that perfect.

If you're used to applying body glitter you probably already know what I found out the hard way: it dries quickly so don't apply to all the places you want glitter and then apply the glitter; apply only immediately before the glitter.

I attempted to apply the glitter over the glue but the glue showed up more than the glitter did.  You have to literally pack on the glitter as to cover the glue from coming up.  I had packed on so much glitter I had fall out all over my cheeks and under my eyes.

I like many ELF products, so when I needed to start using glitter makeup for my Celine Dion tribute show (I am a professional celebrity impersonator) I was happy to see ELF as a recommend product. The tip of the tube is a tapered applicator, making putting the primer on easy. You need very little for it to work. It dries clear and did a nice job keeping the glitter makeup on. It washed off easily when I wanted to take it off. Another keeper from ELF.

I was skeptical because of the pricing & the brand. But I didn't want to splurge on an expensive glitter glue. I did my research on this & decided to purchase it anyway & I LOVE IT !! No fallout , my glitter stick well on to the product as well as the pigments I used. Not hard to use. The product also has good nourishing oils for the eye care. That's a big plus. I will continue to buy this as long as I do makeup !!

Application then waiting a few seconds to do shadow but glitter I put on while still more wet. Little sections of glitter at a time.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Glitter Primer is Okay, but Better Options are Probably Available.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I'm new to using a glitter primer and loose glitter for make up.  This is the first glitter primer I've tried and I don't think it is exactly as I expected.  While it dries nicely, the lack of tackiness and the quick drying effects the application of the glitter.  Granted, I need a little practice, but in order to get the proper use, I use only a very small amount (definitely on only one eye at a time for example) and then apply the glitter and then move the next area I want glitter.  If I put it on say, both sides of my face, by the time I get the glitter applied to one side, the other side is dry and needs re-application.  Its a learning process, but I think there are likely better products out there for this purpose and I'll be trying those.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great buy for only a few dollars
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was looking for a primer specifically for glitter and did not want to spend 20+ dollars at sephora. I thought I would try this out as it retails for 2 dollars.  Glue is definitely the right word here, it has a very similar consistency to Elmer's Glue.  I find, for glitter as well as loose pigment shadows, this works better than the regular primers.  Here's why: this stuff remains tacky until you place another product on top.  That being said, there is still a little fall out with big-glitter shadows.  This, so far, is the best I've found for glitter primer, so I really would recommend it.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: The opposite of what a primer should be..
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Growing up Korean, I became accustomed to being someone with hooded lids, or 'double eyelids', it's quite common for me to always be searching for a new primer to use on my eyelids. That being said, I wasn't crazy about this product. It's far less creamy, and much more slippery than I had expected. It's almost the opposite of what a primer should be..however, I do realize that everybody has different skin, and this review only represents my personal experience. For me, it is almost like an oil-based primer, very watery and light. It hasn't done the job I needed from a primer, so I will not be buying this again in the future.

For my oily lids, this Elf Glitter Primer absolutely sucked. I had high hopes since it would be marvelous to find a great eye primer for under $5, but sometimes you do in fact get what you pay for. I love a lot of other Elf products, but this glitter primer was a total disappointment when compared to the UD eye primer I normally use. This stuff did look like glue but it was surprisingly thin.  I was able to apply my shadows no problem and everything seemed fine and dandy, but then when I looked in the mirror almost 4 hours later I was shocked to see that everything had slid into my creases and was an oily, ugly mess (this NEVER happens with my more expensive primer). This worked the same as not using an eye primer at all! Overall, this is one product I would never purchase again.

Product_Name: E.l.f. Glitter Primer

Category: Beauty & Personal Care › Makeup › Eyes › Eyeshadow Bases & Primers
Description: Milani Eyeshadow Primer, Nude, 0.30 Fluid Ounce

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I would consider myself a makeup artist and a drag queen. My looks consist of very bright and bold colors on the eyes and long-time wear. I actually prefer this product over the urban decay eyeshadow primer, for a few reasons.1. The product does not have an applicator, like the UD primer, it can be squeezed right onto a makeup brush. The use of the applicator causes streaks and use of more product.2. Fuller coverage for less product.3.  Better price.It grabs the eyeshadow true to color all day, cooperates with my brushes and allows for a seamless look. If your eyeshadow palettes aren't the best, it will still make medium quality eyeshadows look great. (I've never tried it on low quality eyeshadow). I find that it works better unset with powder. If you prefer to set your eyes with powder you may want to consider UD. I find that an unset eye makes for better blending and less patchiness. Good product, good price, not much needed per eye. Drag queen approved!!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: the color payoff for the eyeshadow is better, and it stays on all day but also ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I bought this hoping it would a lower priced alternative to Urban Decay Primer. This stuff works just as well as higher priced products, the color payoff for the eyeshadow is better, and it stays on all day but also is easy to remove.

Let me tell you what primer can do for you. Seriously.The first picture is right after the application of the primer and my eye makeup. The eyeshadow I used was $5-- NOT high quality stuff, but lovely colors. (Check out Technic brand Brights-- it's better than you'd think for the price, especially with primer!)Anyways, the second photo is 8 hours later and the third is over 13 hours from the first photo. I didn't notice creasing until I took that pic, and it's not even noticeable until I'm nearly touching my nose to a mirror.I'm going to go to sleep with it on just for fun to see what I wake up with in the morning.Tip for applying: don't do anything fancy! Just put a dab on your finger and cover your whole eyelid up to the brow. Let it dry for a sec. You shouldn't be able to see it, and it should feel very light.

I wanted to love this product, but it was too greasy on my lid and wasn't happy with the role it's supposed to play (and I ensured to mix it up, and knead it a bit - just in case it had separated). I'm not sure if it was an old primer tube, but I would not recommend this product. 40YO eyes, and I need a solid primer. I need something that preps the surface, and perhaps it's my skin type. Not sure how there's so many raving reviews for this product.

Finally a budget friendly primer that actually WORKS!! I have tried others and was very disappointed and kept going back to UD, which is more expensive but is worth it since it works so well. I saw this reviewed somewhere and decided to take the chance one more time, and I'm glad I did. This works just as well as UD but at a fraction of the price. I will definitely continue to use this and recommend others try it as well.

I will never again buy super expensive products like UD for this use.  This is amazing and makes my eye shadow stay on all day without a crease.  The only problem I have had is the tube itself has begun to liquefy at the bottom.  Sometimes when I squeeze out my tiny drop of formula, some clear liquid (separation of product) came out.  It hasn't negatively affected how the product works, so I'm not too bothered by it.

Sorry to say this product did not work for me. It goes on gunky. No matter how thinly I apply it dries up and flakes off. I looked in the mirror while shopping and I was appalled. It looked like I had a disease of the skin around my eyes. It was so crusty I couldn't get it off without warm water in the ladies room.The worst part of this experience is that my eyes watered and my nose ran all day. All that stopped as soon as I washed it off. I don't usually complain about a product but I felt I needed to let others know how it didn't work out for me. The good thing is that I have no damage or symptoms to my eyes or eye areas afterwards.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great primer in general and great for older eyes!! Affordable, too!!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: One of my eyes produces more oil than the other one and this primer keeps liner and shadow on all day. I do go over everything (bottom lash line and upper lash line with a very small brush using E.L.F. High Definition Undereye Setting Powder or Mary Kay Translucent Setting Powder. I'm thrilled with how the shadow goes on and holds the color. Even when I had to go to the ER recently, I did not wash my makeup off until the next day. My brow powder, eye shadow, and liner were still holding. My brow powder stays on beautifully as well. I will repurchase this primer. It's wonderful for older eyes. I'm 61 and wanted something that wouldn't crease.I also didn't want to have bottom eyeliner migrate and smear. This fits the bill. I watched the review of it on YouTube by "Hot and Flashy." She was right and the price is so much better than other primers.

Great inexpensive primer for fair skinned women.  Am fair, but this primer is fairer than my tone. So I only use along lash line for my liner, as I have oily lids which need primer.  Careful not to apply too much or it will cake.  Less is more, dot on & spread!  Be sure to let dry with lid closed before applying colors on.

Now I prime my eyelids with this product, and then top it with some translucent powder. My eyeshadows last all day, even if I've been sweating at work. Amazing!!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Happy I gave it a shot (Urban Decay Primer Potion loyal for years)
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I am really happy with the performance of this product!!!!  I usually buy Urban Decay Primer Potion ($24 for 0.33 oz).  I was on a 30 day "no-buy" when my eye shadow primer ran out!  I tried going without primer and my eye shadow was creasing- of course!  I needed to replace my empty primer but I was also trying to save money.  I decided to give this a shot.  So glad I did!  My eye shadow easily lasts through my 12 hour shift.  Works as good as Urban Decay for a fraction of the price.  The application is slightly different.  Other than that I am very happy with it and I don't really see the need to go back to Urban Decay.  I used it to do my friends makeup the other night and she was surprised saying her eye shadow and eyeliner never last long.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: New HOLY GRAIL eye primer! Best deal on the market!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have recently purchased the Lorac eye primer, and really liked it, enough that I started to run low, and panicked a bit! I remember hearing a YouTuber that I trust named Emily Noel recommend this primer, even referring to it as her "Holy Grail!" I know that she had the chance to try so many that at this price, I had to try it! I am so incredibly glad I did. I love this eyeshadow primer MORE than the Lorac! Lorac is about 3 times the price, so I am still in shock. I used both on my arm side by side with one of my lower quality eyeshadows and swiped swatches on the bare skin, Lorac primer, and this one, and the Milani was the obvious winner. On days that I used the Milani I noticed that not only was the color of my shadows more intense, but it lasted ALL day and then some, you have to use a makeup remover to even get it to budge. So far, it has worked flawlessly with all of the shadows I have tried it with on a large range of qualities and price points. I cannot stress enough that you should give this a shot, I almost promise that it will save you a ton of money in the future. I will not be using another brand unless I a sent a sample or something, and it somehow beats this one out! AMAZING buy and an official must have for me!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I purchased this after reading good reviews on Reddit
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I purchased this after reading good reviews on Reddit. This primer is supposed to be on par with Urban Decay and other more expensive brands. Having never tried UB, I can say that this primer will be the reason I never have to. I think it works great, goes on like nude-clear, and stays on all day. It keeps my eye shadow in place and I love how it brings out the pigment. I would def recommend and purchase again.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I love how it goes on so smoothly and it really ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I purchased this to help keep my eyeshadow from creasing during the day. I love how it goes on so smoothly and it really makes the colors in my shadows more vibrant. It also keeps my shadow from disappearing by the end of the day. I still see a little creasing, but only after wearing makeup from morning to night. The texture is creamy, light and blends easily. Overall, I'm pleased.

I'm not one to spend a ton on make up but I do enjoy it. I don't have high end eyeshadows but enjoy cheaper (yet good quality) ones like the revealed 2 coastal scents palette. Since using this primer, the application of the eyeshadows has improved exponentially. The colors are more vibrant, they "stick" to the primer perfectly, it helps to keep my shadow in place (no colors blending into one hot mess) and it prevents creasing. I wear make up for most of the day (7am-7pm) and this makes my eyeshadows look fawless from the moment I leave the house until I'm ready to take my make up off.

Overall this is a very good primer...a great alternative to any high end eyeshadow primers. If you have eye lids that get extra oily, this will work out great for you, but if you tend to have dryer skin, this may dry out your eyelids a bit more. Its a great quality eye primer, in that it makes it easy for eyeshadows to adhere to the skin as well as blend well into the skin without causing any blotchiness. The best thing about this product is 1) a little goes a long way, and 2) this product will last you a VERY long time, even if you use it every day (which is what I do). I definitely recommend this product to others.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Better than UDPP, TFSI, or WnW eye primer!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have used a variety of eye primers in the past 8 years or so, and I have to say, I think the Milani eye primer is very likely to be my favorite, not just among the cheaper options but also against high end stuff too.  In the past the two I used most were the Urban Decay Primer Potion and the Too Faced Shadow Insurance.  I started with UDPP but eventually moved over to using TFSI as I liked the texture of TFSI more.  UDPP always felt a bit more oily and liquidy compared to TFSI.  The problem I ended up having with TFSI is that after a while it separates, and then it turns into greasy mess too.Later I started using the Wet n Wild eye primer, which I really liked for a long time.  I pretty much liked the WnW as much as I liked TFSI, maybe a little more since it's cheaper.  However I noticed the WnW primer had kind of opposite problem of both UDPP and TFSI - whereas UDPP and TFSI are both more liquidy and oily (esp after TFSI separates), I find the WnW to be rather dry.I stopped wearing makeup for a couple of years, then recently I picked up a couple tubes of UDPP when it was on sale during black friday, thinking it's gotten much cheaper and surely UDPP is good.  Except I realized that it REALLY is much liquidier and greasier than I prefer.  Because of the liquidy texture, it seems to take much longer to pat it onto my lid, and the greasiness/liquidiness ends up not playing nice with the foundation around my eye area.  I tried to not put any fdnt on my eyelid, but it still was creating patchiness when I tried to blend it out at the edge of where the fdnt would meet the primer.  I noticed that the WnW primer was doing the same thing (though not as obvious).  At this point I don't have a tube of regular TFSI, just a sample of TFSI champaigne - and that was also doing the same thing.I picked the Milani eye primer up on a whim due to emilynoel83's youtube vids.  The texture is absolutely perfect - it's not liquidy/greasy like the UDPP, but it's not nearly as dry as WnW either.  Only time will tell if it separates or changes texture though, but even comparing brand new tubes of UDPP, WnW, and this together, this still have the best texture.  It also blends onto my eyelid super easily with zero patchiness where it meets foundation.  I also find that it doesn't disturb my concealer under my eyes either, and in general it somehow melds into my eyelid with minimum amount of need to pat/blend.  Both UDPP and WnW takes much longer.  I also find that I can simply pat it to blend, whereas both UDPP and WnW i had to tug/swipe (which then can cause more patchiness against fdnt and concealer).In terms of performance, it works as well as the other two.  I have oily skin but monolid so there's no crease to worry about.  Most primers work well on me, so just like with UDPP, WnW, and TFSI, this kept my eyeshadows on with no fading or melting, and vibrant all day.  I have yet to experience any oily pooling at the corner of my eyes from liner either (which used to happen back in the days, but it could've been because of the liner and not primer issues).For the price I paid, which is even cheaper than when UDPP went on sale, this is an excellent product.  I currently have a full new-ish tube of UDPP, an old sample of TFSI Champaigne, and a new-ish tube of WnW, and I still only wanna use this.  I also have a back up tube of UDPP that i literally do not know what to do with now.  Remind self to never buy backups, no matter how discounted, because I might find stuff I like better!  I believe the WnW primer is cheaper than this retail price (although with amazon S&S the price difference was only in cents level), but since the WnW is so much drier, I definitely still prefer this.  I'd rather shell over a couple of extra dollars and not run into my eyeprimer screwing with my foundation.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great bang for your buck primer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I like this primer. I have been a makeup snob for years and honestly haven't tried a lot of non-brand named primers but I found myself not wanting to pay $20 for my go to Urban Decay Primer Potion. I looked at a lot of different drugstore primers and found this one has the best reviews so I decided to give it a try. I was impressed. The product is a bit thinner and more oily than UD but still gets the job done. I also do notice more breakdown at the end of the day than compared to UD but again, not enough for me to be dissatisfied. For the price, I am pleased and will likely continue using this primer for daily use.

I'm not sure if I just got a bad one, but this primer is one of the worst I've tried. It came out of the tube poorly mixed, and even when shaken or mixed, it applied clumpy and nowhere close to smooth. It was just nowhere close to what I expected.On the bright side, shadows won't budge once applied over it. They may not look their best, but boy do they have staying power. I had a harder time blending over it, but with a bit of elbow grease, it came together. Didn't budge one bit and took a bit more makeup remover to take off than I do with other primers. So if staying power's what you want, this surprisingly worked well for that, despite my annoyance with its other qualities.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Going to say: I'm not a fan. Did ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Going to say:  I'm not a fan. Did the product work? Kinda. But kinda not.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great primer for a great price- better than more expensive brands out there!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This eyeshadow primer is actually a "caucasian" shade of nude, not white or clear like I expected. It does not have a color once it's rubbed in. You don't need a lot- it goes a long way. I have used more expensive primers in the past but this one is just as good as others I have tried (like Too Faced or Urban Decay). I love it. It's also a great price!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I'll pay for a good primer because it makes even the cheapest eyeshadow look ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I mine as well have just used my concealer. I typically use Urban Decay Eyeshadow primer potion and tried this one out because of the reviews. I'll pay for a good primer because it makes even the cheapest eyeshadow look great and last all day. This is not worth the savings in my opinion. It remained moist on the eye lid, and it made blending the eyeshadow look bad. I will say it did intensify the eyeshadow color as it claims to do, but if the eyeshadow won't blend nicely once it's applied what's the point?

This primer provides a vibrant, CREASELESS look! I apparently have oily eyelids, and have suffered from years of unsightly eye shadow creasing. I've tried so many primers, make sure to use powder, the whole shebang, and nothing has ever done the trick. Well, here I am in middle-of-summer Texas (i.e., oily AF) and my eye shadow looks just as it did this morning when I put it on. And the best part is the price!! So long $20 tubes of primer!A couple notes:- Although the primer looks to be a color, I find that it goes on pretty colorless, so you shouldn't have to worry much about skin matching.- You should let it dry for at about 30 seconds before applying any eye shadow onto it. Once it dries, you won't feel it there at all.- The primer is not sticky at all, so there is no issue with blending eye shadow colors.I would highly recommend this primer to anyone who asks.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Wow! This stuff really works! I typically have ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Wow! This stuff really works! I typically have very oily eyelids, and I had stopped wearing eyeshadow because of it. This primer has me thinking I can wear eyeshadow again! Will totally buy again!

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Arrived SUPER fast, love the product. Its thick enough to not waste too much product when you squeeze it, thin enough to go on smoothly. Feels like velvet, makes my eye lids feel buttery smooth. I haven't used it with high pigment eye shadow yet, so cant tell if it intensifies it like it says it does, but it does keep my regular shadow on all day, no creases. Will buy it again once it runs out, which should be a long time, a little seems to go a long way.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Works ok, but I have oily eyelids
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Easy to apply.  It looks darker than I expected coming out of the tube, but doesn't appear so on lids.  I only apply it once in the morning--I have super oily eyelids and need to reapply, but I don't carry it with me.  And it would work better if I didn't have oily eyelids--I've yet to find an eyeshadow primer that actually prevents eyeshadow from building up in the crease. :(

Wow, I completely understand all the hype around this primer. It brightens my eye shadow and last all day plus. It goes on evenly and has a great consistency, not to mention the price is oh so nice. I will continue ordering this Milani primer, for sure.Kristy (on fiance's account)

This is now my favourite eyelid primer. It's a light nude colour that blends into a sheer finish on the lids and gives a smooth, non-sticky surface for shadows to adhere to. Unlike some primers I've tried, shadows still blend well over this even without powdering beforehand. An excellent product and so much cheaper than popular mid/high-end primers.

Fantastic! I have oily eyelids and the elf brand primer did not work at all. My eye makeup melted and eye liner basically disappeared. This Milano primer works great. Makeup stays in place all day with no creasing and keeps my oily eyelids "dry".  Makeup goes on smoothly too. Can also use just the primer without putting on eyeshadow and just use eyeliner. For the price it's fantastic!!

It is SO PERFECT except for it is just a teeny bit too light tan for me-I need almost an off white.  Don't get me wrong, for the majority of people this would be light enough to provide a great base color, but  not if you're a pale, pale redhead :)

I was disappointed with the amount of product you get...Blend quickly because it does dry somewhat quickly. It does it's job but I have had better eye shadow primers and will not be purchasing again.

This primer is perfect! Right out of the squeeze-tube, the color is a lightly-tanned beige, but rubs down to perfectly match my skin tone at more of a  porcelain hue. It is NOT a sticky base, but holds eye shadow in place very well. At the end of the day, I have zero transference from my lid onto the area directly above it. It can also take a minor amount of rubbing without transference to your finger or smudging.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: When I received my package it was much smaller then I thought it would be. On the plus side a very small amount does go a long way. Compared to my Mary Kay primer this works just as great. Only down side would be how small of an amount you are getting.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: May be great for others, but NOT for me
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I bought this at my local CVS (where it cost about $7) after seeing several bloggers compare it to Urban Decay (one called it a "perfect dupe").  Now, to be fair, I've never used Urban Decay or any other specifically eye shadow primer, so maybe what it did on me was "normal" -- or maybe eye shadow primers just are not going to work on my 46 year old eyelids.I consider my skin to be pretty "normal" -- a little oily in my T-zone, a little dry on my cheeks, and of course as I've gotten older, I've gotten more laugh and smile lines. I wasn't expecting this or any other makeup to work miracles.I tried it first with my fingertips. It came out thick and wasn't very easy to smear on and as soon as it went on, my lids got dry, the wrinkles/droops (extra eyelid skin) were accentuated. I felt like I looked 10 or even 20 years older.I washed it off and tried applying it with a brush. The application went *much* smoother, but the outcome was still dry, wrinkly, awful looking eyelids. I waited the prescribed 30 seconds and put on my eye makeup anyway (Sugar Pill eye shadow and It eye liner). The shadow was difficult to get on, didn't blend or spread the way it usually does, wasn't noticeably brighter/darker (although Sugar Pill is pretty highly pigmented to begin with, so there was only so far it could go). The shadow caked into all of the creases created by the primer and all of the wrinkles that either hadn't been there before or that I hadn't noticed before (around my lash-line). My eyeliner was harder to apply (instead of gliding on, my skin pulled and tugged and the line wasn't smooth or even). In short: it was a hot mess.I removed my makeup, moisturized like crazy and in about 10 minutes, my lids went back to normal--which for me *is* a few wrinkles and a little droopiness.I'm going to pass the primer down to my daughter to see if she likes it any better than I did. It honestly may just be a matter of this product not being for someone in my age group. As a general rule, I like Milani makeup (love their Bella shadows; they're *almost* as good as Sugar Pill and come in some of my favorite colors.)

I was hesitant on buying this product after the horrible experiences I had in the past with primer and given its cheap price, I wasn't expecting much. I bought it and I got more than my money's worth. This stuff is fantastic! My eye makeup did not budge for the whole day and to really see if it was worth its salt, I went to sleep with my makeup on. It was only slightly smudged when I woke up. I cannot recommend this product enough and if I could, I would give it more than five stars.
Didn't make a difference at all. I bought this in hopes it would help with splotchy eye shadowing but it didn't make the least bit of difference.

I wasn't really fond of this product because it made my eyelids sting when I first applied it. The burning sensation did go away, but I don't think I would purchase again. The product was fairly runny and I don't really think it made much of a difference in the appearance of my eye shadow, it also gunked up my eyeliner brush. Was very meh.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: the texture can be a bit scary but you just have to keep tapping and blending and within 5-10 seconds you're good. I do recommen
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Currently, I'm testing out this one versus the Nars eyeshadow base. Right when you begin applying this, the texture can be a bit scary but you just have to keep tapping and blending and within 5-10 seconds you're good. I do recommend setting it before applying colors. As for its actual purpose, I've worn this under cream, wet and dry shadows and everything shows up prominately, blends quickly and stays put for 10+ hours. As for the comparison to the Nars base, that one is good of course, but I've actually experienced a lot of difficulty blending while wearing that because it latched on to the eyeshadow. You have to be patient with the texture and allow it to dry but it's well worth the small price.

Product_Name: Milani Eyeshadow Primer, Nude, 0.30 Fluid Ounce

Category: Beauty & Personal Care › Makeup › Eyes › Eyeshadow Bases & Primers
Description:
** E.L.F. Essential Glitter Primer #21611 NIP ELF Sheer Eye Shadow Eyeshadow Makeup ** 
 
Product Description: Preps your eyelid for smoother, longer-lasting, and crease-proof glitter eyeshadow. The lightweight liquid formula quickly absorbs into the skin for comfortable wear, increases eye color longevity, and creates a lasting bond for stay-put glitter that holds. Infused with Shea Butter and Jojoba to nourish the delicate eye area. Great with loose or pressed glitter eyeshadows. 
 
Use: Apply a thin coat to the eyelid and blend in. Tap on glitter eyeshadow with a finger or a brush while primer is still damp on the eye to lock in glitter.

sub category rank: 4 in Beauty & Personal Care > Makeup > Eyes > Eyeshadow Bases & Primers

Product_Name: e.l.f. Essential Glitter Primer - Clear elf Eye Eyelid Bond Crease

Category: Beauty & Personal Care › Makeup › Eyes › Eyeshadow Bases & Primers
Description: Preps your eyelid for smoother, longer-lasting, and crease-proof glitter eyeshadow. The lightweight liquid formula quickly absorbs into the skin for comfortable wear, increases eye color longevity, and creates a lasting bond for stay-put glitter that holds. Infused with Shea Butter and Jojoba to nourish the delicate eye area. Great with loose or pressed glitter eyeshadows.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Amazing adhesive for eye glitter! No fallout!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I purchased this to use for my loose glitter that I apply to my eyes. The reviews are amazing and I have found some really great E.L.F. products in the past so I decided to give this a go. This adhesive is AWESOME. First of all: for the amount you receive, the quality and the asking price this is a total steal. I have seen other glitter adhesives go over the $10 mark, which I think is ridiculous. This one by E.L.F. takes the cake.I found the following things to be true:- There is very little, if any, fallout when applied correctly- I only had to apply this once to last all day- It dries clear- The product is very easy to work withI have a little method for using this adhesive and I think it is worth sharing:1. Dab adhesive onto ONE clean eyelid with an eyeshadow brush2. Immediately apply glitter on top of adhesive with another eyeshadow brush3. Use a tissue under your eye to collect any glitter that falls as you apply glitter4. Repeat steps 1-3.It is very important to apply adhesive on just one eye then immediately use the glitter. When one eye is complete, you can do the other eye. This helps the glitter stay well before the adhesive dries and prevents fallout.I have been raving about this adhesive to anyone who will listen because it is that good. I am recommending it 100%!
I was skeptical about buying this but I'm glad i did! Its super affordable and good quality, and also got here really fast! I tried it out right away and was pleased with the results :)
Love this stuff.. Great results at a bargain price. Specially for a one time or once in a blue moon glitter users.
Loveeeeeee it! It's not messy you don't have to apply much for the glitter to stick!

I love this glitter primer!!! It's perfect and kept my glitter on perfectly!! But I do suggest you do your eye makeup first before your face because glitter will slightly get on your cheeks for those who wouldn't know.
Holds loose glitter shadow VERY well!!
I was very skeptical about buying the primer but I went ahead and j must say its wonderful it blew my mind. The glitters stuck to it very well and wasn't getting all messy. It's a must buy

So I don't use this as my regular eye primer, and I wouldn't recommend anyone do that. However, I do like this a lot for loose shadows and glitter. I found that it wore well throughout the day, but I did have some creasing on one of my eyes. Using a quality eyeshadow primer underneath helps with that, though, and the less shadow I put on, the less it creases. You have to work kind of quickly when you use this, because it dries down fast, and it's best to work with glitter primers when your base is sticky. Otherwise, you'll probably have a lot of fallout to deal with, and if you've already done your base it's the biggest pain to clean up dark glittery powder from under your eyes.I'm not sure if this product is comparable to Fyrinnae's Pixie Epoxy, but I used the e.l.f. Glitter Primer with one of Fyrinnae's loose shadows (Wicked). Granted, I used the shadow wet with setting spray, which always helps bring out duochromes, but the shadow was really vibrant. I definitely think it stuck to the glitter primer better than loose shadows do with my normal primer, and I had a lot less fallout using the sticky base as well. I'd recommend this for people who work with loose shadows, glitter, and very shimmery shadows, but not any one else. One of e.l.f.'s hits for sure, though.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: it didn't hold very well for an all day wear it could have been the glitter that sucked. For the price tho this thing is bomb ..
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Fav for real, it didn't hold very well for an all day wear it could have been the glitter that sucked. For the price tho this thing is bomb a little goes so far!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Love to use glitter on eyes? Stock up on this STAT!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I LOVE to use loose glitter on my eyes all the time; when a beauty store stopped carrying a special glitter glue I was really disappointed. The makeup line "Too Faced" carries what they claim is a glitter glue, but really it's just another regular eyeshadow primer. THIS, however, is the real deal. I can't say enough about it!! The glitter stuck and stayed *perfectly* to my eyelid without any problem!! I admit, at first I was worried that it was just going to be like the Too Faced glitter "glue", but I was happily proven wrong! Suffice to say, I'll be buying this every month!! May it be available until the year 3000---I'll try to be around to order it!  ;D  :D  :D Love, love, LOVE IT!!!!
It kept the glitter right where I wanted it without making my eyelid feel stiff or sticky. Easy to use and dries clear.
Holds very good.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: ... but I have OILY OILY OILY eye lids and love me some indie makeup
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Maybe I need some advice here but I have OILY OILY OILY eye lids and love me some indie makeup. With lots of indies you need a glitter primer so you can get all those sparklie goodies to stay on your face. I've used this with a regular primer and without but no matter what I do the darn stuff creases like a mother. I'm also not incredibly impressed with the amount of glitter this will hold on to. It's tacky and it does grab some sparkle but not nearly enough.Also, get this in a store where it'll cost you $1-2. (Target and Wal-mart both sell these in So Cal)

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: and just like everyone else already said
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: i reviewed this item, and just like everyone else already said..:ill say it again:THIS PRODUCT IS GREAT!!! i was too one of those people that was at first sceptical to buy this product becuase it was "e.l.f." brand, a lowerend brand or non-expensive brand. however, i had heard great things about the brand and this product in particular. i saw this item posted for a high price though, at around $12+(not including shipping). i was surprised, so i decided to buy it at the drug store myself, expecting a lower price there. however, i could not find the product anywhere at any drug store, so i decided to wait. finally i found this product at a lower price i think around &4-5. i had read that this item should not be more than $2-5. so i was not going to pay more than that knowing that it is a lower end brand. i have not tried this"glitter primer/glue" in other more expensive brands, but i am going to do so , in order to compare prices, and see if my primer works just as good. i am sure that i will soon see that it is just as good as the "sephora" or "too-faced" brand. i thought the product went on smoothly, and did a great job of holding the glitter or the eye shadow on. i forgot to wash this off, along with other eye makeup, and it stayed on all night. i assume that means it will stay on very well all day and all night (literally). it was not sticky or glue like, and i never felt like i was pulling my eyelids off. however, it did seem a little dry or stuck in one spot the next day because i had worn it overnight and fell asleep, probably not a good idea..Anyways YES THIS PRODUCT IS AMAZING AND YOU CANNOT BEAT THE PRICE!!!I AM VERY HAPPY

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Works Great At An Affordable Price
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was recently given several MAC eye shadow pallets for Mother's Day. I couldn't use it because of constant smearing and coming off even when using my favorite MAC primer. So I read reviews for this product and decided to give it a try. It is exactly what I needed. I put it on and then applied the eye shadow--instant success, fallout problem gone, and beautiful pigmentation. I didn't even need much product for the results. If you're considering trying this with a glitter shadow-just do it. You will be happy you did. Also, in the review section of this product you have to answer how many times a day do you need to reapply. You DO NOT need to reapply but there was not an option for none.

Lemme just say one word.. amazing! Seriously been looking for the perfect glitter primer I even tried the benefit one for 20$ n that didnt work as well as this one.. one thing I will tip especially for those who wrote a bad review or just wrote "meh", use a small flat dense brush when applying glitter that way you will have a more compact look;) when taking off it could b hard so use eye makeup remover not just water:) my go to now especially during the holidays!Source: certified makeup artist and youtube guru

I had hopped for a little shimmer with thisbut unfortunately this is just normal looking primer. However that being said this is one of the best working primers I have used. I've tried Clinique, NYC and my regular liquid foundation. None of them work nearly as well as E.L.F. It goes on a little white so you can see where you put it but it dries clear. It is also very creamy without being sticky. Speaking my eyeshadow last all day when using this whereas before it was gone within 4-5 hours. (Yes I'm using the same eyeshadow.) It also helps my lower quality shadows (Wet n' Wild) from flaking off. Over all though I do think this is a great product and I would buy this,again.

Really does the job! Glitter sticks really well, although as a few people have mentioned, you should probably apply primer and glitter to one eye, then the other. What I've noticed is that it works SO well that you kind of have to be careful how much glitter you apply! The first time I used it I applied WAAAY too much glitter, and my whole eyelid looked completely covered in glitter. If that's the look you're going for, you can definitely achieve it with this! I, however, was not, so now I'm sure to apply the glitter with a makeup sponge or something, and with just a very very light coating of glitter.Overall, great product!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: A non-irritating product that keeps shadow in place and is reasonably priced
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is a good primer for the price - I've tried everything from really cheap to really expensive brands and there isn't a *whole* lot of difference when it comes to primers.  Really cheap primers can irritate your eyes and show creasing... this product did not do that.  If you're looking to keep shadow on all day but get a primer that doesn't break the bank, this primer is for you!

So many people sang the praises of this primer, but I've used both this and eyelash glue to hold cosmetic glitter "highlighter" on my cheeks. Eyelash glue did the job far better, held up to dancing, sweat, and heat. This one... sorta kept some glitter on. I guess if you want an easy-wash, gentle eye glitter primer, this might do it, but eyelash glue killed it in long-wear (or even short sticking) arena. If you're putting glitter on your face, you can do better.

This works so fantastically.  Minimal glitter fallout and also works great for packing on pigment heavy eyeshadow looks.  Easy to remove and comfortable to wear; no sticky feeling.  And the price point can't be beat.  I used to use the Too Faced glitter glue and this is 1/10 the price and works better.

This is great for products that have a lot of glitteror the possibility of fallout - if you want your glittery eyeshadow to pop, you NEED this. All it takes is the tiniest amount and your lids will shimmer the whole night. It is quite a lot, and rather inexpensive for how much you will use. What I do is apply eyeshadow normally, then place a bit of the Glitter primer in the center of my eye (or where I want the most shine to be). I wait about 45 seconds for it to get tacky, then take a brush and pat the eyeshadow on again, directly where you want the most attention.It works like a charm!

I put this on then I apply the glitter.  This glitter stays on all night.  I use an oil to remove it.  I remove the glitter first, then remove the rest of my make up with my make-up remover. I some times use the remove to get the last traces of glitter.

First time I have ever used makeup glue and I think I hit a home run with this one! I have to apply only once, add my glitter on top and forget about it. It does not flake nor smudge and the glitter does not fall off at all during use. Quick dry time and does not transfer all over the place for people like me with semi-hooded eye lids.

This has been a total game changer for my makeup. I could never figure out how to get my loose pigments to stay until recently I saw someone say glitter primer. And oh my goodness. My eyeshadow looks totally amazing when I use this with the pigments. I'll have to continue to buy this. Definitely recommend.

I will say there is a trick to the primer, you must apply a thin layer and while it's still wet, apply the shadow/glitter, by dabbing it on the primer. There isn't much ability to blend with this primer, but that's OK, I'll use my normal primer to blend and add this primer for glitter accents. :)

It washed off easily when I wanted to take it off. Another keeper from ELF.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Glitter Primer is Okay, but Better Options are Probably Available.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I'm new to using a glitter primer and loose glitter for make up.  This is the first glitter primer I've tried and I don't think it is exactly as I expected.  While it dries nicely, the lack of tackiness and the quick drying effects the application of the glitter.  Granted, I need a little practice, but in order to get the proper use, I use only a very small amount (definitely on only one eye at a time for example) and then apply the glitter and then move the next area I want glitter.  If I put it on say, both sides of my face, by the time I get the glitter applied to one side, the other side is dry and needs re-application.  Its a learning process, but I think there are likely better products out there for this purpose and I'll be trying those.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great buy for only a few dollars
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was looking for a primer specifically for glitter and did not want to spend 20+ dollars at sephora. I thought I would try this out as it retails for 2 dollars.  Glue is definitely the right word here, it has a very similar consistency to Elmer's Glue.  I find, for glitter as well as loose pigment shadows, this works better than the regular primers.  Here's why: this stuff remains tacky until you place another product on top.  That being said, there is still a little fall out with big-glitter shadows.  This, so far, is the best I've found for glitter primer, so I really would recommend it.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: The opposite of what a primer should be..
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Growing up Korean, I became accustomed to being someone with hooded lids, or 'double eyelids', it's quite common for me to always be searching for a new primer to use on my eyelids. That being said, I wasn't crazy about this product. It's far less creamy, and much more slippery than I had expected. It's almost the opposite of what a primer should be..however, I do realize that everybody has different skin, and this review only represents my personal experience. For me, it is almost like an oil-based primer, very watery and light. It hasn't done the job I needed from a primer, so I will not be buying this again in the future.

For my oily lids, this Elf Glitter Primer absolutely sucked. I had high hopes since it would be marvelous to find a great eye primer for under $5, but sometimes you do in fact get what you pay for. I love a lot of other Elf products, but this glitter primer was a total disappointment when compared to the UD eye primer I normally use. This stuff did look like glue but it was surprisingly thin.  I was able to apply my shadows no problem and everything seemed fine and dandy, but then when I looked in the mirror almost 4 hours later I was shocked to see that everything had slid into my creases and was an oily, ugly mess (this NEVER happens with my more expensive primer). This worked the same as not using an eye primer at all! Overall, this is one product I would never purchase again.

sub category rank: 1 in Beauty & Personal Care > Makeup > Eyes > Eyeshadow Bases & Primers

Product_Name: E.l.f. Glitter Primer

Category: Beauty & Personal Care › Makeup › Eyes › Eyeshadow Bases & Primers
Description: Milani Eyeshadow Primer, Nude, 0.30 Fluid Ounce

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I would consider myself a makeup artist and a drag queen. My looks consist of very bright and bold colors on the eyes and long-time wear. I actually prefer this product over the urban decay eyeshadow primer, for a few reasons.1. The product does not have an applicator, like the UD primer, it can be squeezed right onto a makeup brush. The use of the applicator causes streaks and use of more product.2. Fuller coverage for less product.3.  Better price.It grabs the eyeshadow true to color all day, cooperates with my brushes and allows for a seamless look. If your eyeshadow palettes aren't the best, it will still make medium quality eyeshadows look great. (I've never tried it on low quality eyeshadow). I find that it works better unset with powder. If you prefer to set your eyes with powder you may want to consider UD. I find that an unset eye makes for better blending and less patchiness. Good product, good price, not much needed per eye. Drag queen approved!!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: the color payoff for the eyeshadow is better, and it stays on all day but also ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I bought this hoping it would a lower priced alternative to Urban Decay Primer. This stuff works just as well as higher priced products, the color payoff for the eyeshadow is better, and it stays on all day but also is easy to remove.

Let me tell you what primer can do for you. Seriously.The first picture is right after the application of the primer and my eye makeup. The eyeshadow I used was $5-- NOT high quality stuff, but lovely colors. (Check out Technic brand Brights-- it's better than you'd think for the price, especially with primer!)Anyways, the second photo is 8 hours later and the third is over 13 hours from the first photo. I didn't notice creasing until I took that pic, and it's not even noticeable until I'm nearly touching my nose to a mirror.I'm going to go to sleep with it on just for fun to see what I wake up with in the morning.Tip for applying: don't do anything fancy! Just put a dab on your finger and cover your whole eyelid up to the brow. Let it dry for a sec. You shouldn't be able to see it, and it should feel very light.

I wanted to love this product, but it was too greasy on my lid and wasn't happy with the role it's supposed to play (and I ensured to mix it up, and knead it a bit - just in case it had separated). I'm not sure if it was an old primer tube, but I would not recommend this product. 40YO eyes, and I need a solid primer. I need something that preps the surface, and perhaps it's my skin type. Not sure how there's so many raving reviews for this product.

Finally a budget friendly primer that actually WORKS!! I have tried others and was very disappointed and kept going back to UD, which is more expensive but is worth it since it works so well. I saw this reviewed somewhere and decided to take the chance one more time, and I'm glad I did. This works just as well as UD but at a fraction of the price. I will definitely continue to use this and recommend others try it as well.

I will never again buy super expensive products like UD for this use.  This is amazing and makes my eye shadow stay on all day without a crease.  The only problem I have had is the tube itself has begun to liquefy at the bottom.  Sometimes when I squeeze out my tiny drop of formula, some clear liquid (separation of product) came out.  It hasn't negatively affected how the product works, so I'm not too bothered by it.

Sorry to say this product did not work for me. It goes on gunky. No matter how thinly I apply it dries up and flakes off. I looked in the mirror while shopping and I was appalled. It looked like I had a disease of the skin around my eyes. It was so crusty I couldn't get it off without warm water in the ladies room.The worst part of this experience is that my eyes watered and my nose ran all day. All that stopped as soon as I washed it off. I don't usually complain about a product but I felt I needed to let others know how it didn't work out for me. The good thing is that I have no damage or symptoms to my eyes or eye areas afterwards.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great primer in general and great for older eyes!! Affordable, too!!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: One of my eyes produces more oil than the other one and this primer keeps liner and shadow on all day. I do go over everything (bottom lash line and upper lash line with a very small brush using E.L.F. High Definition Undereye Setting Powder or Mary Kay Translucent Setting Powder. I'm thrilled with how the shadow goes on and holds the color. Even when I had to go to the ER recently, I did not wash my makeup off until the next day. My brow powder, eye shadow, and liner were still holding. My brow powder stays on beautifully as well. I will repurchase this primer. It's wonderful for older eyes. I'm 61 and wanted something that wouldn't crease.I also didn't want to have bottom eyeliner migrate and smear. This fits the bill. I watched the review of it on YouTube by "Hot and Flashy." She was right and the price is so much better than other primers.

Great inexpensive primer for fair skinned women.  Am fair, but this primer is fairer than my tone. So I only use along lash line for my liner, as I have oily lids which need primer.  Careful not to apply too much or it will cake.  Less is more, dot on & spread!  Be sure to let dry with lid closed before applying colors on.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Preferred over high end eye primers
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This eye primer is great. It helped me blen my makeup smoothly and covered my blue veined lids. I won't be buying high end primer while this is in stock for sure. Save your money ladies and buy this!!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Amazing product, especially for the price
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Amazing product, especially for the price!!!! Before this, my eyelid was a greasy mess and all my eyeshadows would get stuck in my crease. Now I prime my eyelids with this product, and then top it with some translucent powder. My eyeshadows last all day, even if I've been sweating at work. Amazing!!

Can't recommend this product. It is very thin and therefore it's hard to get a good coating of it on the eyelid. It doesn't dry down well. I didn't notice increased eyeshadow wear time when using this product. Probably not going to finish the tube.

I was nervous about this primer as it is considerably less expensive than my previous primer. I'm sold! This worked great! It dries a little thick, so make sure to apply it lightly. But the function is terrific. I'll be buying this again and again.

I recieved my package quickly (two days) but I was very disappointed when I opened the box and noticed that the package the primer was in was open. Otherwise I would of given it 5 stars .  I dont feel safe using it knowing this . But I will probably use it anyway because I don't want to go through the hassle of returning it . Other than that I bought this product because of all the positive reviews
