Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Happy I gave it a shot (Urban Decay Primer Potion loyal for years)
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I am really happy with the performance of this product!!!!  I usually buy Urban Decay Primer Potion ($24 for 0.33 oz).  I was on a 30 day "no-buy" when my eye shadow primer ran out!  I tried going without primer and my eye shadow was creasing- of course!  I needed to replace my empty primer but I was also trying to save money.  I decided to give this a shot.  So glad I did!  My eye shadow easily lasts through my 12 hour shift.  Works as good as Urban Decay for a fraction of the price.  The application is slightly different.  Other than that I am very happy with it and I don't really see the need to go back to Urban Decay.  I used it to do my friends makeup the other night and she was surprised saying her eye shadow and eyeliner never last long.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: New HOLY GRAIL eye primer! Best deal on the market!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have recently purchased the Lorac eye primer, and really liked it, enough that I started to run low, and panicked a bit! I remember hearing a YouTuber that I trust named Emily Noel recommend this primer, even referring to it as her "Holy Grail!" I know that she had the chance to try so many that at this price, I had to try it! I am so incredibly glad I did. I love this eyeshadow primer MORE than the Lorac! Lorac is about 3 times the price, so I am still in shock. I used both on my arm side by side with one of my lower quality eyeshadows and swiped swatches on the bare skin, Lorac primer, and this one, and the Milani was the obvious winner. On days that I used the Milani I noticed that not only was the color of my shadows more intense, but it lasted ALL day and then some, you have to use a makeup remover to even get it to budge. So far, it has worked flawlessly with all of the shadows I have tried it with on a large range of qualities and price points. I cannot stress enough that you should give this a shot, I almost promise that it will save you a ton of money in the future. I will not be using another brand unless I a sent a sample or something, and it somehow beats this one out! AMAZING buy and an official must have for me!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I purchased this after reading good reviews on Reddit
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I purchased this after reading good reviews on Reddit. This primer is supposed to be on par with Urban Decay and other more expensive brands. Having never tried UB, I can say that this primer will be the reason I never have to. I think it works great, goes on like nude-clear, and stays on all day. It keeps my eye shadow in place and I love how it brings out the pigment. I would def recommend and purchase again.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I love how it goes on so smoothly and it really ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I purchased this to help keep my eyeshadow from creasing during the day. I love how it goes on so smoothly and it really makes the colors in my shadows more vibrant. It also keeps my shadow from disappearing by the end of the day. I still see a little creasing, but only after wearing makeup from morning to night. The texture is creamy, light and blends easily. Overall, I'm pleased.

I'm not one to spend a ton on make up but I do enjoy it. I don't have high end eyeshadows but enjoy cheaper (yet good quality) ones like the revealed 2 coastal scents palette. Since using this primer, the application of the eyeshadows has improved exponentially. The colors are more vibrant, they "stick" to the primer perfectly, it helps to keep my shadow in place (no colors blending into one hot mess) and it prevents creasing. I wear make up for most of the day (7am-7pm) and this makes my eyeshadows look fawless from the moment I leave the house until I'm ready to take my make up off.

Overall this is a very good primer...a great alternative to any high end eyeshadow primers. If you have eye lids that get extra oily, this will work out great for you, but if you tend to have dryer skin, this may dry out your eyelids a bit more. Its a great quality eye primer, in that it makes it easy for eyeshadows to adhere to the skin as well as blend well into the skin without causing any blotchiness. The best thing about this product is 1) a little goes a long way, and 2) this product will last you a VERY long time, even if you use it every day (which is what I do). I definitely recommend this product to others.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Better than UDPP, TFSI, or WnW eye primer!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have used a variety of eye primers in the past 8 years or so, and I have to say, I think the Milani eye primer is very likely to be my favorite, not just among the cheaper options but also against high end stuff too.  In the past the two I used most were the Urban Decay Primer Potion and the Too Faced Shadow Insurance.  I started with UDPP but eventually moved over to using TFSI as I liked the texture of TFSI more.  UDPP always felt a bit more oily and liquidy compared to TFSI.  The problem I ended up having with TFSI is that after a while it separates, and then it turns into greasy mess too.Later I started using the Wet n Wild eye primer, which I really liked for a long time.  I pretty much liked the WnW as much as I liked TFSI, maybe a little more since it's cheaper.  However I noticed the WnW primer had kind of opposite problem of both UDPP and TFSI - whereas UDPP and TFSI are both more liquidy and oily (esp after TFSI separates), I find the WnW to be rather dry.I stopped wearing makeup for a couple of years, then recently I picked up a couple tubes of UDPP when it was on sale during black friday, thinking it's gotten much cheaper and surely UDPP is good.  Except I realized that it REALLY is much liquidier and greasier than I prefer.  Because of the liquidy texture, it seems to take much longer to pat it onto my lid, and the greasiness/liquidiness ends up not playing nice with the foundation around my eye area.  I tried to not put any fdnt on my eyelid, but it still was creating patchiness when I tried to blend it out at the edge of where the fdnt would meet the primer.  I noticed that the WnW primer was doing the same thing (though not as obvious).  At this point I don't have a tube of regular TFSI, just a sample of TFSI champaigne - and that was also doing the same thing.I picked the Milani eye primer up on a whim due to emilynoel83's youtube vids.  The texture is absolutely perfect - it's not liquidy/greasy like the UDPP, but it's not nearly as dry as WnW either.  Only time will tell if it separates or changes texture though, but even comparing brand new tubes of UDPP, WnW, and this together, this still have the best texture.  It also blends onto my eyelid super easily with zero patchiness where it meets foundation.  I also find that it doesn't disturb my concealer under my eyes either, and in general it somehow melds into my eyelid with minimum amount of need to pat/blend.  Both UDPP and WnW takes much longer.  I also find that I can simply pat it to blend, whereas both UDPP and WnW i had to tug/swipe (which then can cause more patchiness against fdnt and concealer).In terms of performance, it works as well as the other two.  I have oily skin but monolid so there's no crease to worry about.  Most primers work well on me, so just like with UDPP, WnW, and TFSI, this kept my eyeshadows on with no fading or melting, and vibrant all day.  I have yet to experience any oily pooling at the corner of my eyes from liner either (which used to happen back in the days, but it could've been because of the liner and not primer issues).For the price I paid, which is even cheaper than when UDPP went on sale, this is an excellent product.  I currently have a full new-ish tube of UDPP, an old sample of TFSI Champaigne, and a new-ish tube of WnW, and I still only wanna use this.  I also have a back up tube of UDPP that i literally do not know what to do with now.  Remind self to never buy backups, no matter how discounted, because I might find stuff I like better!  I believe the WnW primer is cheaper than this retail price (although with amazon S&S the price difference was only in cents level), but since the WnW is so much drier, I definitely still prefer this.  I'd rather shell over a couple of extra dollars and not run into my eyeprimer screwing with my foundation.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great bang for your buck primer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I like this primer. I have been a makeup snob for years and honestly haven't tried a lot of non-brand named primers but I found myself not wanting to pay $20 for my go to Urban Decay Primer Potion. I looked at a lot of different drugstore primers and found this one has the best reviews so I decided to give it a try. I was impressed. The product is a bit thinner and more oily than UD but still gets the job done. I also do notice more breakdown at the end of the day than compared to UD but again, not enough for me to be dissatisfied. For the price, I am pleased and will likely continue using this primer for daily use.

I'm not sure if I just got a bad one, but this primer is one of the worst I've tried. It came out of the tube poorly mixed, and even when shaken or mixed, it applied clumpy and nowhere close to smooth. It was just nowhere close to what I expected.On the bright side, shadows won't budge once applied over it. They may not look their best, but boy do they have staying power. I had a harder time blending over it, but with a bit of elbow grease, it came together. Didn't budge one bit and took a bit more makeup remover to take off than I do with other primers. So if staying power's what you want, this surprisingly worked well for that, despite my annoyance with its other qualities.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Going to say: I'm not a fan. Did ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Going to say:  I'm not a fan. Did the product work? Kinda. But kinda not.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great primer for a great price- better than more expensive brands out there!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This eyeshadow primer is actually a "caucasian" shade of nude, not white or clear like I expected. It does not have a color once it's rubbed in. You don't need a lot- it goes a long way. I have used more expensive primers in the past but this one is just as good as others I have tried (like Too Faced or Urban Decay). I love it. It's also a great price!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I'll pay for a good primer because it makes even the cheapest eyeshadow look ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I mine as well have just used my concealer. I typically use Urban Decay Eyeshadow primer potion and tried this one out because of the reviews. I'll pay for a good primer because it makes even the cheapest eyeshadow look great and last all day. This is not worth the savings in my opinion. It remained moist on the eye lid, and it made blending the eyeshadow look bad. I will say it did intensify the eyeshadow color as it claims to do, but if the eyeshadow won't blend nicely once it's applied what's the point?

This primer provides a vibrant, CREASELESS look! I apparently have oily eyelids, and have suffered from years of unsightly eye shadow creasing. I've tried so many primers, make sure to use powder, the whole shebang, and nothing has ever done the trick. Well, here I am in middle-of-summer Texas (i.e., oily AF) and my eye shadow looks just as it did this morning when I put it on. And the best part is the price!! So long $20 tubes of primer!A couple notes:- Although the primer looks to be a color, I find that it goes on pretty colorless, so you shouldn't have to worry much about skin matching.- You should let it dry for at about 30 seconds before applying any eye shadow onto it. Once it dries, you won't feel it there at all.- The primer is not sticky at all, so there is no issue with blending eye shadow colors.I would highly recommend this primer to anyone who asks.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Wow! This stuff really works! I typically have ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Wow! This stuff really works! I typically have very oily eyelids, and I had stopped wearing eyeshadow because of it. This primer has me thinking I can wear eyeshadow again! Will totally buy again!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Inexpensive but great product. Arrived quickly.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Arrived SUPER fast, love the product. Its thick enough to not waste too much product when you squeeze it, thin enough to go on smoothly. Feels like velvet, makes my eye lids feel buttery smooth. I haven't used it with high pigment eye shadow yet, so cant tell if it intensifies it like it says it does, but it does keep my regular shadow on all day, no creases. Will buy it again once it runs out, which should be a long time, a little seems to go a long way.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Works ok, but I have oily eyelids
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Easy to apply.  It looks darker than I expected coming out of the tube, but doesn't appear so on lids. This is now my favourite eyelid primer. It's a light nude colour that blends into a sheer finish on the lids and gives a smooth, non-sticky surface for shadows to adhere to. Unlike some primers I've tried, shadows still blend well over this even without powdering beforehand. An excellent product and so much cheaper than popular mid/high-end primers.

Fantastic! I have oily eyelids and the elf brand primer did not work at all. My eye makeup melted and eye liner basically disappeared. This Milano primer works great. Makeup stays in place all day with no creasing and keeps my oily eyelids "dry".  Makeup goes on smoothly too. Can also use just the primer without putting on eyeshadow and just use eyeliner. For the price it's fantastic!!

This is a VERY nice product, I love Milani even though I am sooooo pale.  I've been spending $25 on Laura Mercier's Linen color eyeshadow and using it as a primer base-but am so tired of spending so much!  So I tried this one.  It is SO PERFECT except for it is just a teeny bit too light tan for me-I need almost an off white.  Don't get me wrong, for the majority of people this would be light enough to provide a great base color, but  not if you're a pale, pale redhead :)

I love Milani products but this didn't cut it for me unfortunately. For the price, quality, and amount of product you get the nyx one works better and gives you more for your money. It keeps the eye shadow on but not as well as my go to NYX one does. It has a weird consistency, but it is easy to apply. I was disappointed with the amount of product you get...Blend quickly because it does dry somewhat quickly. It does it's job but I have had better eye shadow primers and will not be purchasing again.

This primer is perfect! Right out of the squeeze-tube, the color is a lightly-tanned beige, but rubs down to perfectly match my skin tone at more of a  porcelain hue. It is NOT a sticky base, but holds eye shadow in place very well. At the end of the day, I have zero transference from my lid onto the area directly above it. It can also take a minor amount of rubbing without transference to your finger or smudging.

I've only ever tried one other eyeshadow primer from hard candy, it didn't do anything and smelt like petroleum, I wasn't expecting much, but this one actually prevented creasing even when I put glitter on my eyes, it lasted through a wedding in 90 degree heat, all the hard work I did on my eyes lasted all night, quality product, despite its size

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Compared to my Mary Kay primer this works just as great. Only down side would be how small of ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: When I received my package it was much smaller then I thought it would be. On the plus side a very small amount does go a long way. Compared to my Mary Kay primer this works just as great. Only down side would be how small of an amount you are getting.

This is absolutely the  best eye shadow primer I have ever used.  I was extremely disappointed when the retailer I purchased if from stopped carrying it.  Forever grateful that I found it on Amazon.  It does not irritate my skin. I have sensitive skin.  It reduces  the amount of eyeshadow that needs to be used and helps the eye shadow last all day from work to going out.  Well worth the inexpensive price.

Love this primer. It spreads so easy and is so creamy. Read the directions on how to apply. It is important to wait the time it says on the back for it to dry before applying eyeshadow. You will get better results this way.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It works ok but not the best
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I wanted to love this but I just don't *love* it. It works fine, and it's... fine. It's just annoying to blend out because the formula is very dry and powdery, so sometimes it leaves weird powdery streaks on my lids if I'm not suuuuper careful. Honesty I probably won't buy it again.

Made my eye-shadow last all day long. My shadow normally sweats or oils off within an hour.  It totally lasted with this product.And it was not drying at all.And... Milani is a cruelty-free company. (No, I am not affiliated with them) in any way

This is the second one that I go through. I absolutely LOVE this product. It is as good or better than high end. I love how it's a nude color because it makes the eye area one even color. Which is great. Eyeshadow does not move, crease, or build up all day and night. I had a friend so said she didn't use eyeshadow primer because they didn't work. Let her try mine and after a whole day of business conferences it stayed and then she showered with it on and it her eyeliner and mascara came off but eyeshadow was still there. Amazing product. Buy it.
it's a nice eye primer, helps keep the shade on.

I went and bought this spur of the moment with no knowledge of how well it worked or how long it lasted. I've always used urban decay or too faced eye shadow primers...this is seriously good! I can even wear cream glitter pigments without a glitter glue and my shadows/glitter stay put all day and no creasing. Definitely will repurchase

This primer does not intensify or change color, as is says on the package. It holds my eyeshadow for the day really well, but those several colors and shading I did with my eyeshadow always find a way to fade into one color making it look amateur. I think this is fine if you are just doing a cat eye and you need to make sure it doesn't run of AS easily. My defiantly not going to buy it again.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: May be great for others, but NOT for me
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I bought this at my local CVS (where it cost about $7) after seeing several bloggers compare it to Urban Decay (one called it a "perfect dupe").  Now, to be fair, I've never used Urban Decay or any other specifically eye shadow primer, so maybe what it did on me was "normal" -- or maybe eye shadow primers just are not going to work on my 46 year old eyelids.I consider my skin to be pretty "normal" -- a little oily in my T-zone, a little dry on my cheeks, and of course as I've gotten older, I've gotten more laugh and smile lines. I wasn't expecting this or any other makeup to work miracles.I tried it first with my fingertips. It came out thick and wasn't very easy to smear on and as soon as it went on, my lids got dry, the wrinkles/droops (extra eyelid skin) were accentuated. I felt like I looked 10 or even 20 years older.I washed it off and tried applying it with a brush. The application went *much* smoother, but the outcome was still dry, wrinkly, awful looking eyelids. I waited the prescribed 30 seconds and put on my eye makeup anyway (Sugar Pill eye shadow and It eye liner). The shadow was difficult to get on, didn't blend or spread the way it usually does, wasn't noticeably brighter/darker (although Sugar Pill is pretty highly pigmented to begin with, so there was only so far it could go). The shadow caked into all of the creases created by the primer and all of the wrinkles that either hadn't been there before or that I hadn't noticed before (around my lash-line). My eyeliner was harder to apply (instead of gliding on, my skin pulled and tugged and the line wasn't smooth or even). In short: it was a hot mess.I removed my makeup, moisturized like crazy and in about 10 minutes, my lids went back to normal--which for me *is* a few wrinkles and a little droopiness.I'm going to pass the primer down to my daughter to see if she likes it any better than I did. It honestly may just be a matter of this product not being for someone in my age group. As a general rule, I like Milani makeup (love their Bella shadows; they're *almost* as good as Sugar Pill and come in some of my favorite colors.)

I was hesitant on buying this product after the horrible experiences I had in the past with primer and given its cheap price, I wasn't expecting much. I bought it and I got more than my money's worth. This stuff is fantastic! My eye makeup did not budge for the whole day and to really see if it was worth its salt, I went to sleep with my makeup on. It was only slightly smudged when I woke up. I cannot recommend this product enough and if I could, I would give it more than five stars.
Didn't make a difference at all. I bought this in hopes it would help with splotchy eye shadowing but it didn't make the least bit of difference.

I wasn't really fond of this product because it made my eyelids sting when I first applied it. The burning sensation did go away, but I don't think I would purchase again. The product was fairly runny and I don't really think it made much of a difference in the appearance of my eye shadow, it also gunked up my eyeliner brush. Was very meh.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Best Eyeshadow Primer on the market
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Love this stuff. Best, cheapest, and fastest-drying eyeshadow primer around. I have one eye hood that droops lower than the other and rubs off my eyeliner on that eye only, making my makeup look very strange by the end of the day. With this primer, that never happens anymore.
Love this eyeshadow primer and even 12 hours later, my eyeshadow looks amazing and doesn't crease or smudge! Definitely would recommend this this product!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I give this primer an A+
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: . When I use it, my eye makeup stays on all day, no creasing or creeping. A tiny dab (the size of a grain of rice) is enough for both eyes.I'm fair skinned and on me this primer is invisible. It's different from a concealer, yet it creates an even tone on the skin around the eyes.I'd say it's a dupe for Urban Decay Primer Potion.

Love it! Wasn't expecting much because I've always had a problem finding a primer that would work with my oily lids but this stuff works like a dream ! My eye makeup stayed in place all day which never happens! I will definitely be repurchasing this again!
The bottle was smaller than I thought it'd be, but you really only need to use a little bit of product. This primer exceeded my expectations, it's seriously great!
It's ok for the price, the shadow doesn't set as well or for that long.
I love how smooth my shadows go on and last.

I first bought this eye primer a few years ago when I heard emilynoel83 on YouTube rave about it. She was right...the Milani eyeshadow primer is fantastic and is a great price. It reminds me of the Urban Decay eyeshadow primer (another great primer, but a bit more spendy). I would highly recommend this product.

I was so excited to find this product.  I have been using it for some years and it works great as a primer for eye makeup.  It works as well or better than the much pricier products.  The company apparently has discontinued making it, much to my dismay.  So I was happy to be able to stock up.  One tube lasts a long time!
Works exactly as expected!

I have extremely oily eyelids. I've tried many different primers and none of them ever lasted more than 4 hours on me. But this Milani one has never let me down. It intensifies the pigmentation of my eyeshadows and makes them last the entire day. Visit my blog at christinaschiccorner.com to read my more detailed review I posted about it.
Definitely helps my eyeshadow last longer. Tried it out 2 days and no creases at the end of the day!
This works really well. Not too expensive and my eyeshadow stays put and no creasing yay! Also lasts a long time. Will buy again...If I ever run out...
Truly makes the eye shadow colors pop and makeup stays in place ALL day no matter how long your work day is. Very happy with this product!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: the texture can be a bit scary but you just have to keep tapping and blending and within 5-10 seconds you're good. I do recommen
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Currently, I'm testing out this one versus the Nars eyeshadow base. Right when you begin applying this, the texture can be a bit scary but you just have to keep tapping and blending and within 5-10 seconds you're good. I do recommend setting it before applying colors. As for its actual purpose, I've worn this under cream, wet and dry shadows and everything shows up prominately, blends quickly and stays put for 10+ hours. As for the comparison to the Nars base, that one is good of course, but I've actually experienced a lot of difficulty blending while wearing that because it latched on to the eyeshadow. You have to be patient with the texture and allow it to dry but it's well worth the small price.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This is my favorite Milani product

First eyeshadow primer I've tried and I love it! Evens out complexion and works great---just be patient enough to let it set for 20-30 seconds.

Product_Name: Milani Eyeshadow Primer, Nude, 0.30 Fluid Ounce

Category: Beauty & Personal Care › Makeup › Eyes › Eyeshadow Bases & Primers
Description:
** E.L.F. Essential Glitter Primer #21611 NIP ELF Sheer Eye Shadow Eyeshadow Makeup ** 
 
Product Description: Preps your eyelid for smoother, longer-lasting, and crease-proof glitter eyeshadow. The lightweight liquid formula quickly absorbs into the skin for comfortable wear, increases eye color longevity, and creates a lasting bond for stay-put glitter that holds. Infused with Shea Butter and Jojoba to nourish the delicate eye area. Great with loose or pressed glitter eyeshadows. 
 
Use: Apply a thin coat to the eyelid and blend in. Tap on glitter eyeshadow with a finger or a brush while primer is still damp on the eye to lock in glitter.

I'm surprised at how well this product worked.
Excellent and on time without problems

Love this for evenings out.
Works great
Its great.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: My glitter held on ALL day. Through sweat from dancing and all. Had it on from 7am-8 pm and it looked like I had just put it on when I was ready to take it off. Love love love
Don't have to use a lot and not sticky
Works just as well as the NYX glitter glue.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Lasts all day for eye glitter application.
I got it. It's good thanks

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Works wonders for glitter.  When applying eyeshadow it seems to not blend well after using it.  I only recommend this for application of glitter to your eyes.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: ... get this for my glitter makeup and it works perfect it only takes a little it's going to last ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was so excited to get this for my glitter makeup and it works perfect it only takes a little it's going to last a long time thank you Amazon
This works so much better than Vaseline for festivals! It makes the glitter look so much more sparkly and it stays on it's a win win!
I've only used it twice but so far it seems to work alright. Not as sticky as the other ones I've tried but it's okay
It did make a difference making the my eye shadow pop a little bit more..

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Purchased as a gift for someone who was happy with the results
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Purchased as a gift for someone who was happy with the results.  She didn't lose glitter in her eye all night.
Great with keeping the glitter on
Actually really makes the glitter stick! Great product
Very good primer
will buy again

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Worth the money to buy this size, not the smaller tube
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This was a gift for my friend and she loves it! I love that elf products are cruelty free! I was going to get the size smaller than this, I am glad I bought the bigger size because this is still a small amount of product.

I'm so excited to have this. I've had some glitter and shimmer eyeshadows that work fine during the day but if you go out tend not to hold up. This really keeps my makeup on even if I'm dancing or get too warm. Now I like it for all my eyeshadow because it makes the pigment really pop. I love it.
Update: washed the brushes and used only those for this make up... LOVE THEM
Very sticky, felt like I was putting glue on my eyes
