Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Almost a dupe for MAC's Painterly paint pot
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is about as close as you'll get to a dupe of MAC's Painterly paint pot--I'd say the Shany product is just a smidge lighter in color.  (See photo:  Shany on top, followed by Painterly and Camel by MAC.)  Painterly is the lightest color by MAC, so I was pleased to get this lighter color from Shany.  The MAC version will give you much more product for twice the price.  But, the Shany product is a good investment, even though it comes in a tiny package.  A little goes a looooooong way.  You'll need a brush to get the product out, or else you'll get this under your fingernails.  Applies just as easily with a brush as it does with my fingers.  Just like the Mac product, it does NOT crease all day.  After a full day of wearing it, you have to wash it off.  It looks as good at 9pm as it does at 8am.  Good product overall.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It still looked perfect! Doesn't work as well for a lip primer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: My eyeshadow survived a full day, through a doctors appointment, driving around in the heat, and a 2 hour nap. It still looked perfect! Doesn't work as well for a lip primer, but I still am happy with it.

I am very impressed with the staying power of this product! It takes a good rubbing with a makeup wipe to get this stuff off your eyes. It doesn't crease, as far as I have experienced, but I can tell it would if you put too much on at one time. The colour is a good neutral beige-y pink-y colour, and would work on any skin tone, but if you are a darker skin tone than my Oregonian paleness, you may want to make sure you get all of it covered with eyeshadow, otherwise it might look really weird. It makes any eyeshadow a bajillion times more pigmented and brilliant, and it works with any shade of shadow without changing the colour of the final look. This really is a great product. I will mention that the product definitely is a *base* and not just a primer. The product has some colour to it, and is not just a sheer primer.  Not that there's anything wrong with that.The only problems I have with this product is with the packaging and application process. The packaging is tiny, and it makes it really difficult to get a little bit out and use it. If you have longer fingernails and want to apply with your fingertips, you're going to get a bunch under your nails while trying to get it out. Now, the tiny packaging is not a problem when it comes to the amount of product you get. Believe me, this base will last you a good long time, as you don't use very much. The problem is just getting it out.The application process is a little difficult because of the consistency. Now, don't get me wrong, this base is the perfect consistency for applying to your lids and catching your shadow, but it's a little difficult to get it on your lids without smearing it somewhat everywhere. You really do have to have a very very small amounts at a time on your finger, or it's going to get everywhere on your eyes. It does nothing for your lashes except make them clump up a ton, but it's really hard to get this product down to the lash line without getting it on your actual lashes, due to the slipperyness of the cream. However, I wouldn't change the creaminess of this base for anything, I'm just saying it can be difficult, especially for the un-experienced makeup applicators.I would call this base comparable to, if not better than, the Smashbox or Urban Decay primers. The consistency of this product is easier than the SB or UD primers to apply precisely, but you really do have to be careful, as this base is pigmented, not sheer, so you don't want it going anywhere but where you are putting eyeshadow.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Not a great primer for the lips.....
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was so excited to try this product when looking at the reviews. However, I am highly disappointed in it. In the photos it looks like it has a shimmer to the primer. My primer did not and it basically looked like it was foundation in a pot. I purchased this primarily for my lips to give it a primer and hopefully make my lipstick last longer. That it does NOT in any way..... I put this on first at 8:15 am and by 9am the lipstick and this primer were completely gone. Also it does not let your lipstick give its true color off. It makes it lighter because it is such a light foundation color. Would not purchase this again.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Where hasthis been hiding??? BEST lip AND eye primer ever
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Wow.... When I saw how little th he bottle was for the price I was shocked!  But as other reviews state,  a little goes a long way. I bought this primarily as a lip primer cause the E.L.F one didn't have very good reviews and I already have a shadow Primer but I decided to try this for both today and I was blown away! As far as eye Primer... This blows mine away.  It lays such a smooth,  silky base that my eyeshadow had never looked so good and it had amazing staying power... I didn't use my setting spray and my shadow still hasn't budged. It works just as go or as a lip Primer. It doesn't alter the shade of my Lipstick,  plays a nice smooth surface which is great for me because it makes it a ton easier to do a slight ombre lip that I like to do. Also,  my Lipstick hasn't budged yet either. I will be buying this from here on out for BOTH eye and lip.... Amazing product

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I loved the smell of it
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Not a fan. The color was more peachy and the size of this primer is ridiculous. I loved the smell of it. I would recommend nyx primer instead as I trust that brand

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Not what I thought it would be
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: The picture makes this eye base look like it has a metallic sheen to it, kind of like the Be A Bombshell eye base's do. However, this actually looks and feels like a concealer.

First off, I have to say I have been looking for a good not super expensive eye primer and this is it! I love the color (nude) and went on so smoothly! And made my eye shadow pop! And then it stayed on for 10 hours!!!! I have very greasy eye lids and it's hard to find a primer with out spending $40! I usually use paint pot but I hate how expensive it is. I have tried so many and this is by far my favorite! I totally recommend this!!Also this picture is after 10 hours of ware! No crease in my shadow whatsoever!
Didn't like it
Drys fast, blotchy

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Fabulous lip primer for pale skin
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Love this primer for lips, I always use it before applying matte lipstick. It gives you a nice fresh canvas to paint your lips and is great if you want to over draw your lips a bit.

I have to say, I love this primer.  I use it for my eyes and it works wonderfully.  I am no longer a spring chicken but nor am I out to pasture  (idioms, gotta love 'em). I like to look nice when I leave the house.  One of my biggest frustrations was my eye-shadow, it would always crease and look like crap just a few hours out the door.  This I attribute to my aging eyelids (bleh).  I have used numerous eye primers and all have left me wanting.  The Shany primer is the first I have used that actually does what it is supposed to.  It is very creamy and easy to apply, just a dab will cover the entire lid.  Most importantly, the primer does not crease itself before I put on my eye-shadow.  I pat it on my eyelid, smooth it out, and right before I put on my shadow, I smooth it one more time and it stays smooth.  I can apply my eye-shadow by brushing it on vs having to pat the shadow on and then smooth out the shadow,  Again, as my lids are showing the effects of time, I don't need nor do I want a heavy layer of eye-shadow.  I wish to enhance, not be a you-tube wanna-be.  This primer would work wonders for that generation as well.  Once my shadow is in place and looks as I wish, it stays that way until I take it off at night.I highly recommend this primer.  It is a small container but because the amount you use, it should last a long time. Oh, I also use it as a concealer on my lids when I am going for a no make-up look but don't want to scare people with my hereditary dark circles.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: product is thick and you can see every line with ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: product is thick and you can see every line with the product. It cakes the skin and extremely visible when applied. Leaves skin dry and slightly pink

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: A little drying but does the job
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Arrived with a broken cap

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: TERRIBLE LIP PRIMER BUY SOMETHING ELSE FOR LIPS ...DRY CAKEY
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I don't usually write negative reviews but I  feel everyone should know about this product, I was super disappointed when I received this. In the pictures it appears shiny with a moist little golden color  but when I got it I realized it was a light beige and cream but when applied its powdery... I bought this for my lips only and it applies SO DRY its ridiculous how quickly it dries when applied and it does not make my lipstick appear more bold or bright either, seemed lighter because it's such a light beige...I'm gonna post pics....pics are without flash and with flash.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I guess it is waterproof and it is better then no primer but I wouldn't buy it again
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It was way smaller than I expected!it also says that it won't crease and it does. Not what I expected. I guess it is waterproof and it is better then no primer but I wouldn't buy it again.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Good bang for your bucks. Hypoallergenic too!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: First things first, I am the wife of the account holder in case anyone is wondering why this dude is reviewing the primer.I have sensitive skin and have had an allergic reaction in the past from non-hypoallergenic makeup so I'm very cautious when buying them. This primer works great on my eyelids and lips, the eye shadow does not smudge and this is great for a lip primer!The images are not accurate however, the product is matte and not shiny as pictured but it's not a big deal. As long as it is doing its job and hypoallergenic, I am happy.
ok

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Similar formula to Mac paint pot, very decent dupe and I recommend.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Lasts all day, my eye makeup doesn't move. The white base helps color show up better on my brown skin. I recommend it and even compared the ingredients to the Mac paint pots and the Urban Decay primer potion and the consistency is identical. Cosmetology student tip: a little goes a long way with this type of formula. Start using a thin coating at first and then apply more to your liking. Works best applied with a sponge tip brush and patted in with your fingers. Eyeshadow primers last longer when set with a little bit of powder. It gives the eyeshadows more to stick to.

I have unusually oily eyelids so I need to use a primer before I apply eyeshadow or else I will end up looking like a raccoon by the end of the day.  I was using Estee Lauder primer and liked that a lot but it was also expensive.  Shany eye and lip primer is very comparable to Estee Lauder's if not better.  My eyeshadow stays on all day and I have had no irritation from this product.  Highly recommend!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: You won't think you need primer until you use it!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Eye liner and shadow is the only makeup that I wear. But, I have LOTS of it, and wear metallics, bright colors, shimmer, gel liner, pencil liner, loose shadow, pressed shadow, shadow stick, waterproof, non-waterproof, you name it. No matter what the combination, it looks great for the first hour or so, starts to fade noticeably by lunchtime, and by the end of the day the shadow is gone and my eyeliner looks like I'd been crying. I think it's my oily eyelids or something, lol.I recently discovered primer, but was turned off by the liquidy ones that I have to paint on with the wand and let dry. Yuck. So I saw this and figured I'd give it a try. Well, its amazing! It just applies with a brush (and you only need a teensy bit), is dry right away, and everything else goes on as usual. The difference is, the makeup goes on much better (gel liner will stick right to it, instead of smearing around on my oily lids and getting all over when I blink) and once it's on, it's on! *Be careful, its not easy to smudge away liner mistakes with this primer underneath.*The first day I used this primer, I was amazed. When I got home from work, my eyes looked the same as they did when I applied the makeup that morning! I even fell asleep with the makeup on, and the next morning it was still there, pretty much intact. No raccoon eyes! Realistically, a quick swipe under my eyes with a qtip and shadow touch up would have been fine.I'm a believer in primer now. It's not a gimmick. Trust me, try this out. You won't regret it!

I received this as a Christmas gift today from my husband, he said it arrived loose in a package with other gifts. When I went to use it, I noticed what looked like a sticker seal had been peeled off and the lid was cracked/broken. Upon taking off the lid there is a clear as day brush stroke taken out of it, even residue not the side as if they had too much on the brush and wiped it on the side. I rarely use my friends make up let alone using something like this after a stranger. Very disappointing.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This has a light tinted color almost like an under eye concealer as far as the shade ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I apply this across my eyelids as an eyeshadow primer after I have finished my morning routine of cleansing & moisturizing my face. It only takes about 2 minutes to completely dry. This has a light tinted color almost like an under eye concealer as far as the shade match. But it's not overly pigmented. I apply it from my lash line up to my eyebrow line so that my eyeshadow will adhere to it & not fade or crease. I don't have ANY eyeshadow fallout when using this product. As for my lips I use a very tiny amount dabbing it all over my lips so that my lipstick will look more vibrant & the colors do not bleed out of my lip line. The only reason why I gave 4 stars is because it is very small so I'm not sure exactly how long it will last before it runs out. However as I said it only takes a tiny amount to use at a time. I was not given any discount or free product for this review. I'm just a 54yr old woman who enjoys feeling beautiful inside & out & I believe in helping others feel the same.

I expect primers to be white but I was expecting more of a tannish hue to it, as it appears in the photo. That said, this lip primer is incredible. I received this from my wishlist for mainly lip use to keep my stains in place and vibrant. I got exactly what I wanted, but with a few errors!You can use your finger or a brush to apply, though I recommend finger. I can't tell if the brush is  just stained the brown color or if that's primer refusing to budge. The container is tiny so your best bet is to use your pinky finger.A little goes a LONG way. You only need a few dabs, smooth it around, and you've got good coverage. If your lips are too white, you've used too much. If they look like they were dusted in flour, you've got a good mount.Removal wasn't difficult, but it won't come off with 1 simple rub of water. You'll need to do some hard rubbing a bit, not too hard though. Or just use a lip exfoliator.It didn't dry my lips out either, but they weren't exactly moisturized. This seems to sit on the lips and nothing more, so use a balm or chapstick before application. It also doesn't have an odd smell.This kept my lipstains from feathering out.The downside is it didn't moisturize my lips, but it didn't dry it out either. It serves its purpose for your lip make-up but it would have been nice to also tend to the lips.This product also seems choosy about what lip-wear it will accept. A few of my lipstains seemed to sit on top of the primer, instead of being gripped to stay on. I'd say some of them did a better job by being in direct contact with my lips than on the primer.As with most lip cosmetics, this tastes awful so avoid eating it.If you apply too much, which you should try to avoid, it has a tacky feeling and your lips will stick together a little.I've imcluded images of my bare lips, lips with my NYC Everlasting Nude lipstain by itself, then with the lipstain applied with the primer. You can see the amazing difference this primer provides.I was gifted this off of my wishlist by a friend
A must buy! My eyeliner and eye shadow stayed all day until I removed it. Absolutely love it.

I am loving the SHANY makeup. I am in my mid thirties and my daughter is entering her teen years and makeup is becoming more appealing. I have always been a lazy make up wearer. Now that I need to teach my daughterabout makeup I am trying to learn about it. I got this to help with dark eyelids and a scar on my lip. When using it on my lips it does make the lips the same color as my face so I can draw a lip line really anywhere. It does help the lipstick stay in place. It doesn't dry and make my lips feel cakey.  When I apply it to my eyelids it does help to hide the dark. i mean I could go on vacation with the bags under my eyes. Woof... even though this is a primer and not a concealer it does well at both. It works well to help mattify a cream shadow and put on top of undereye concealer to help brighten the under eye area. I have ordered several other SHANY products and they are all top notch quality. They feel good, no harsh chemical smells, and do not irritate my somewhat sensitive skin. I havenot had any breakouts while using the SHANY products. I think I am hooked!

Arrived in a box with other items I order in perfect condition, I am new to Shany Products always heard they are great products and they were right! Product is in a small container the size of a small lip gloss, the lid is black with the words SHANY on top. The bottom of the container is clear so you can see how product is inside/left. Great primer, it's a nice soft pearled pink in color, as well as easy to use. You can use a eye shadow brush, lip brush, or just your finger to apply this to either your eyes or lips. When I applied it to my lip it left no residue feeling and made my lips feel soft, I only applied the primer once ( on lips as well as my eyes ) and the colors stayed all day and through out the night. Couldn't be happier with this product it is a must have for any women!!! I received this item at a discount rate for my 100% honest review. If this review helps you in anyway please do me a small favor and like/thumbs up below. Thanks for reading my review and enjoy your purchase!

Nice mat finish, easy to apply.  I have medium skin tone and this applied evenly full coverage and as expected. I used just your basic small makeup brush to apply to lips and eyes. I also found that this primer works well for hiding dark circles under the eyes as well. product only needs to be applied once before you put on makeup. I have sensitive skin and found that I have had zero irritation with this product. SHANY Eyes and Lip Primer enhances the color of your favorite eye shadows and lip products while preventing creasing. I used this with my Younique Splurge cream shadows and the primer brings out the eyeshadow color very well so happy with the results and how my eyes pop. I love how this makes my eyeshadow stay put and how it brings out the color in my lipsticks to the true color of the tube.I received this item at a discount  in exchange for my honest  review. This had no effect on my opinion of this product, and i would have said the same thing if I had paid full price.

It's a very small jar! The cream in the container looks about 0.5" thick with a 0.75" diameter.. maybe 0.05oz. Tried it on my lips and lipstick didn't stay longer than how it's supposed to like what this product claimed. The eyeshadow smudged and eventually faded. They should change the product info and put the honest truth.

Very small. But a little goes a long way. Nice primer for the lid. I will be honest and say I didn't try my lip.On the eye lid, it never smudged or creased. I have a hooded eye and we hooded eye folk know of those problem wrinkles and creases! Groan!I'm amazed at how bright my shadows appeared! It took them to another level! I'm adding a few photos to show :)I received this item at a discount for my honest and unbiased review.

I love it! It arrived very quickly (2-3 days). I currently use the Urban Decay eyeshadow potion as an eyelid primer, but decided to give this one a try because it's cheap! I couldn't tell a difference from my UD primer and this one! It is unbelievable and it is half the price then the UD. My eyeshadow stayed in place all day. I also used it before applying lipstick and my lipstick did not feather or move even after eating and drinking. I will buy again!

This actually worked better then I expected it to. It goes on nice thick and creamy, not watery at all, this does not irritate my lids at all like a lot of others do and makes my makeup  stay in place and stand out for sure! This goes on like a light cream beige shadow, I actually wore this alone also and it looks good as just a cream shadow! I use a brush to apply it instead of sticking my fingers in the jar and I have no problems. It is a very small jar. I thought it would be bigger but its a nice primer. worth a try for sure if you don't want to buy expensive primers. This works just as good. I received this at a discount in exchange for honest feedback.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: creamy and light primer keeps your shadow on and in place all day!!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: this is a very nice primer for eyes and lips. It goes on nice and smooth and sets quickly and feels powder like after it has set. I like that, that way I know its ready to use. I especially like that its hypo-allergenic, I have very sensitive skin! But so far i have not had any problems with it. I pretty much have only used this for my eye shadow as I am not a huge fan of lipstick. I will put lipstick on only when going somewhere fancy...other than that I use a very light pink type of gloss.Or just an SPF lip balm. But I do need to add that I absolutely LOVE that this primer is water-proof. I have horrible hot flashes and its nice to know that I won't sweat my shadow and brow pencil off! That's always been a huge issue for me while wearing make-up!I had no issue getting the primer out of the tiny pot, I just used one of the brushes that I never use to get it out and then used my ring finger to blend it in. I suppose you could do the same thing with a cotton swab as well. I, too, have long fingernails and I knew that was going to be a mess if i dipped my finger in the pot.At any rate, this is a very nice, quality product. I would certainly buy it again!!

It's pretty creamy texture-wise. I used a brush to have a more even application, but I think that the cream is just too thick. It's the kind of product where a little goes a long way. With that said, I honestly hated it so much I threw it away. It did nothing for me. It really DOES NOT work on the lips as a primer, it actually messed with my lip colors. As an eye primer it wasn't much of a difference. I WOULD NOT recommend this product to anyone.

I had never used anything by this brand before, but I am trying out a number of eye shadow primers to see which ones will help me to keep eye shadows on my face all day. I do have very oily eyelids, so my need for an eye primer is very high. The texture of this is very nice, not crumbly or too powdery. I always set this with a neutral shadow after I apply it. I have been able to wear creme and powder shadows all day without any creasing or fading of color. I have found a few products that have slightly better saying power, but for the money, this one does work very well. Even with my cheapie shadows, this helped to pump up the color a bit and keep them in my lids.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Junk! worst eye primer ever. Cakey and dry.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Worst eye primer ever.  When i applied it to my eyelids it did not want to blend well at all.  The product appeared to leave these little clumps on my lids and did not make my eye shadow look flawless, it made it look very patchy and gross.  Eye shadow appeared cakey and dry looking when using this.  It only looks good when you swatch it on your arm like how some of these good reviews do the side by side comparison but the eye lids have a different texture. Too bad i can't return (i tried).  DO NOT BUY. It's a waste of $8.
I love this product.  It does a great job of anchoring your lipstick to your lips for an extended stay!

This is a great primer at a fantastic price!  I bought this as well as a Mac Paint Pot in Painterly.  I like both equally and this is at a phenomenally better price.  I think I have had this for around 6 months and I'm only half way down the pot.  It is a tiny container but you don't need a lot for a great result.  If pot was bigger it would prob dry out before you could finish it. My eyeshadow lasts all day and I have not experienced creasing or fading when using this primer.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Exactly what i was looking for!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I did Mary Kay for a while and had my own base primer for my eyeshadow. Well I no longer am a rep for MK and my primer ran out. Well, I didn't want to pay the ridiculous extra costs not being a consultant anymore and found SHANY. I absolutely love it! It keeps my eye make up looking fresh or gives me a natural eyelid color when i just want eyeliner on for the day. I definitely recommend this product!!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This works very well to keep everything in place. ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This works very well to keep everything in place. The color looks light, but it blends out well and doesn't affect skintone much.

I love this primer!!  I have been using it with my power eye shadow and it was working great.  Just recently, I tried it with my stick eye shadow.  I rarely use the stick shadow because it wears off so quickly, but when using the Shany Eye Primer, it stayed on all day.  By the end of the day, my eye makeup, shadow and liner, looked like I had just applied it.  I highly recommend this and will continue to use it as long as they make it.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I took a chance and ordered this product and the results are amazing especially on the lips
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Over the years I have tried so many versions of "eye/lip primer"....I took a chance and ordered this product and the results are amazing especially on the lips! Does not change the color of the lipstick or make it dry.  I apply the primer under my  eye makeup and the colors that i have at one point didn't pop now my eye shadow is outstanding in color and makes my eyes POP.  I apply with a slanted makeup up brush over the my eye lids before applying my eye shadow and let it sit for a few minutes before applying my eye shadow.
Creases pretty badly within 15-20 mins and becomes so oily the eyeshadow gets slicked off. What's worse is that they don't accept returns
Love it! Brings out even the naturalist color out more. And it doesn't feel dry.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: ... I expected but the quality of the product is great n will go a long way
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: The primer was a bit smaller than what I expected but the quality of the product is great n will go a long way. I recommend this brand since their eyeshadow pallet was a great product. U will need a small brush or the little sponges that come in the eyeshadows pallets to apply since it's small. Loved it! Eyeshadow primer is a must in ur makeup because it makes a difference n last longer. I recommend it

This is a good primer. I was expecting something like a facial concealer. But this one is only for eyes or lips. It helps prevent your eye makeup from smudging and fading. Also works good on lips for smoother and showing off true color. It is easy to apply by just using your pinky finger before you put on your favorite color. It is enhancing and lasts all day … no need to re-touch. It blends perfectly with my skin tone. I love it for it is long-lasting and waterproof.
it does it's job however it could be a bit creamier for application

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I bought this because of the reviews. I was ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I bought this because of the reviews. I was not impressed. It gives me a fairly average experience. It makes my lip product stay on a little longer, but I still reapplied. And I notice no difference in my eye product. Also the container is so small that I cannot put my finger in without getting the product under my nail.
I really like the feel and color of this product.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: but it blends out fine. Keeps my eye shadow in place all through ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: A little light for ladies with darker skin, but it blends out fine. Keeps my eye shadow in place all through the night and into the next day when I absolutely pass out without washing my face. Make sure to close the cap when you're done with it because one night exposed to the air will turn it into a nearly unusable rock.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I am so happy! Truly waterproof
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I am so happy!Truly waterproof, long lasting!

do not buy. dried out after a few uses. I did like it the time I was 'able' to use. If you do buy this DO NOT leave it open for longer then a few minutes (which I believe was why it dried out) I left it open for about 7 min, not realizing it and after it never was the same and dried out completely.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Pot is too small to be called makeup
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: When is makeup not makeup? When all the customer gets is "jar."The pot is small. No. The word "small" conveys a meaning that is too big. The jar is TEENY, TINY -- ITSY, BITSY. The outside jar is 7/8-inch high and diameter 1-1/8". Inside dimensions (actual product) is only 1/2" high and 3/4" diameter. I don't care how far the product goes. Is Shany selling caviar rather than makeup? The actual product is -- not more than -- two marbles' worth. Egads. Not impressed.The jar is a choking hazard for little children -- it is THAT small.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: it's not great. It is certainly better than nothing
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: As others mentioned: if you have oily eyelids, it's not great. It is certainly better than nothing, that's for sure--it just isn't quite what I'd hoped. My biggest complaint is that it would crease like crazy after a few hours--I'd have a big line of the stuff in the middle of my eyelid.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This is my new favorite make up product by far
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is my new favorite make up product by far. Wish I would have found this sooner. I will be stocking up on this. Its like liquid gold. Easy to apply, completely invisible and keeps your lip stick and eye shower in place all day. Its simply amazing.
The Shany Eye and lip primer//base is nice. It helps keep my eye shadow from clumping and stay on longer. I will definitely buy this again.,

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This actually lasts a super long time and I really like it
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This actually lasts a super long time and I really like it. I was looking for an alternative to the MAC primer which I love but is pricey. This is the perfect substitute. It is smaller than you would expect though. Probably only the size of a quarter in diameter.
It's super thick! I was expecting it to go on more smoothly and lightly. Apply very, very sparingly (also I was hoping it would have a little shimmer to it but sadly it doesn't).

So perfect for an eye shadow base but I wish they made it in more colors. I use it daily and even if my eyes water, the shadow I use over it stays in place.  I have never found a base like this and I've tried them all, at much higher prices. I'll keep buying it, it's the best.

I love this eye primer. I use it almost on daily bases. I love how it makes the eye shadow I have pop. You only need to use a little too. So this small container will last a long time. You can even wear the eye primer by it self. I love that it is a natural color and it blends in very easily.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This primer keeps my eyeshadow in place all day. ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This primer keeps my eyeshadow in place all day. I wear glasses and I use it on the bridge of my nose to keep my them from rubbing my foundation off. I will definitely purchase Shany eye primer again.

Dries very quickly, which means you don't have much time to evenly apply. I accidentally smudged some on the side of my nose and it dried bright orange. Doesn't help my eyeshadow stay noticeably longer. The jar's diameter is similar to one of a nickel. Disappointed.
Great Product!  I already haven't try this in my lips yet, but for my eyeshadows... It makes the color pop, an no crease or fading noticeable after 8 hours wearing!!!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I like this primer very much.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This primer feels and looks more like makeup than primer. On my lips it made them look white and with lipstick on it looked good and did not run or wear off like normal. When used on my eyes my makeup stayed in place without getting all greasy and run and make my eyes burn.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I love the texture and color
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Thank you for my order it arrived in 2 days.  I love the texture and color.  I'll be ordering more in the near future.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It never worked for me. Not for 5 minutes ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It never worked for me. Not for 5 minutes. I didn't even try to put eye shadow with it, this creased up alone within minutes with my greasy eye lids. Urban Decay primer is the only thing that has ever worked for me.
dried up fast, cant even applied it now.

Love it! I thought it was small when I opened it but it doesn't need much at all to work So I expect it will last a long time, and my eyeshadow stays on until bedtime now, wish I'd known about it before!
Preface: I have oily eyelids. It doesn't work with eye pencils to make wings. I can only use it with my liquid liner, but I have a feeling those don't even need primer.
I love this primer. It goes on smooth and stays on. My eyeshadow last all day long when I use this. It also make my eyeshadow true to the color.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: but my eyeshadow stays on mostly nice throughout the day
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: worked just as it should. My eyelids still get kind of oily though, i don't think this product prevented that, but my eyeshadow stays on mostly nice throughout the day.
love this product.  I only have to apply once in the morning. can't say enough about this primer.
Pretty good product, dried out my lips after a few hours if wear, kept lipstick on
Great for using as an eye shadow base! It can even be used as a great nude colored shadow or shimmer lip stain! Love Shany cosmetics!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Tried a lot of products and the works the best
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This will not crease!!! Covers everything. Tried a lot of products and the works the best

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: not at great coverage as expected
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: not at great coverage as expected.  doesn't apply smoothly and works only fair as a primer.  i probably won't be purchasing this again
I'm not very impressed. It is ok, but I don't recommend it.
The container is very small which I didn't expect. I like the texture, but I am not really impresses with the product.
Covers very well especially around eyes.
This is a gem. It works great for both eyes and lips. Love the price.
Great primer! It makes ANY matte lippie less drying! :)

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: ... shifts at work and then some and still looks great.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Eyeshadow stays put past 12 hour shifts at work and then some and still looks great.
I can't believe how well this product works! My eyeshadow stays on all day and looks great!

Description: L’Oral Paris Magic De-Crease Eyelid Primer helps create smoother eyelids, even skin tone, and a flawless canvas for application of powder or cream eye shadow. You can even wear this eye shadow primer alone for a clean, natural look. One universal shade for all skin tones. Fragrance-free. Up to 8 hour wear.  • Prevents creasing • Extends eye shadow wear up to 8HR • Prevents shadow from settling into lines and creases • Ophthalmologist-tested  To improve shadow intensity and wear use the following expert application technique: Step 1: Use wand to apply base to eyelid. Step 2: Using fingertip, blend bade from lash line to brow. Step 3: Allow base to set for a few seconds and then apply shadow.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Simply great product - and so much less expensive than the well known fancy brand name product I had been wearing for years. Consumer_Reviews.review_title: as I'm Indian and have medium brown skin and this definitely sticks out like badly matched concealer (it doesn't matter as much
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is the first time I've used an eye-primer, and it does what it's supposed to - it keeps eye shadows set and lasts most of the day. However I'm not sure about the whole "suits every skintone" pitch, as I'm Indian and have medium brown skin and this definitely sticks out like badly matched concealer (it doesn't matter as much when I anyway use foundation and concealer, but it can make the concealer I apply over it look much lighter). In addition, if you have any loose tags of skin (sometimes my eyelids flake in the winter) this snags terribly and highlights that bit of the skin, instead of the opposite, which I quite disliked.That said, the eyeshadow lasts. I'm not sure if it's for my skin tone though.

This primer works wonderfully, and I have been using it as a regular part of my makeup routine for about 2 years.  Before using the primer, I would apply eye shadow directly to my eyelids.  The color was fine but my eye shadow would crease throughout the day.  With this primer, my eye shadow never creases.  It really gives the eye shadow a nice base to build upon and makes colors brighter.  I haven't used the more expensive eye shadow primers, but I don't know why I would ever switch because this one works great and is less than half the price!

I love this product! I could never keep my eye shadow from creasing without it. A few tips, though......be sure not to skimp and put on too thin of a layer. Also, when you get about halfway thru the bottle and you can't seem to get anymore out, tightly close it and then put it in a sink of hot water for five minutes. Take it out and shake it to the bottom...... All that was on the sides will melt to the bottom. When that doesn't work anymore use a bent  q-tip to get some out. I wish they packaged better, but I found that you just have to be smarter than the bottle!

I really like this primer but now I have to find something that prevents eye shadow from disappearing throughout the day.UPDATE 2 months later: I work in a hot environment with no AC and constantly sweating. I wear this primer almost daily and there is still product in the bottle. No issues at all with make up collecting in my eye lid. Dries fast so I don't have to wait to apply my eye shadow.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Best Primer I Have Ever Used!!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: There are so many different varieties of primer on the market. It feels as if I've tried every single one without success . . . until this one! L'Oreal has done a good job making a primer that goes on smoothly and stays on all day. The color seems to match well with all skin types. Once the primer is on, it is barely seen. Drying time is minimal. My eye shadows have never creased once since using this primer; even after an hour workout outdoors in 85% humidity! The package may be small, but a tube typically lasts me 3-4 months. Sometimes it is difficult to get every last drop of primer out of the tube, but I will take out the little plastic "stopper" and that allows me to move the wand around better to get it all! I recommend this one to all my friends. You won't be sorry if you try this primer.

Believe it or not, I am 22 and in all the years I've worn makeup(about 6 years), I never wore any type of primer with my eyeshadow. I use all different types of eyeshadow and it doesn't always stay on long but I thought that was normal. My friend suggested I purchase a primer. I chose this one for my first time because it's by a Brand I trust and not too expensive. I really like it. I put some on the brush and dab some on my eye and blend it in. I was very impressed by how well it blended to match my skin color. That was a big worry of mine, not matching my skin so I was very happy about that. After that I applied my eyeshadow and it looked great, nice and smooth. It doesn't quite stay all day but it lasts for a pretty good amount of time. I recommend this to someone looking for a good eyeshadow primer without paying a fortune.

A Great Product!  I purchased this first of all because it was only $2.00 at the time, so I thought why not? I'd only lose a few dollars if it didn't work, but it worked great!  I have bought eyelid primers from Sephora, which were well over $25.00, but I found that this one worked much better. It was smoother and the consistency was not heavy at all. Lasts all day, even when I work out and get all sweaty.By the way, I am close to 63 years and I have creases on my lids due to my age, but this works.  I will definitely buy more, but now the price has gone up....but I'm still buying it...

I have used Lime Crime's eyeshadow primer for quite a while, and just found out that is has been discontinued. Through my tears, I searched for an affordable substitute and came across Loreal's primer. I do like the applicator. It's easy to spread on your eyelid, then I blend it in further with my fingertip. The primer evens out the color on your eyelid to give you a good base. Unfortunately, this primer doesn't keep my eyeshadow and liner in place like Lime Crime did. My eye makeup will start to wear off in 4 to 6 hours. I would use it for every day, around the house use, but for going out I will have to find a longer-lasting product.

I ordered this just to try it because I have never used anything like this. I really liked it. It goes on very nicely and if you don't disturb it until it dries, it works perfectly. The first time I tried it, I worked it to much and it sort of became a dry powder mess that flaked off. You have to smooth it on and let it dry before you put on your eye makeup. It works great to put on under your eye before you put on you highlighter too. I would buy this again!

This is the first time I have used a primer so I can't compare it with other products. However, that said, I love this. My eye shadow went on smoothly and stayed on all day with no creasing and nearly no fading.

It's ok but not something I'd use every day because it's kind of gunky. Then again, I'm not much of a make-up maven (generally don't use much) so it may be that I'm just not accustomed to feeling something coating my eyelids like this does. As far as creases - doesn't work. I think this is more to keep powdered shadows in place than it is to cover and smooth crepe-y eyelid skin.

I tried this based on mostly favorable reviews. I didn't want to spend $20 on a high-end brand when many reviewers stated that this product was as good, if not better. I applied per directions and 2 hours later, my eyeshadow had creased into my lids. I wasn't expecting any miracles, but I was hoping for at least 4 hour coverage. The next day I applied this product to one lid but not the other, just to compare. The lid with this product seemed to help my shadow last about 30 minutes longer than normal; I guess that is something, but perhaps not enough to merit a second time purchase. On the good side, it didn't have a strong odor and didn't run into my sensitive eyes.

I have use this product for a few years now and you really need to have a basis like this for your eyelid to put your liner and eyeshadows on . It keeps it from gathering in the crease of your eye it helps to keep your eyeshadow on all day. I never put eye make up on without this decrease on first.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: No Magic Here, Just False Advertising.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This primer was a huge disappointment considering all the positive reviews I read.  It is cheap, and it is better than going without any primer at all, I'll give it that... but I found that it got clumpy after opening and I was scraping at the sides after only a week, which makes me wonder how much is really in there.  I don't like the application brush at all, it just adds to the clumpiness, which means you have to blend a lot with your fingers and it was thick and often left lines on the edges of my eyes if I didn't blend it in fast enough before it dried.  After giving it a solid try, I'm switching back to Milani Eyeshadow Primer, which is only 5 bucks at Walmart.  A little tiny bit of that, applied with your finger, good to go... and it lasts for a few months!  Much better, in my opinion.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: The product seems to be dried out upon receipt so it does not go on smoothly.I am not using it for that reason.

My usual eyelid primer is by Clinique. I've been using it for years.I thought I'd try something less pricey. This product didn't work so well for me. i have very dry skin and even tho I moisturize before I apply primer this product flaked on me. I threw it in the garbage and will go back to my usual stand by.
Hard to blend out and still doesn't help your eyeshadow stay on

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It really holds your eyemake up and there is NO ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It really holds your eyemake up and there is NO CREASE!!!I wish they sold this in ALL stores. it is a rare find. I have medium tan skin and this does NOT look pastey white on my lids.

I purchased this so that my foundation wouldn't crease in my main eye crease and under the eye.  This is perfect for that.  A tiny bit goes a long way.  I don't really wear eyeshadow.  I don't do any powders because they really bother my sinuses and make messes. I love this stuff.
Goes on a little thicker than I had anticipated but it works and you can't beat the price.
Dries quickly so do one eye at a time.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: it's an okay product. I would not buy it again
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Not as great as I expected, but it's not bad. The texture is a bit strange, and it leaves a residue if I don't rub it in all the way. I'm not sure if it makes a big difference in preventing the smudging around my eyelid crease. I guess it's the thought that counts.
too expensive​
It is really dried out and not easily applied. So not worth it.
This primer sucks. Elf eye primer is 10 times better and is only $1
I love this stuff!  It keeps my eyeshadow on even overnight.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: it's fine. does the job ok
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: it's fine.  does the job ok.

Product_Name: L'Oréal Paris Magic De-Crease Eyelid Primer, 0.19 fl. oz.

Category: Beauty & Personal Care › Makeup › Eyes › Eyeshadow Bases & Primers
Description: Preps your eyelid for smoother, longer-lasting and crease-proof eyeshadow. The lightweight liquid formula quickly absorbs into the skin for comfortable wear and increases eye color longevity.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: So this is about as light as it appears and that probably doesn't matter a whole lot for a primer. The better question is how it interacts with the eyeshadow. I've used MAC, Clinique, and Urban Decay eyelid primers. I love my urban decay eyelid primer - it's the perfect shade for me.I found this relatively easy to put on and I was able to use a sponge to rub it in so the color almost didn't matter, it just added a slight lightening of the eye. In terms of primer, this gets the job done. I think the Urban Decay is better at keeping my eyeshadow in place and allowing me to blend the way I want to, but for the price, this works. I added a picture of the raw product and it rubbed in a bit on my arm for reference.One last note, like other reviewers, I thought the bottle felt a bit empty. This didn't last very long - again for the price that could be expected, but you'll be purchasing this frequently if you do your make-up daily.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It didn't look like product was ever even put in it
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: The tube literally came empty. It didn't look like product was ever even put in it. The wand came out with absolutely nothing on it after putting it in and out a couple of times. I blew in the tube and it made a sound like it was obviously filled with nothing........Weirdest thing ever.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I ordered e. l. f Shadow Lock Eyelid ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I ordered e.l.f Shadow Lock Eyelid Primer awhile ago to see what the hubbub about primer is. I have to say I now understand. Not only does it help keep my eye shadow from flaking off my eyes during the day, but it really makes my colors POP and they stay put all day.

This primer is so close to being a perfect 5-star review for me, however I have to point out that there is little to no actual product inside the tube. It works very well for me but does not last as long as I would prefer. It has eliminated creasing and gives my eyeshadow an extra pop. Almost perfect!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I have very oily skin and so I thought it would be perfect. I noticed pretty early that creasing was an ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I purchased this because I was looking for a new eye shadow primer. I have very oily skin and so I thought it would be perfect.I noticed pretty early that creasing was an issue with this primer.I tried it for a couple of days and after 2 hours I already had creasing on my eyelids and that was not good thing because I do wear eyeshadow everyday and I work 10 hour shifts.I would only recommend this product for women that have dry skin.This does not stop the eye shadow from creasing especially for those of us with oily skin. I purchased this b/c I thought it would make my eye shadow stay in place longer but it's like adding nothing at all to my eyelids. My eye shadow creased within about two hours. Don't waste your money.It went on smooth and didn't affect the eyeshadow color (which is what I was looking for at the time of purchase) but unfortunately this product did not work at all.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Pale, Tightening, does as advertised, but has problems
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This primer does a good job of creating a platform for eye makeup that doesn't shift during the day. It has a mild tightening effect, which is good in a way, but also means I feel my eye makeup more, making it more annoying.  The "Sheer" is actually very slightly tinted, giving my eyelids a slightly lighter skin color, which is good to make bright eyeshadow brighter. I do Not like that after the primer is blended into the skin, it colors the high points a very pale skin color, and does not color the low points (so it makes any skin texture more obvious, makes wrinkles look more wrinkly). This is the opposite of an air-brushed look.

This is my first time using a shadow primer so I have nothing to compare it to, but it works fine for me! I use it on top of some light concealer (applied with my finger tip, not the applicator--to avoid getting it too dirty!) and let it dry for a few minutes and then the shadow goes on nicely. Only complaint is that not much product seems to come out on the applicator. Hopefully it doesn't run out too fast!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great product, especially for the price, less fallout issues with eye shadow when using this.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Not bad, especially for the price. Worth a try if your looking for a primer that goes on well and dries quick so you can start adding makeup right after. I've used the Urban Decay Primer Potion in the past and didn't notice any drastic difference in quality between the two, my eye makeup holds together all day for both. Would recommend trying this product if your looking for a new eye primer to try or if it's your first time using eye primer, I'd rather go for a lower priced eye primer and then spend the extra money upping my eye shadow or eye liner products.

I'm VERY impressed with this fellow! I have very oily eyelids and before I used any kind of primer, I could usually make it about 3-4 hours before my eyeshadow was creased and clumpy. I was hoping this could help extend my eyeshadow life at least another hour since it's so cheap, but with this primer I can easily make it 9 hours with no creasing and around the 10 hour mark is when I start to see a little crease forming. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking for an amazing primer!

I rarely wear eye shadow without it anymore. It lasts all day and stood up to me rubbing my eyes with very little eye shadow coming off. I wanted to see the color difference between wetting baked eye shadow and using the primer. The primer will make shimmery eye shadow a little duller but when I went to rub them both off my arm after testing them I had to really scrub with soap and water for the primer and it didn't come off until I used actual make up remover which in that situation was a pain but that hold comes in handy throughout the day . Highly recommend trying it!

I normally like most of the e.l.f. products I buy, but this....this primer actually SUCKS!! I was very surprised at how quickly it wears off! I wear makeup every single day and 90% of the primers I have tried never wear off this quickly! It starts to leave crease marks about an hour to an hour and a half after applying! I never thought I would leave a negative review about one of there products, but this stuff is not good!

i like this primer alot. i have also used NYX Proof It! primer and Urban Decay's potion. honestly I think this one is better than NYX and it is very comparable to the UD. keeps my shadow on all day. it doesnt last into the night but that is to be expected. but i dont have to re-apply the primer, i just add a little more shadow if it fades.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great for pressed eyeshadows, not so much for loose powders.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is a great primer for pressed shadows. I apply it first, wait 2 or so minutes, then add my pressed shadow. At the end of the day, my eye makeup still looks the same as it did when I applied it. I was a tad disappointed that it didn't do the same for loose powder - But honestly my loose powder wasn't having problems disappearing throughout the day like my pressed powders were.It also lightens the area you apply it to, which makes it nice and easy to tell where you've already put it. It was a bit surprising the first time, but it didn't affect my makeup, so it's not a big deal.

Excellent!  This was a little "darker" but really lighter than expected - it gives more of a "white" glow, which is great and allows a more vibrant color to be put on top.  Holds all day and this color the "sheer" color is a daily routine for makeup.  I more frequently use the sheer, but highly recommend both for your makeup stash ;)

This is a great addition to anyone's collection of makeup.Pros;- Goes on smooth and blends in well- It makes my shadow that I put on top of it stand out a lot more.- Smells like non-scented lotion very slight odor.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: great quality for a steal of a price
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It's great, however for some reason I seriously struggle to remove the wand from the tube. I know the protective barrier is there to prevent globs from coming out and from dirt getting in, but holy cats is it a tight fit! I highly recommend to anyone who isn't in a hurry and has the time to wrestle it out. I'm hoping that since it's so new (only had a week as of this review) it is suction from the tube being so full and will eventually loosen up or get easier.The product itself works fantastic, holds my shadow all day, doesn't feel dry or sticky when put on. While it is the color pictured, after it's smoothed on it is clear on any skin tone. I especially like that this primer isn't heavy or thick. With other heavier brands I notice whenever I blink the creases of my eyelids have accumulated a lot of eye shadow, emphasizing the crease. This does not cause that, which is perfect for anyone that blinks.
So cheap and works like a charm! Does not cause your eyeshadow to crease and doesn't melt off your face like most. I always apply mine and add a little powder on top to "set" it.

Not exactly what I expected.  The wand is kind of weird to use on my eyelids so I brush it on my fingertip and apply it that way.  It's creamy and not sure if it really is a primer.  I think it would be better as a shadow.  I thought it would be a cream that turned into a powder or something.  I don't know.  It's just different than what I thought it would be.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I wish it lasted a little longer and had a slightly better applicator, but again for the price I'll buy ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: For the price you really can't beat this primer! I wish it lasted a little longer and had a slightly better applicator, but again for the price I'll buy this forever! It intensifies eye shadow color just as well as the more expensive brands.

As expected for the price. It's not excellent but it's not bad either. I still use foundation underneath, I wouldn't use it alone. It's pretty light colored but it goes on thick. It does its job but keep an eye on it as it dries, it can clump up in the corner of the eye and it can be a little flaky and inconsistent so you might want to reapply in places after it dries, I've just been rubbing it in with my fingers but a sponge applicator might work better to ensure consistency, I wouldn't just apply it with the applicator it comes with and let it dry like that, it'll tend to streak if you don't make sure it's blended well. It didn't cause me any irritation unless it gets clumped up in the outside corner of my eye like I mentioned before so just watch out for that.

I like it, but it is somewhat hard to blend. It blends best if you use your finger,. I dislike using my fingers so I use a sponge but its hard to blend with a sponge. There isn't much product in the tub and it seemed a bit dry. It kept my shadow from creasing and helped it last for about 5-6 hours.

I really love this primer. The white color helps to really see where you've put it and it keeps eye shadow on ALL DAY....even longer with setting spray. I'm incredibly impressed with this primer.- NO creasing- Grips eye shadow and keeps it on all day- Easy to apply

While this product may work for some, it was a nightmare for me!  Clumpy, chunky application that left my eyelids with an odd texture.  Definitely not smooth and ready for shadow application.  ELF has so many great, affordable products that really deliver...sadly, this isn't one of them for me.

I really like using E.L.F products. They are affordable and they actually work much better than the other grocery store brands. This eyelid primer helps keep my eye shadow stay on all day. I have a oily face so most of the time eye shadow doesn't stay on all day and I need to reapply halfway through. This primer keeps me from doing a second application However, I think they changed the formula and it is a little less powdery than before so I have to play around with it because before I didn't need to worry about the amount going on my eyes but now I need to make a thinner layer as the white can show through some of the eye shadows that I like to use.

I am very happy with product. I use it on my entire eyelid as a primer, and sometimes a touch of it in the corner of my eyelids to brighten my eyes. It is worth every penny. It has lasted longer than I thought it would. I will reorder this primer again.
I use Shany high-pigment lose powder eye shadow and this primer really makes the colors pop and look vibrant. It also keeps my eyeshadow looking fresh all day.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Works GREAT but Comes HALF EMPTY
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I bought this compliment my eye shadows. I read other reviews which stated the tubes come half empty..... I CAN confirm that is TRUE! The tube was half empty when I got it brand new, straight out of the package. The overall, quality of this is great. My eye shadow stayed on ALL DAY and NIGHT despite heat and cold! I was impressed! It did not make my makeup any harder to remove. It did go on a little streaky so I blended it in before applying my makeup.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: but I would not recommend using this product as a primer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Primers are supposed to stop makeup from creasing. This product creases and pulls my shadow in there too... Works well for an under arch highlighter, but I would not recommend using this product as a primer.

I've been using MAC primer for my eyelids for probably 10 years.  I'm trying to cut costs and I love ELF products so I decided to give it a try.  I saved about $15 and it's actually better than MAC, applies easy and stays put!

If I could give this zero stars I would. ELF makes some good products, but this isn't one of them. A lid primer needs to have a little coverage at the least. This primer is thin thin thin. Pretty much useless. I guess you get what you pay for.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: this was great, i actually used a little as a concealer ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: i am such a jerk about makeup. if i can't "set it and forget it" i don't want to bother. this was great, i actually used a little as a concealer under my eyes to cover the purple too... i am also super sensitive to eye makeup, no issue. don't need to apply much.

Firstly, this is the first eyeshadow primer that U have used and U am extremely unimpressed.  My eyeshadow does not look any more pigmented, nor does it stay in longer.  Not a product I will buy again, but I am going to give other primers a try.  I have watched my sister use others that she swears by, so I am going to start by asking her which to buy!
Could be more concentrated and not much in the container.  Most other brands are more viscous and will last longer.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Bought this after judging on reviews to use for glitter ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Bought this after judging on reviews to use for glitter shadow. First of all it was ALOT smaller tube than I expected, wish I had just spent the extra few bucks for the clear glue I saw listed, also you have to apply a very very thick coat if your using it for glitter application. So for the amount it's priced as and it being so small, having to use so much it's not going to last very long. I won't reorder, going to try another brand.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: You get what you pay for!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: No wonder it was so cheap! First off, the top broke off immediately! It is very hard to get the applicator into the tube, and when you do, there's nothing on it. I don't know if it's dry or there is nothing in the tube.
This product didn't work well for me. I am a newbie but it seemed to go on blotchy, which was an issue for me. I don't know if I got a bad batch but it was dry and hard to spread on my lids.
Hardly any product in the tube--very disappointed.

I have been using this product. And it makes a huge difference on my eye shadow look. The only downside is that it is a little bit light so when I put it on my skin it makes my I did look weird. But I usually deal with the problem by putting over it. Overall I give it 4.75/5

I love this eyelid primer! I have medium brown skin, and have historically only used cream eyeshadows to get great color on my eyelids. I needed to find a quality and affordable primer to use with my eyeshadows. I've used e.l.f. products before and decided to give this a try. One of their best products yet! Not only does this primer allow me to use regular eyeshadows with no problem, it also keeps my eyeshadow from creasing throughout the day. This is a must have in my make-up bag going forward. You CANNOT beat this price!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: All of these products are pretty terrible. This was almost completely dried out when ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: All of these products are pretty terrible.  This was almost completely dried out when I got it.  Which I suppose is fine because I probably never would have worn it again after the first time.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It turns from liquid to powder in seconds, so ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It turns from liquid to powder in seconds, so there's not much time to blend. I tried applying moisturizer to slow down the setting time but it does not tolerate moisturizer well and fades away.
Decent primer for the price. I used to use a $25 primer and then I found this. Of course there's a difference, but this is cruelty free and cheap - you can't beat that!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I've only used this eyelid primer so keep that in ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I've only used this eyelid primer so keep that in mind but I was impressed. It kept my eyeshadow in for a long time without it smearing. I have very oily eyelids and it kept my look clean all night long
Was paying $12-$15 for a similar product. This is just as great. Definitely recommend this as an alternative to more expensive options like NYX, etc.
Keeps my eyeliner and eyeshadow looking great all day! Even when it rains or when I sweat. I have somewhat oily eyelids so a primer is a must. This is amazing!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I like the pro elf eye primer better than this
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I like the pro elf eye primer better than this.  This doesn't always keep my eye shadow from creasing.  The thicker solutions work better for me.

I really like the product and I feel ridiculous complaining about a $2 purchase but the wand handle broke off immediately and never really fit in the tube, so any product was almost completely scraped off by the time you pulled it out anyway. Good primer, but not good if you can never use it..

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Holds eyeshadow, but dries into a white paste
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I really liked this for the first few times, then it began to get really sticky/tacky (even though it's never been left open) which made application difficult. It also dries into a really light color. I'm super pale, and you could see it even on my skin. I have to be more nuanced in my application, because if I just slap it on quickly, I get white smears outside the eyeshadow region. That being said, my eyeshadow lasts a long time, and I haven't had any crease problems.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Quality is not as good as other drug store brands that serve the same ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Quality is not as good as other drug store brands that serve the same function.  Quality is streaky and takes extra time to blend.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Did cause irritation to my eyes- I wore it for ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Did cause irritation to my eyes-  I wore it for my wedding photos and couldn't stop tearing up & stinging in the outside corners of my eyes.  You can tell in some of my photos that there is redness, and it made my tears wash off all my eye makeup in the corners.  Kind of a bummer
This primer really helps my eyeshadow stay put. It also looks really nice (brightens my skin) if I don't wear anything over it.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Does the job alright, but putting it on kind of hurts.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: The product is hard to get on my lids, it feels like sandpaper is being rubbed against it. Hardly any product gets on the applicator, which may be why it feels like it does. However, it does what it is supposed to do. I'm a fair skinned red-head so the color matches my skin tone and my eye shadow does stay on all day, with fewer crease marks. I'm 47, so my eyelids are a bit droopier than when I was younger. I won't be ordering this again, even for the price.

I've been watching makeup techniques on U-tube and lots of the "instructors" recommend using primers. So I gave it a shot. And wow, it does make a difference. Makeup goes on easier, stays on better and longer. I made the decision for this purchase partially on price. There are others that cost both more and less. I can't comment on that making a difference. You know, the "you get what you pay for" syndrome.But this met my needs and expectations.
I like the coverage and how it helps eyeliner, shadow & concealer last longer. It does give a mat & dry appearance.
I'm not able to use because the applicator wand is broken and stuck inside
Goes on nicely. Covers with little product and looks natural after blending. Very happy with this concealer.
Nice creamy eyeshadow primer. Goes on well and blends excellently without creasing on my porcelain skin and holds color very well.

I never used an eyelid primer before and I'm so glad this was my first shot at it. I have a problem with eyeliner wandering all over my eyelid. This prevents that from happening. Now I can wear eyeliner again. And my eyeshadow stays put all day. Love It!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I used this about 2 times and both times it ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I used this about 2 times and both times it made my eyelids turn an irritated pink color. My eyelids also swelled up a little bit and was tender to the touch. It scared me the first time but I thought maybe I just didn't remove my eye shadow well enough but the second time confirmed my fears. I dont have sensitive skin so I was a bit surprised when this primer irritated my skin. Will not be buying again.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: it really works the only problem I seem to have ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: it really works the only problem I seem to have with it is if you're not careful it leaves a white ring on your eyelid

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I find that I can apply it once and it's fine!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Going to be buying this again when I run out. So far, it's lasted me a while and I have a lot left!I guess it depends on personal preference for how much you apply. I find that I can apply it once and it's fine!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Obviously low quality which is pretty much what i paid for but I decided to ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Obviously low quality which is pretty much what i paid for but I decided to try it because elf sometimes has some good stuff

I purchased two of these at two different times because the applicator stick in the first one that arrived was broken, but I was still able to get the product out and use it so it's really no big deal.  I made the choice to go ahead and order the second one because I really like the primer.  It covers very well and helps make the eyeshadow pop, plus you can't beat the price.  I do recommend this primer.

I use this in the morning as cover up, not so much as a shadow primer. I use it to cover my under eye bags, and the dark veins I sometimes get on my eyelids. Works perfectly, and it blends with my skin tone amazingly.

I'm a fan of every e.l.f. item I've ever bought, but this was pretty dry and nonexistent from the start. The applicator is hard to work with. The primer itself doesn't work better than without it either. I would rather spend a couple more bucks on something that does what it's supposed to.
Very flakey after worn a few hours. Is very thin and does not provide full coverage.
This works really well and helps prevent melting off of eye makeup. For my taste the pearl is too bright and I am getting sheer next time.
Great product for the price.  Not Urban Decay quality but it's good just the same.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: My makeup stays on all day and through practice!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It is a bit disappointing that so little comes in the tube but it works great. I put one dip and swipe on each eyelid and blend It with my finger. It might be partially my eyeshadow pallet, but my eye makeup stays on all day. I've had eyeshadow that gets a crease in it after a while, but when using this my eye makeup stayed on all day and through dance practice just like how I put it on.

was actually shocked how well this holds up and works thru out the day. its amazing. normally I would have to reapply my eyeshadow a few tims but not with this once in the morning and your good until the end of the night.
Bottle was basically empty, I got 2 uses out of it but that was about it.
GREAT price and the product works perfectly. My eyeshadow doesnt crease with this.
Don't blend well with eyeshadows. I have tried everything to make this work by nope not for me.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Little product, but what product you do get is amazing.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: The product itself is amazing. I can definitely see a difference with respect to how much eyeshadow sticks to my lids, as well as the vibrancy of the colours. However, there is not at much product in the bottle as I expected, so just know what you're getting. For the price though, I'm still happy.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: great for the price! holds up longer than i thought!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: its a great primer for the price but does not really hold up all day, still great for at least 6 hours

I ordered this eyeshadow primer because the product I usually use was out of stock and I was running low on eyeshadow primer. This is a good alternative...keeps eyeshadow on throughout the day and seems to brighten up the colors of eyeshadow. My only complaint would that the product stays put and is hard to clean up if you mess up.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: it lasts more like 6 hours before it creases
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Makes my eyeshadow pop more, and seems to help it stay in place longer. Without this, my eyeshadow will crease without an hour or two. With this, it lasts more like 6 hours before it creases.
Product is  easy to apply.  Its not too heavy and non irritating.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Did not work for me whatsoever, disappointed. :<
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was terribly disappointed with this product. :{ The best drug store priced eyelid primer I had used so far was the Fergie Wet and Wild, but since they stopped making that I decided to try this one. I'm not sure if I got a bad batch, but it does literally nothing. My liquid eye liner smears with this (but not with my other primers) and my eye shadow creases. A total waste of money for me :/.
Heard good things about this and I really like it so far. Keeps my eyeshadow in place
This is a great eyelid primer.  It is smooth and no irritation.
Very easy to apply and it definitely helped in my opinion
Way lighter than I thought. Sadly sitting in a drawer.
Color is lighter than expected but I still like it

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This stuff is amazing! I've tried many lid primers over the years ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This stuff is amazing! I've tried many lid primers over the years and this is the only primer that keeps my eyeshadow set in place for hours! No creasing, no oiliness. It's fabulous! The only con I would list is the color is very white. I would like it to be slightly warmer but it doesn't seem to affect the color of my shadow so I guess it's fine.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: They might not all be like this, great price
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This item was clumpy. They might not all be like this, great price.
