Consumer_Reviews.review_title: you get what you pay for
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I initially thought I'd like this because it was more sheer than the other brand I tried. However, it is a bit oily and shiny, and it really doesn't do the job. Within hours, my eyeliner has spread all over. Also, one of the products came with the cap a bit loose-- there was no way to tighten it-- and what was left it in the tube was essentially just oil. I got this because I have liked other ELF products, and because it was super cheap as an add on-- but not worth it. Honestly? I think it made my makeup run MORE than if I'd just had a bare lid, like a moisturizer. Maybe I got a defective product given all the good reviews?

I have been using this e.l.f. Shadow Lock Eyelid Primer for at least a year now, and I love it.  It is exactly the same consistency and quality as products that are 10 times the price.  For a fraction of what you would pay for other brands, why not save your money.  If you wear it every day, one tube lasts at least a month, if not two.  I use it as my eyeshadow base, and only apply shadow in my crease and above.  The color is quite natural to my own skin tone, but covers the irregularities of color on my lids, and makes a great preparation base for holding my shadow all day long.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Easy to apply and really makes my eye shadow last
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I don't find that this product creases at all. Easy to apply and really makes my eye shadow last.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Not as good as the e.l.f. Stick primer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: The applicator is not well padded so I feel the stick and need to keep redipping it for primer. The color is good; light enough for my very light skin. The formula seems a bit oily and my shadow was oily and creased after several hours. I used it again, with translucent face powder over it and that helped but isn't what I want in a primer.I have an e.l.f. stick primer that is a bit dry and dragging to apply but is worth the effort over this. The stick adheres well, improves the color quality of shadows and does keep them on and fresh looking all day. This one I probably won't keep.

This was bought for my daughter, and it was pretty much garbage. you could hardly get any product on the applicator to put it on the eyes, and it did nothing to make the eye shadow look brighter, or stay on longer. Definitely will not buy again.

I love this eyelid primer!! It absolutely works as promissed. I use it anytime i don't want my eyeshadow to budge and it does not disappoint. At the end of the day (about 10 hrs) there is no creasing in my eyeshadow, and that is amazing considering I have slightly hooded eyes!

It definitely does the work! My liquid eye liner and eye makeup lasted all night long after using it. I usually have a problem with my eyeliner disappearing as the night goes, but this primer helped a lot and the price was the most wonderful part :)
great primer. keeps the eye shadow vibrant and in placd

I was looking for a white primer to make bright colors brighter. Since this is in a white tube, I thought that's what it was. I am used to Urban Decay's Potion primer and have been using it for years, but I only have it in beige and clear. That stuff goes on like a concealer and makes your shadow stick. It's great. This stuff is creamy like lotion and leaves you covered in glitter. It doesn't work anywhere near as good as the UD stuff. And I mentioned the glitter, right? Why?? If I'm putting shadow OVER it, why do I want to cover my eyes with glitter? The white is barely visible as a base. I will stick with UD or find something else. This stuff is going to my kid cousins.Also, it doesn't say it contains fragrance, but it smells kind of fruity / flowery.
seems very chalk great for use on solid colors not shimmery colors
Not what I expected

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great addition to any makeup bag
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have never used a primer and just added this to my order as it was so cheap, I thought I would try it out. Anyway I am 48 and have always worn eyeliner, I can only use the liquid type with a thin brush due to my eye lids being wrinkly. (I dont ever remember having no wrinkles on my eye lids by the way). Anyway I cannot believe how smooth and easier it was to apply my eye liner on top of this primer. So pleased with this that this looks like it will be a keeper for me. As for eye shadow I cannot comment as I dont wear it. For the price its well worth a try!!
this concealer is terrible, it's super clumpy on the face and doesn't blend well at all. i do not recommend

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Works as well as Urban Decay!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I recently started using e.l.f. cosmetics instead of high end products.  The quality of e.l.f. is comparable and the price is dirt cheap!  I usually use Urban Decay shadow primer.  Elf shadow lock works just as well.  The product goes on smoothly, doesn't crease, and gives my shadow staying power.The only reason I gave it 4 stars vs 5 is because it is not labeled.  The tube looks like concealer and I have started to put it on as concealer when I was in a rush. I recommend grabbing a permanent marker and labeling it!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Yes Foundation For Your Eyelids is Real & A Must For Any Make-Up Diva
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: So I never thought in my life I would have the urge to buy something called "eyelid primer"; basically like foundation for your eyelids.  All I can say...why do I not here of this stuff sooner?!?!?First off, I became a huge E.L.F. converter after buying loads of their product on a sweet sale and just loved the quality I get for such a low price.  When I saw this, I went back and forth about buying it; but after seeing some of the "divas" in one of my beauty groups talk about and lip concealer even, I decided to try the concept first hand.  I wanted to go with sheer, since it looked like it would just blend to my natural honey/light tan skin tone.  It comes with a little soft brush wand and glides on super easy liquid foundation.  I use it all over my eyelid all the way up the brow and even sometimes use a little in my bag/under eye area to help even the skin color.The eyelid primer has made my black liquid eyeliner so much more intense; and my eyeshadows as well.  They have this huge pop with them and I find it helps in the eyeliner and shadow stay a little better through the hot sweaty Florida summer days.  It doesn't alter or lighten the color in anyway when I apply something over the eyelid primer.  The bottle gets me a pretty long way.  I started using it daily, and got almost 4 months out of 1 bottle.  So glad I took the chance on something I thought I would never need in my make-up routine; and now I can't live without.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Ordered 2: BOTH arrived DRY & EMPTY. Unusable.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: 0-ZERO STARS. Ordered two because the price was so great and I loved the STORE-bought sheer Elf eye primer I had from a couple years back., both arrived from Amazon almost completely dry. The bottom of the wand was literally dry all the way down with just a little "square" nub of dry paste at the very end of the tip, which would mean the tube is empty less the .5cm of dried material the wand had dried at its tip. Even pumping in effort to "stir" many times makes no change. Also, the tiny dry square "glob" at the tip is a gross pinkish color. By no means "sheer," as the label states. And by no means a light/fair sheer yellow tint as I was hoping per some reviews, and as the equivocal sheer Elf eye primer I purchased in the store last year (probably yr before) and was attempting to replace. What a waste. This is nothing like the Elf eyelid primer I purchased in a Walmart a year or two back and loved, which had lasted me 1-2 years with intermittent use.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Easy to Apply, Works Well, & Non-Irritating for Sensitive Eyes
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was pleasantly surprised by this eyelid primer, especially after being disappointed with E.L.F.'s under eye primer. The tube and applicator are very similar to those of a standard lip gloss and allow for simple, precise application. The actual primer is predominantly sheer with a very slight nude tint, which makes a perfect base for your eye shadow. The primer has also made it much easier for me to get a more uniform eye shadow application, particularly in comparison to how much more uneven (and frustrating) it was when I was applying my shadow directly over my foundation & powder. My eye shadow now lasts all day (about 8-9hrs before I start to notice any fading) rather than my previous 4-5hrs. It is completely odorless and has not caused any irritation at all to my very sensitive eyes. I would highly recommend this product to others!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Works ALL DAY! 10+ hour resturaunt shift proven
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have never been as pleased with a cosmetic as I am with this. ALL through middle and high school I would wear cateye liner that would bleed onto my upper eyelid. For six years I just accepted that's what happens after an hour or two of wear.I've worn the Shadow Lock a couple days now, just for short outings before and it worked fine! Great!BUT TODAY I WORKED A TEN HOUR SHIFT AND WHEN I GOT BACK HOME MY EYELINER STILL HAD NOT EVEN SMUDGED. It didn't bleed onto my upper eyelid, it didn't wear away at the corners of my eyes. I put it under my eyes and my mascara didn't "melt".Lmao you can see my concealer and foundation definately gave out HOURS ago, but the Shadow Lock is still going strong.10/10 this is the best product I've ever used

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Awesome product at a steal of a price!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I've considered buying this for a while, mostly because at the Amazon Add-On price, it's so cheap.  But I mostly wear a Jane Iredale eyeshadow palette that stays in place all day long, and I wondered if I really needed it.  Recently, though, I got a  (free with Ulta purchase) eyeshadow that I really love, but it seems to move into the crease of my eyelid as the day progresses, much more so than my more expensive eyeshadows do.  So this primer seemed like it could be an easy solution to that problem.I selected the sheer, so it wouldn't affect the colors of the shadows I already love as-is, and in that sense, it works very well.  It blends in easily, and it doesn't appear to lighten the eyeshadows I use.  The primer itself goes on smoothly but needs to be blended in a little.  I've attached a pic so you can see difference in color between initially applied and blended against my pasty white skin.It's not a large tube at all, and the packaging is deceiving.  I won't put the effort into verifying whether it's exactly 0.11 ounces, but as you can see in the attached pic where I've held it under a light, the tube does not arrive fully filled.  I imagine I'll go through it pretty quickly, but since e.l.f. products are so ridiculously affordable, I can hardly complain about that.  Fact is this stuff works really well, keeps my cheaper eyeshadows in place much longer, doesn't bother my skin or affect my makeup colors except for making them stand out as intended.  Definitely worth the steal of a price!

This product works well enough but my problem with it is the packaging.  After only 2 weeks the cap broke off of the wand, which the want piece has the thread on it so it still seals fine.  When you pull the wand out of the tube it's a very tight fit so most of the product gets pulled off.  I have to go back in for more product to do the other eye.  Would be nicer if I didn't have to double dip.  It makes me think that I'm not going to be able to get a majority of the product out before the wand can't pick up anything else and I have to throw it out.  The color is good though and covers the veins on my eyelids.  Mildly tacky so be sure to set it with powder first or it can drag a little.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Did everything it's supposed to do. Works great for me!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This gave my eyelid a nice soft , smooth base to work with.  My eyeshadow went on easier, looked more pigmented, blended easier and laster longer. It did everything it was supposed to do. The price is not bad and I'm enjoying this product.*Added :  I gave a tube of this to a friend of mine . Got it from amazon . It was the only change in her eye routine. The next morning she woke up with her eye so swollen she couldn't open it. I don't know if this stuff was out  of date or what.  I usually get it fom Walmart or target and have zero issues. Just wanted to tell you all what happened. Amazon gave me my $1.50 back.
Perfect base eyeshadow ELF nice product .keep my fare eyeshadow 15 hour fuulllll pretty . Long duree time

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Perfect Primer for Perfect Long Lasting Eye Makeup
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I love this primer. The price is remarkable. Cruelty free products are a necessity for me. I know I should be washing my makeup off every evening but there are times I get too busy. I've tried out how long i can keep my eyeshadow perfectly in place by using this primer. I can wake up with my eyeshadow on as impeccably as it was when I applied it the previous morning. It won't smudge or budge until I remove it with eye makeup remover.  I absolutely love this product and have already purchased it a second time. I highly recommend this primer to anyone who wears eyeshadow. It is fantastic!

I am a cosmetic junkie, that being said,  I've tried ever so many brands of eyelid primers [even ridiculously pricey ones ] but none lived up to expectations or promises for that matter. Finally, I tried ELF's Shadow Lock eyelid primer. This is the best one I've found so far. It goes on easily, doesn't dry out my eyelids and keeps my shadow in place all day long with no creasing. Who would have thought that a $3 primer would out perform the $25 primers! I'm hooked.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Very budget friendly and does what it's supposed to
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Very happy with this primer, it really helps the eye shadow pop and thanks to this primer my eye makeup seems to last all day without creasing. Also very very affordable compared to other options.I know that with elf products it can be a hit or a miss, fortunately they're very budget friendly so you're not wasting a lot of money if you don't like the product, I've found many elf products that I love and use daily and this one is definitely one of them.Would definitely recommend!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: but it did annoy me that this primer did not blend in with ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I ended up purchasing this at Target, but thought I'd leave a review of what I think of this item.Firstly, I'm generally very pale, no matter how much sun I get, so pearl was the color choice I went with. I don't know if sheer is the same, but there's glitter/sparkles in this product. I'm not a huge glitter fan and really can only tolerate glitter/sparkles in eyeshadows and highlighter. I also noted it made my eyelids a bit brighter than their natural color (which is a pink with many noticeable veins). It's not a big deal, but it did annoy me that this primer did not blend in with my skin tone.Pros about it? Feels smooth, comes off easily, and most of all, my eyes pop! The eyeshadows I use are beautiful colors and don't show up well without a primer (especially glitter and metallic shadows), but they showed up amazingly with e.l.f.'s eye primer here. And even after my day working in a place with a poor AC system, I have no folds or build up in the creases of my eyelids.You can see my first application in the first two photos of what it was like for the application. The last photo is one of the shadow's appearance after work today and also being in the hot sun for a while.

This is BY FAR the best primer I have ever used. I've tried others and they turn cakey on my eyelids so I hated using them, but I also hate when my eyeshadow creases! I tried this and it is AMAZING. My eyeshadow didn't crease one bit all day long. All day! E.l.f. has now become my favorite make up brand for practically everything I buy. You can't beat them, especially the price.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I spent years thinking that eyeshadow primer was a waste
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I spent years thinking that eyeshadow primer was a waste - I find that most facial primers don't really work well with my skin type, so I assumed that eyeshadow primers would be the same way. I'd wonder why my eyeshadow always creased or wouldn't blend evenly.I recently splurged on a nice eyeshadow pallet, but I only ended up with the same problems as always. On a whim, I bought this primer because it was so cheap. When I tried it out, I was amazed - I couldn't believe what I'd been missing all these years! My eyeshadow has never looked better. If you're not a primer person, go ahead and buy this. You won't regret it.

I kind of thought buying this product wasn't for me. But after reading many blogs that get no kick backs, no free products, and no money for sales... I read it to use it to freshen up the eyes instead of the eye shadow primer it is. Well, I don't wear eye shadow at all, so to try it to freshen up the eyes seemed weird. But.. I must say I do like it. I use a dark circle cream on under my eyes and I use concealer under my eyes and on my eye lids.Well, I put this on my lids after the concealer and it did freshen them up! they looked a little healthier. And it didn't look like I was wearing anything, which is what is important to me. I don't like to look made up or like I am wearing a bunch of make up. I like to highlight my best features and hide a few flaws and that's it. The less make up I put on the happier I am.
The tube is a little on the small side, but the rest of it was fine. My eye shadow/eyeliner, etc., stayed on all day long and looked great.

Disclaimer: I haven't used an eyelid primer beforeHowever, now that I have used this product, there's no going back. My shadow pops more and stays in place (after years of smudged makeup!!). This also minimizes my fine lines.\Con: As other reviewers have said, .11 oz is very little product. This mostly bothers me because the applicators seem wasteful when I keep buying so many!

I love e.l.f. brand makeup because everything is super cheap, so even when products don't work well at least it wasn't a huge waste of money. I got this primer on a whim, not expecting much. Once I used it, I was impressed! It works just as well as the more expensive primers that I've tried. The color of the product is pale and semi-sheer, so beware if you have darker skin. Of course this doesn't matter too much if you're putting eyeshadow over it anyway. Helps keep shadows on all day!
This product is actually better than some of the overpriced name brands from the malls.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Easy to apply, actually WORKS: awesome!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I've never used an eye primer before. But I noticed that my eye shadow wasn't staying on my lids all day and looked faded when I got home from work, so I thought I'd try this. It's really easy to apply, it's thick and gooey (kind of like marshmallow cream in color and consistency). I dabbed some on my lids using the applicator and blended with my finger. I let it dry for about a minute and applied my eye shadow. It REALLY helps my eye shadow last longer. I am writing this review at the end of the work day and my eye shadow still looks like it did when I put it on this morning. I love this product because it is doing exactly what I wanted it to do.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This product is crap. Normally ELF has excellent products for a good ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This product is crap.  Normally ELF has excellent products for a good price but this primer is the exception to the rule.  It goes on OK, but the eye shadow colors don't adhere and "pop" like they do with higher end primers.  By the end of the day, after just a few hours even, my eyelids are a smeary creasy mess.  I tried it a couple of times to give it a fair chance, but in the end it went right in the trash.  I'd rather skip the eye shadow altogether than look like a hot mess.  The only primers that I've found so far to be worth using at all are Lorac, Too Faced and Urban Decay. That's what I get for being cheap!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: You get what you pay for! I have oily ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: You get what you pay for! I have oily lids and this product does nothing to combat that. It lasts maybe 4-6 hours and then starts to crease and/or my makeup starts to fade into this really weird look. It doesn't hold my eyeshadow nor my eyeliner. I need my primers to last me all day so I prefer something that works as well as the Urban Decay primer despite the expensive price point. If you want something that works as well as that but is affordable, try the Palladino primer.

I love this stuff! I work long long days sometimes and I feel that this eyeshadow primer keeps my eyeshadow looking nice for a long time. Towards the end of a long day, it starts wearing off, but hey, a lot of makeup does that. Glides on nice, and is transparent, dries quickly too. Don't waste money on expensive products, this one does the trick. :-)

Great eye shadow primer.I only apply a small amount to the tip of my finger and rub onto eyelid.Its a very creamy consistency that locks on my eye shadow for hours.It makes the colors "pop".works just as well as some higher end eye shadow primers.Love that it has a basic base color to it.

This is amazing! I actually bought this in a drug store but it works very very well. If you have oily lids this will help your eyeliner and eyeshadow stay on tremendously. If you have slighty darker skin, it might be a little ashy, but if you have on eyeshadow, it masks it.

I was wary about buying because it was only $1.42, thought it was probably really cheap quality.  I was wrong!  It works great! My only wish is that it was available in a darker shade as I am biracial and the porcelain color takes a bit of work to mask.  Other than that it's a great product!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Very good product, goes on like concealer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Very good product, goes on like concealer. Only complaint is it is very sparkly so when you put it on their is glitter all around your eye. Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great product; Urban Decay people, please keep the older tube design!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Love this stuff.  I've used it for years but, Urban Decay changed the tube to have a sponge applicator.  I prefer the tube which lets me squeeze our the correct amount with our contaminating the contents with skin bacteria, which the sponge applicator does when you stick it back in the bottle.  Very happy to find the older tube design here on Amazon.  I tried different brands to find a replacement but, still come back to UD primer as long as I can find in the the older tube.  UD marketing people:  please change back to the old tube design!

I don't wear much makeup but I do love eyeshadow. It is annoying when the one thing I like wearing ends up caking and rubbing off weird halfway through the day. I follow a Youtube creator who recommended this brand so I finally got around to trying it. This is a considerable improvement to the cheap brand I bought at a grocery chain. The primer is thicker than I expected and feels like it coats very well with a tiny amount. I probably use a quarter to a fifth of the size of a grain of rice if that tells you anything. The best part about this product is that my eyeshadow only fades slightly (which is to be expected if I don't want to touch it up), but never cakes into the folds of my eyelids, so it still looks clean even if it doesn't look brand spankin new. If I felt so inclined, I could probably touch up once in the middle of the day and be great.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Best primer you could ever hope for!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This primer is literally the best thing ever. I have never used an eye primer or thought it was important because I don't have oily skin so my makeup doesn't run or cake up during the day. In addition to keeping the exact look 18+ hours, this primer creates the perfect canvas for blending!! It takes very little eye shadow to create the most gorgeous looks and I literally now won't go a day without it.

There really is no comparison to Urban Decay Primer Potion. While other primers are greasy and cause your eyeshadow to fade and crease by the end of the day, this one holds up perfectly, even in the extremely humid climate I live in. A tiny drop on each kid goes a long way. Last time I bought this product, it lasted two years. It's an investment, but worth it in the long run.

Overall at 2 dollars I would buy this again just learn from my mistakes ladies.

I did not know that Stay Don't Stray was a colored product or I would not have even bothered to purchase it; I don't need a primer that is also a concealer. I just want some eyelid glue for my eye makeup.*Before you use this, if you plan to leave the house, make sure you exfoliate any dry patches around your eyes, where you plan to use this. I promise that you won't notice how dry stuff looks until AFTER you are gone and can't do anything about it.*Expect that no matter how carefully you try to gently press the pump, it's going to dispense way more than you can use, and there is nothing you can do about it. This was frustrating to me. As expensive as this stuff is and I have to wash half of it off my hands every time I use it? No thanks.Benefit's product has an opaque coverage that is very fair; even on my pasty face it was pretty light. I can't imagine how this would show up on someone of darker coloring, it would probably look ghost-like. It was not as drying as the UDPP Eden, however it sure did showcase any dry areas I did have. And it stung all around my eye area!! This made my eyes water. Already by this point I had decided to return it. Nothing short of miraculous color retention was going to make me keep it.Wear: Not too bad. I did notice more emphasis on lines under my eyes after awhile, and I normally don't stick concealer under my eyes so I can only blame the Stay Don't Stray. I would say overall I am much happier with Urban Decay's Original primer for wear. I would not use UD Eden under my eyes, nor am I happy how the Stay Don't Stay looks under my eyes.PROSanitary packagingCovers discolorationsNot as drying as Urban Decay Primer Potion EdenCONIncredible waste of the product and there's nothing you can do about itNot as long-wearing as Urban Decay Primer Potion OriginalStung my eyesMust make absolutely sure that you have no residual dry areas where the product will be usedI'm returning it and won't repurchase or recommend.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Covers up under-eye circles and keeps shadow in place!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This product works exactly as it is supposed to.  It keeps my eyeliner and shadow in place all night, and helps conceal my under-eye circles to boot!  This product works great with my fair skin.  However, I can't imagine this product working for anyone with a darker complexion...or a tan!+Quick Addition:  I originally rated 5 stars, but this product does not age well and the ingredients separate after a while...not sure what life expectancy is supposed to be.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: A better than average product for keeping everything in place
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I noticed that the reviews are very mixed on this product.  For me, I tend to be towards the lovers of the product. Here, I think are the major points.First major test used: early evening application for a wild party birthday evening and a "sleep over" with younger man (I'm over 30, but in denial that I'm aging... as we all should be).  The make-up neutral/natural dramatic (3 eyeshadow shading) with powder eyeliner (MAC) and liquid eye-liner on top (Cheap drug store brand), cover the dark circles.  Application of product surrounded the eye raccoon style to give you that bright young "base" for which you can apply the darker brown/neutral shades on top for a sophisticated look  The stay put went to the brow.  My skin tone is medium, so this added a highlight effect to the brow shaping technique that i did.Performance:  Pass with flying color.  I awoke at 9am, slightly hung over, jumped over my young beau, so as not to awaken him, fearful that my face was going to be a distorted mess.  I looked ready to go back out on the town.  It held the cheap liquid eyeliner on top of a powder eyeliner I was testing as well as the eyemake-up despite having had "night-time activities" and sleeping in it.  This means it held the powder eyeliner on tightly along with the liquid. My "night-time" activities + sleepover would have generally resulted in make-up across my face.  The dark circles (now accentuated by alcohol with inadequate hydration) were not visible.Notes:  I have a good medium foundation for which to ultimately blend color on top. I'm not sure if some of the other reviews are trying to use this as a concealer/liquid foundation.  That seems a little odd to me... it's a primer not a foundation. Alternatively, I wonder if those using the product are using a powder foundation or liquid.  I can say with a liquid foundation or liquid + powder foundation you're good to go. I haven't extensively tried this with only a powder foundation. The texture is close to a light liquid foundation, not thick like a concealer.Test 2:  All day work and then go on to party at night.  Application 7am - ????Performance:  Not bad, still required re-ap. While there is a notable difference between when I use this and do not, this product will not hold eye make-up all day perfectly.  The touch ups are more minor and it will still show lighter around the eyes if you are using shading techniques to manage dark circles and increase that youthful eye look. However, you'll want to re-ap if you're doing anything more than going to the grocery store and going home.Note: if you're an eye-rubber - especially if you're a contact wearing eye-rubber - then you will think this product doesn't work.  Look.. it holds make-up on your face. If you're rubbing your eyes, then the darken flecks of your mascara that ends up in your eyemake-up is going to make you think this stuff isn't working.Final Review:  If you're primarily interested in holding eye make-up and you are not doing something crazy/christina aguillera show make-up, then go for it.  If your make-up regiment includes holding massive amounts of a single shadow that must stay uniformly applied, then go for the urban decay product.  That is the style they are selling anyway. However, if you have more of a relaxed neutral blended style, you'll be fine with this one and appreciate the lightness.  As for irritation, the product allowed me to withstand the irritation I usually get from the cheap drug store liquid liner, so for most this should be a good product on that test.

There are multiple problems with this product:1- it dispenses too much at a time, you end up wasting half the product.2- it does NOT keep eye makeup from creasing.  The color stays, but I still get a crease.3- looks cakey4- for those with fair skin and light bags under your eyes, it is too light to be used as an all day concealer.  But, if you use concealer over it you get raccoon eyes.Don't waste your money on this.  There are far better eyelid primers.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: made my creases worse, not great packaging
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: this was the first eyelid primer i ever tried, and it actually made my creases worse than when i only wore the eyeshadow (velvet eyeshadow by benefit). i have really oily eyelids as my makeup creases very fast, but this product did not help. i really tried to like it and use it - i tried using less/more product, but nothing really worked. the reviews are true about the dispenser, also - definitely a pain in the butt unless you've mastered the 'half pump' to not get an excess of product.i bought this at sephora and exchanged it for too faced's shadow insurance, and it has worked much better for me. i hear a lot of people swear by THIS product, so it probably just depends on your skin. for me, didn't work. i gave it two stars since when it was under my eye, it did a satisfactory job of actually concealing, even though it's only supposed to serve as a concealing base. also was a good color when it was on my lids.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Does what it says it will
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This product works very well.I have oily skin and have darker shadows under my eyes as well as darker eye lids.  So in addition to eyeshadow often disapearing after a few hours, concealers also look chaulky and cakey after a while too.  A small (and it is hard to dispense a small amount) amount of this on my lid and under my eyes actually keeps my eyeshadow on all day, and I've found acts as a light concealer too-in fact some days I've managed to go without wearing any concealor some days.  There's no creasing, no chaulky look and no cakey feel either.  I really love this stuff and am glad I have it.I bought it at Sephora where it was bundled with Erase Paste and a cream shadow and both compliment the product; although I find the Erase Paste a little heavy with the Stay, Don't Stray applied and have switched to Boi-ing for concealer.  But for the first time ever I'm now able to wear a cream eyeshadow without creasing as soon as it's applied.

To be honest, this is a product I would have never thought of buying by itself.  I received it in a package full of other Benefit makeup things and I absolutely love it.  I also have oily eyelids so by the time noon rolls around, I look like a cross between half raccoon half human or that I've been holed up in my office watching sappy movies.  After using this product, my eyeliner and mascara stay put.  I've actually received compliments after using it "I don't know what's different about you, but your face looks more awake" (yes, it's because my makeup is staying put).  I have medium to darker skin so a little goes a long way.  It really brightens your appearance.  I've  used it with and without eyeshadow and it is marvelous.

I bought this since my HG primer (Two Faced Shadow Insurance) started giving me a rash on my lids.  (Luckily I was later to return to using TFSI with no ill effects).  This works ok but not great.  Hate the applicator, doesn't go on too smoothly.  It is better than no primer but I still get creases on my eyeshadow after a few hours.  I do feel it is gentler on the skin, so if you have sensitive skin, it is worth trying to see how it works for you, esp since I see Amazon has trial sizes.

I got a sample of this product in the mail and I was hooked from the get-go.  It works very well as a primer if put on very thin.  Push the dispenser down very slowly or you'll get about a week worth of product.  I've used this just about every time I put on makeup and my tube has lasted me almost a year (but i use a teeny-tiny bit at a time.)  It's great for diminishing under eye darkness.  On another note it is an EXCELLENT tattoo concealer too.  Give it a try.
This primer sucks. I get creases within 3-5 hours that are worse than using no primer at all!

Hello-I was sold on this product at the store.The eyeshadows looks silkier and smoother on.The only complaint I have is too much of the liquid comes out with one pump. You can use one pump 3 times, easily. A lot of the product goes to waste. What I now do is turn bottle upside down and then pump. A tiny amount will be dispensed that will go a long way on both eyes. I have also noticed that the eyeliner does not smudge either. I love this product, but had to give the 4 stars because of the pump issue.

I tend to have oily eyelids, worse in the hotter months, but overall nothing excessive.  My eyeliner usually stays in place, but eyeshadow doesn't normally last more than 4 hours (what remains is in the crease).  I bought this on the salesperson at Sephora's recommendation, and this has been a disappointment.  There has been NO DIFFERENCE in the staying power of eye makeup on me, regardless of the environment (cold, hot, humid, etc.) I'm in.Also, Benefit put no thought into the functionality of the packaging.  A small dab (a drop is too much) of this product can cover your entire eye area.  You have to use a very controlled, light touch with the pump, otherwise you will waste product.  As with all pumps, when the product is low, it's hard to empty out the container to use it all (which is a must for something this expensive).The only good thing about this is when I do apply it, it actually helps brighten my eye area without additional concealer... at least for the few hours it lasts.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great for me, but probably not for everyone
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have VERY pale skin.  I'm talking not even pasty.  Beyond white.  Sour cream blue maybe.  And this stuff is GREAT for me.  I use it as a concealer and top it off with mineral powder, and the combination really covers my dark circles better than anything I have ever tried (and believe me, I have tried EVERYTHING).That being said, for anybody with darker skin than I have (in other words, 99.99% of the population) I imagine that this stuff is pretty useless.  It was pretty stupid of benefit to make a concealer-esque product for one skin tone.  Even band-aids probably match skin tones better than this stuff.So again, if you are super pale like me and use a powder, this stuff is great and comes highly recommended.  If you are not super pale, it probably won't work.

If anyone thinks this is a replacement for Benefit FY Eye (since this is the product that now comes up if you search for FY Eye): Don't Believe It! This is nothing like it. Very disappointing. It doesn't work well as a base. Impossible to squirt out a small amount. Actually makes creases worse. Ugh. Benefit, please bring back FY Eye.
This is wonderful as a primer, or as an eye shadow itself.  No creases.  Smooth.

I'm usually a fan of Benefit products, but not this time. I used this as an eyeshadow primer and was disappointed. It goes on extremely thick and is a matte beige color, which takes a long time to blend fully. I also don't think it makes my eyeshadow stay put nearly as long as other eye primers, such as Too Faced and Urban Decay. I definitely will not repurchase this.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Didn't work well, irritating to eyelid
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Thankfully I didn't pay full price for this, a sample was included in a beauty box by Sephora. I saw no difference in liner or concealer smudging. Very disappointing. Even worse, it made my eyelids red and puffy after one use. I've never had this problem before, but must have a sensitivity to something in the product.
I bought this for my sister. She says it works wonderfully. She says: concealers and eyeshadows STAY PUT. This is the second time she purchase this product.

My makeup usually rubs off in an hour after applying it. I was pleasantly surprised when I used this and it didn't Stray!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: ... professional makeup artist and this is hands down my favorite primer! I don't typically use Mary Kay makeup
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I am a professional makeup artist and this is hands down my favorite primer!  I don't typically use Mary Kay makeup, but I prefer their eye primer over my favorite brands like MAC, Urban Decay, and 2-Faced.  It is "clear" when applied and tacky but not too tacky that you cannot blend your shadows.  Eye shadow stays put all day with this primer and it is great for all types and finishes of eye shadows.  It is definitely a must have in any make up kit!  It is also half the price of MAC's eye primer and many other brands.

Doesn't work for hooded eyelids. You only need a small amount to cover both eyelids. It comes in a tube so it's much easier to apply than the primers that come in a little pot. It doesn't set down a nice base layer, or base tone. It reminded me a lot of just a lotion. It doesn't hold the eye shadow in place. Be prepared for all kinds of eye shadow creases.

I stick to the basics with make-up, and I refuse to spend very much on it.  This is a staple though that I cannot live without. Just a tiny dab on each eyelid keeps eye shadow in place all day and night, and usually prevents that shiny crease that I would otherwise get after a few hours of going about my daily routines. Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Hands down the best eye primer I've used.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is hands down my favourite eye primer. It does not have that weird, silicone-y feel other primers have - it feels like a lotion. And most importantly to me, it's white/clear, not flesh coloured. I'm really not sure why they make all primers flesh coloured now but I don't care for it at all. I do use this for both my eyelids and my eyebrows - yes, you can TOTALLY rub this in to your eyebrows before applying powder and it will stay ALL DAY. There have been multiple times when I have fallen asleep with my makeup on (yes, yes, I know this is BAD), and when I wake up my brows and most of my eyeshadow has not budged one bit. Considering that I sweat heavily and can wear this on the most humid of days with no problem, that is amazing. I really cannot speak highly enough of it.I will say that for those of you who are used to only using the weird silicone-y flesh coloured primers, this one being more like a lotion, has a little bit of 'tack' to it. I recommend putting it on your lids/brows, then proceeding with the rest of your makeup while it dries a little bit. When applying eyeshadow I sometimes have to 'dab' it on gently at first before really beginning to blend. If you immediately start trying to push powder across the area where it is applied, it will sometimes drag.

As a LARPer and Ren Faire actor I've had to wear costume makeup outside for several hours and thanks to this primer it has never budged. Not even in the rain.

sub category rank: 9 in Beauty & Personal Care > Makeup > Eyes > Eyeshadow Bases & Primers

Product_Name: Mary Kay Eye Primer

Category: Beauty & Personal Care › Makeup › Eyes › Eyeshadow
Description: No smudging, creasing or caking. The NARS Smudge Proof Eyeshadow Base is the insider trick of the trade. Never looking heavy-handed, this lightweight eye primer creates a seamless canvas that keeps cream and powder color looking brilliant, fresh and just-applied, all day. A polymer and mineral powder blend creates a firm grip on color ensuring hours and hours of gorgeous wear. Fortified with special deep-sea and antioxidant rice extracts, the Smudge Proof Eyeshadow Base dries on contact and keeps the delicate eyelid smooth and prepared for color application.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I used Too Faced Shadow Primer in the past, and I thought THAT was the Holy Grail of eyeshadow primer. This stuff's way better. I don't like the doe-foot applicator and hard tube, though, because I have no idea how much is left and won't be able to use every last drop like with the Too Faced. Eh, still worth it. My eyelids are kinda greasy and one of them is hooded, my face is usually dry but eyeshadow melts right off. If I prime with this, my shadow/liner lasts all day with no problems.
