However, with that being said I used it and my eyemakeup did not bleed or budge all night/day.  I even used in on my brows and the brow makeup stayed all evening and typically this fades off on me within a few hours.  Great product.

I have VERY oily eyelids.  You can fry bacon on these eyelids.  I recently started wearing gel eyeliner and was disappointed at how it would rub off on my top lid, and kind of break apart throughout the day.  I heard great things about the primer from nars and decided to take a chance on this expensive product.  I left the gel liner on one eye with no primer and then primed the other lid before applying my eyeliner.  I left it on around the house for about two hours.  The primer worked SO WELL.  It mattified my lids and kept the oiliness at bay.  The liner didn't rub off on the primed eye and the naked eyelid was almost void of eyeliner after two hours.  The primer allowed my gel to stick where it was supposed to, without it the liner transfers to the top of my lid.  The applicator is nice, and not messy.  But I wish there was more products.  The wand takes up most of the tube, tricking you into thinking there's more product than there is.  I took off a star because of the price, 25 dollars.  My liner is about 7 dollars, so I hope this product lasts me at least a few months.::update::  this primer has lasted me 5 months, and will probably last me at least another month!  so it reallllly is worth the money, and I changed my review to 5 stars.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This is a good primer for what it's meant to do
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is a good primer for what it's meant to do. It keeps your eyeshadow on and without creasing for 8+ hours so you can get through a day at work no problems. However, for someone like me that will use 3-4 different shadows in one eye look this lacks the biggest factor-blendability. It does such a good job of keeping the shadows in place that it makes it difficult to blend them out. There have been multiple occasions where my crease color has looked like a stark like because this primer makes blending really difficult. For the price you're paying, you want it to offering everything a good bad should and it doesn't do that.
My eyeshadow creases no matter what I do or how expensive the products are. This works really good but only for so long. For most people it would probably last all day though.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: My eyelids get super oily and I'd basically given up on the hope ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Had this on my wish list and received it yesterday as a Christmas present. My eyelids get super oily and I'd basically given up on the hope of ever being able to wear eyeshadow. I also have to deal with the dreaded eyeliner transference on a daily basis. I used a thin layer on each eyelid and all I have to say is I went all day, all night, finally fell asleep, and woke up with my eyeshadow and eyeliner still in place. Gross (because wash your face people) but AMAZING. I'm a believer.

This is one of those beauty jackpots you always hope to find.  It does what it's supposed to do and it does it very well.  Unlike the eyeshadow primers at the drugstore which become oily after a few hours, this one stays dry and holds eyeshadow and liner all day.  Sometimes I actually have a hard time getting it all the way off!  But I would much rather have that issue than have streaky oily eyelids by the end of the day.  Great product.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Fast application, great results, better than other primers
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I had used Bareminerals cream eyeshadow primer for years and tried this last week. It will be replacing Bareminerals! It dries quickly (to the point of other reviews, definitely let it dry before applying shadow) and it works great with cream and powder shadows.It dries completely clear, no shine or color. Here's my complete detailed comparison of the two primers: [...]Overall, 5-star product and just a tiny bit needed means it will last a long time for the price!

I have used many shadow primers over the last few years & I was recently shopping for a new one when an associate suggested this one. It is amazing! No creasing, it dries clear and your shadows & liners last until you remove them. I have oily lids & even with primers, my shadows used to slide off, not this one, yes, its a bit more pricey, but very worth it! And a little goes a long way, definitely worth the few extra $$$.
I have tried so many eyeshadow primers, this one is the absolute best. I wear this when I want to go to the beach or to a water park or pool. It will stay all day!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Best ive ever used for oily skin and eyelids
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Best eyeshadow primer ever. I have super oily skin and nothing works but this. It never let's me down.

I have never used eyeshadow primer before this one so I have nothing to compare it to -- however I LOVE this product.  It works.  I use a few dabs in the morning -- then apply eyeshadow -- and my shadow lasts ALL DAY without CREASING.  I think this NARS Primer is wonderful
I love this primer. Its smooth, holds makeup all day, comes off easily with makeup remover. I have tried many other primers out there, nothing holds like the NARS Primer. Highly recommended.
Totally rad base, it works and i've tried MANY.

I love this primer! It keeps my make in place all day (and I have oily skin, so eye shadows usually last maybe 2 hours maximum before creasing and smudging). Unlike Urban Decay, it's not drying at all. I will definitely repurchase when I run out.

Stops creases, keeps makeup in place, very matte finish.  Goes on white, but you really can't see it once it's on.  Has lasted me a long time.  Works better than other bases I have tried (Laurea Mercier, Trish McEvoy, Clinique).
This product is ok-the trick is to let it dry before putting eye shadow on. I will not buy it again, but will go back to cream based eye shadow base.

sub category rank: 16 in Beauty & Personal Care > Makeup > Eyes > Eyeshadow Bases & Primers
300 in Beauty & Personal Care > Makeup > Eyes > Eyeshadow

Important_Info: NARS Smudge Proof Eyeshadow Base 0.05 ozNARS Smudge Proof Eyeshadow Base 0.05 ozNARS Smudge Proof Eyeshadow Base 0.05 oz
Product_Name: NARS Smudge Proof Eyeshadow Base

Category: Beauty & Personal Care › Makeup › Eyes › Eyeshadow Bases & Primers
Description: Preps your eyelid for smoother, longer-lasting and crease-proof eyeshadow. The lightweight liquid formula quickly absorbs into the skin for comfortable wear and increases eye color longevity.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Better than Urban Decay's Eye Primer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have very sensitive skin and this product was recommended to me by someone at Sephora. I like that it does not have parabens, preservatives and chemical dyes in this product. To apply, just swipe it over your eyelids and smooth out with either a brush or your pinky finger. It glides on very easily. With this product it allows my eye makeup to stay on longer.I have tried Urban Decay's Eye Primer. The ELF Eyelid Primer works just as well as the more expensive one.If you shop at Target, they have this product for $1. If you don't have time to go out shopping, $4 is a steal for this product that well deserves 5 stars.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: THE BEST thing ever for eyeshadow creasing after a long work day! NO MORE CREASES!! YAYAYAYAY!!!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: i've had issues with my eyeshadow creasing for years, i guess it's because i'm oily.  I layer my eyeshadows, but still, no matter the brand (expensive or cheap, mineral or cake) my eyeshadows are creased after an 8-10 hr work day...i hate it.  I bought this product to see if it would help the situation.  I HAVE HAD NO EYE SHADOW CREASING since....THIS IS AMAZING! my eyeshadow looks exactly as it did when i first applied it now  (even after 10-12 hours)....HOLY COW!!!!!!! i highly recommend this, you'll no longer have creases with this product!! THANK YOU!!!

My general eyeball area is pretty sensitive. I have had bad reactions to so many eye things, but so far this is doing me pretty good! I have never really used primer on my eyelids before, so my makeup has always been sweating off. I'm pretty oily, so I kind of expect this to happen, This keeps my eyeliner on as a perfect winged line. I do notice a little bit of creasing though when I wear eyeshadow. It wipes off pretty easily, I use Burt's Bees Oil Cleanser to take my makeup off and it wipes off clean. I'm a fan!It comes off kind of a sheer white when you first apply it, but once it is rubbed in you can't see any color anymore. I'm super pale too.

I love this primer and didn't think it would work as well as it did.There are 2 reasons why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 and that's 1. The cost. I've read reviews about it being only $1 at Target. Unfortunately for me, we don't have a Target where I live (Maui) I did see a 'out-of-stock' sign at Kmart for it a few times (never did see it in-stock.) The price there was only a dollar also.2. How do I use the rest of it? I feel like there's more product in the little bottle but I'm unable to use it all. The applicator doesn't give you much room to try and scrape the edge of the bottle. I've bought things similar to this but I've always been able to use about 95% of it. I feel like I've used about 50-60% of the bottle.I guess the price isn't too bad considering the mac primer is about $20 and drug-store brands are about $8. I just wish I could have got it for the price they sell it for in the stores.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Nice, but may cause an allergic reaction
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is a great idea for those who have deepset eyes (like mine) and have trouble getting my eye shadow to show up.  It was easy to apply and made the powder adhere well.However when I put it on and waited for it to dry, I began to feel a burning sensation on my eyelids.  I didn't see any redness, but it was uncomfortable just the same.  I am not an allergic person, but this was something that made me wonder what it is made of. The burning sensation lasted about 10 minutes, so beware of this possible reaction.

I've been looking for a cheaper alternative to NARS eyelid primer and this is definitely not it!  This is too dark (NARS goes on clear) and it is actually visible on the lid.  Eye shadow sticks to it and makes it difficult to blend, even after letting it dry for ample time.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Does NOT work on greasy eyelids!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was very excited for buying this but it was a total disappointment! Does not work, leaves stresks on eyelid and it is NOT long lasting. mAC eye primer does wonders compsred to this. I am very dissatisfied with the product, and believe me, I wanted it to work.

I have very oily skin and my eyelids stay oily as well. This primer does a good job holding on to my shadow for most of the day. I still need to touch up and reapply some shadow if I'm going out after work, but as oily as my skin is, that's really not asking too much. Be careful not to use too much primer or get it too high on your lid because it is visible, particularly if the shade doesnt match your skin exactly. I've used the high-dollar primers from Smashbox and Urban Decay, and this primer really does hold up just as well for a fraction of the cost.

I know this gets a lot of mixed reviews, but the elf primer works fine for me at preventing creases and keeping my eyeshadow in place and longlasting. I haven't tried any high end primers, so I can't compare to UDPP or TFSI, but I don't really feel the need to since elf does the job already. I use drugstore eyeshadows too. The elf primer does not make colours brighter, though.When I first started using it, the primer was a bit greasy feeling when applying, but that's stopped now, and besides there has been no effect or change in the way it performs. The tube hasn't dried either, and I've had this for over 6 months. I have used this on really humid hot days where the rest of my face makeup has pretty much sweated/melted off but my eye makeup looks as flawless as when I put it on. I have also used this on super long days, and it has coped with being on for 24 hours.Not bad at all for something so cheap. It's worth a try, I'd say.

I've purchased it twice, and I've been very satisfied with it. I run out of it relatively fast, but I use it daily. I've never really used the applicator, I usually use the applicator to put it on my fingertip then pat it in. I've used ( but not owned) elf's mineral eye shadow primer a couple of times and I like this one much better. It has a more oily consistency and I feel like it never dries. Maybe its better for loose powders, but I've never liked loose powder eye shadows.

Not a very effective eyelid primer. I used it several times, and I didn't notice any difference in how long my eye makeup would last. Also, it was much lighter than I expected, so it made my eyelids look paler than the rest of my face. It was also hard to apply.

I have tanner skin so I was a little worried that the "sheer" would not be as sheer as it portrays, however, this eye lid primer is pretty awesome.It actually goes on sheer believe it or not! When you first apply it it is like a light creamy rich vanilla color but once you blend it over your lid, it becomes invisible so you can freely apply your lid make up.So far I love it, I have tapered lids, so I have a bit of a problem with creasing make up, but once i apply this primer and my make up, my make up lasts for hours with no problem.Also, I use a lot of liquid eyeliner for my day-to-day look and with liquid eyeliner, it doesn't settle well directly  on the lid it needs something to "grab" like powdered eye shadow, but with the eyelid primer it grabs nicely with no added eyed shadow so I can go with a more casual look.Over all, I recommend.

Great Primer...but the bottle was half empty? I used it maybe 5 or 6 times and now I'm out! I LOVED this primer though. I have oily eyelids and that can cause issues with creasing eye shadow but the e l.f. Essential Eyelid Primer will fix that issue, I can now wear eye shadow all day long with no concerns. It feels so silky when applying it and that feels amazing. After you apply it, let it dry for about 30 seconds, then apply your shadow and your shadow colors will pop! I love this stuff, just wish the bottle was full but know I'm kind of grossed out thinking I used USED primer..EW!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Just as good as more expensive primers
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have been using Urban Decay eye shadow primer and have been pleased with how it works, although the cost is a little high in my opinion.  I ran across e.l.f. by accident and decided to try it since it's a fraction of the cost of Urban Decay.  It works perfectly indoors and outside in the heat, and I couldn't be happier.  I get .17 ounces of e.l.f. for under $4.00, but have to pay at least $16 for .34 of Urban Decay.  It's a no-brainer.Update:  I have read reviews by others for whom this product didn't work well.  If that's the case, you might want to try the darker "champagne" shade.  It seems to last a bit longer for some people than the sheer.
OK eyelid primer. Extends the wearability of eyeshadows for a few hours. Very sheer with a tiny bit of iridescence which allows for it to also be worn alone for a dewy finish to skin.
It is ok

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: But it does do a good job of priming the lid so that eyeshadow application ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This primer doesn't have a tint to it so it doesn't really mute the eyelid color which would make the eyeshadow color more vibrant. But it does do a good job of priming the lid so that eyeshadow application is smooth and free of creasing. You'll have to put concealer on the eyelids prior to priming for optimal use.
This primer makes my eyeshadow last all day. I am in the nursing field and I run around for eight hours sweating and this primer holds up! Only a dollar at your local Walmart though.
Love this! It helps my eye shadow from smudging and boy do I notice the difference if I forget to put this on. I will buy this again.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Super product! Not so sure about the "sheer" aspect, though.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I purchased this after reading rave reviews, and I have to say I agree with everyone-- this product is inexpensive and it WORKS. It's important, however, to make sure you don't get a crease in the product while waiting for it to dry on your eyelids. I found that applying the product and then using my blowdryer on the low cool setting dried my eyelids in less than 20 seconds. However, you do need to make sure to blend the edges. It highlights my lid and you can definitely see where the primer stops if you don't smudge it a little while it's still wet to blur the edges. Great product; seals my make up nicely!

The packaging was Perfect, they put the 6 different elf items I ordered together in a box and nothing was wrong at all :)I love elf always have, pretty cheap online or I can go to target and get things for a $1. Of course it's not the best out there but for the price it's amazing compared to spending hundreds on makeup when you can spend like $20 for several items that work just as awesome.  I love the primer, its a big help in my 100 palette I got on here from e.l.f which was only $10 bucks! Makes my colors last longer and makes the color pop! :) I would definitely invest in e.l.f products. For people who give negative reviews they must not know what they are doing :)

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Doesn't work very well, unless you use a lot of it.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It made my eyeshadow last throughout the day today, though I had to smear a lot of it on my eyeball for it to really do its job. If you're starting out with makeup, or you need something just simple and aren't going to be partying heavily, this should work for you. I need to also note that the applicator is a bit strange, you don't get hardly any product on it. All in all, not TERRIBLE. However, like other reviews have said, most Targets and other major retailers sell this for $1. I don't think it's worth much more than that. I'd suggest buying it there, saving a few dollars.

I will be honest--I purchased this with the simple intention of getting something cheap to help keep on my eye shadow.  Is this as good as the fancier and more expensive primers?  Nope--I've paid big bucks for something I went swimming in, for crying out loud.  But this primer does exactly what it is supposed to and provides a decent foundation for eye makeup.  Does it last all day?  No, but enough to last through work or a night out.  It glides on easily with no super greasy mess leading to shadow clumps. The sheer color blended in well.  No "primer look" here.  So, not as heavy duty as more intense products, but it's inexpensive and does its job.

This stuff is a good alternative to more expensive eyelid primers. It does keep color on longer, in my experience. But if I use it too many days in a row, it makes the eczema on my eyelids flare up. I've finally got that under control and I don't want to risk irritating it more by using products that aggravate it like this, but it's good on occasion.

Cheap product made in China. It's only $1 at Walmart. You get what you pay for. It doesn't help your eyeshadow stay on any longer than normal and it sure doesn't prevent shadow creasing. In fact I think it's a bit greasy so if you tend to have oily eyelids like I do don't expect this product to help. I am a make-up artist so I'm always looking for a good shadow primer. This isn't it...

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great primer for not so youthful eyelids!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I love this eyelid primer from Elf!  I bought a different one from Elf in a store and didn't care for it.  It was a stick and it was thick and hard to spread.  I have 45 year old eyelids that I try not to tug on so this sheer primer is perfect. It's easy to spread and then it dries.  It is so nice not to have creased eye shadow by the end of the day.  It make me look fresher with out the creased old looking eyelids.  The price is great too!  Definitely will buy again.

I learned about this product from a blogger that I follow. She claimed that this was her "emergency primer" and that it worked wonders for her night out. I immediately looked for it on here since I had been looking around for a decent/inexpensive primer anyway. I found it on here for an excellent price (under $4) and was a little hesitant to order it based on some of the reviews I read. I am glad I took the chance and bought it. It worked great! It wasn't heavy on my lids at all. I applied it, worked it into my lids, waited for it to set, and applied my eyeshadow as usual. It literally lasted all day and night. Not one crease and eyeshadow looked as if it was freshly applied the whole time. Well worth the investment!

I can not say just how much I do love this product! No complaints whatsoever! I've used one entire tube of it and purchased another one. It blends in well on your eyelids with no lumps or clumps, keeps your eye shadow on all day, and it prevents your eye shadow from creasing throughout the day. I'm glad that I gave this product a try, and it is definitely a continual repurchase! However, I did find this same product at K-Mart for .99 cents, but it was on sale, with that being said, I would still check in stores for sales or specials first before ordering it online.

My eyelids are extremely oily and don't hold eyeshadow or eyeline for more than an hour.  It's ridiculous.  When I saw this product, after trying SEVERAL others and getting used to the disappointment and wasted money, I decided to try this after reading the customer reviews.  Bracing myself for disappointment once more, I was blown out of the water!  This product is absolutely amazing and if it works for ME, I think it's safe to say ti will work for ANYONE.

This is my first primer I've tried and I love it. I have oily skin and always have a problem where towards the middle of the day my eyeshadow will start to cease and wear off, as well as eyeliner.  Since I started using this,  it doesn't crease or wear off at all! I don't have to worry about working or going out with eyeliner smudging or big clumpy crease from eyeshadow anymore!  Love it and definitely recommend =)

For primer, it works fine but only for a handful of hours.  I've found that when I'm out, this lasts maybe 4 hours before my eyeshadow starts coming off.  It's ok and I like that I don't have to use a lot, but don't expect it to last all day unless you're going to be indoors and air conditioned.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great essential makeup product for the price.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I really have nothing negative to say about this product. I don't wear makeup everday but when I do I always use this. Most drugstore and department store eye primers are around $10 to $20 each, while this one is $3 online and $1 at stores. It works and is a great value. Why pay more? Unless you are getting ready for a special event or are a brandname freak, just buy this for basic everday use. It can't be beat.

Well......  i recommend  you putting on a thin coat.  Dont just pile it on.But anyway....  i  put it on and it dried into a thin light film.  Which was cool.  But when i begin choosing  my eyeshadows to put on over it ..the primer started making my eyelid burn "slightly"  so  i just wiped the primer off.I guess if you have sensitive skin this isnt for you.  But if you dont  ..go for it.  Just make sure you start by applying a thin coat first.  I think thats all you would need anyway.  2  or more coats would make it look cakey.  This primer dries bulky.

I have REALLY oily eyelids, so I bought this. It DOES work. I put on cream eyeliner without it once and it smeared ALL over my lids. Then I tried it with this and it didn't really smear at all. I blame it only on how oily my lids are. It feels creamy and it does have a color to it but when it tries it looks transparent. I do recommend this!

This was my first time using/purchasing a primer. It really helped bring out the eye-shadow color. Texture is not so much as creamy(oily) but little does go a long way. If you have oily or combination , or even dry skin it won't do any harm for it sets on to the skin perfectly and doesn't leave a shine.

No where near as good as too faced or urban decay. My eyeshadow lasted about half the day, with no excersize, before it started creasing. It is priced according to its quality though. Maybe it's good for starters but not if you work a 9-5

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It looked cheap and like I'd but very light foundation on my eyes
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It was not "sheer" at all and did not blend in. It looked cheap and like I'd but very light foundation on my eyes. It also was very obvious under my eyeshadow.

Okay so we all know you can get this cheaper at any store but this is the best eyeshadow primer honestly, my eyeshadow pops more and also it stays on longer and doesn't crease so I would buy this again

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Primer works, but isn't completely sheer - Still good for the $$
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Here's the deal:  This eyelid primer works well, but it also isn't really sheer, i.e., it has a tint of beige to it so even if you don't wear any eyeshadow, this one makes your lids lighter in color.  Of course it not like the expensive stuff, but it works well for the girl on a budget who needs their eyeshadow to stay on longer or have more "pop" in color.

This is the first eyeshadow primer I've ever used on a regular basis and I love it. The color is very sheer and makes my eyeshadow last all day with no creasing. It has a silky feel to it and sets to tacky quickly which is great for those mornings when you're in a rush. The only downside to this product is that the packaging is a tan color so you can't see inside the tube and it seems like its not very full? I wish the packaging was clear so you would see the product inside but overall very nice item I would recommend to people just starting to use primer or for someone looking for a bargain.

This primer is thick, heavy, and feels like I'm putting concealer on my eyelids!  Isn't a primer supposed to go on smoothly, with a somewhat velvety texture?  This has none of those qualities. Also, the color is really light. It may be okay for very fair skinned people, but I looked ridiculous with it. I did nothing to keep eye shadow in place either.

I have bee wanting to try an eyeshadow primer but did not want to spend $15+ on one from Urban Decay and not see a difference. So I ordered this one!!! OMG, not only can I tell a differnece, in that the colors pop more and stay on longer, it was only .99 cents. I will certainly order more.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Blends like it was never there!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is great for girls with lighter skin. Goes and smooth and blends so well.!
It does exactly as it says! I've even gotten more compliments on my eye shadow now that it actually stays on. Such a good deal and came earlier than expected.
Brought better primers after this and this one did not do to good clump up on my eyes and even with me rubbing it in my eye shadows did not stay the entire day.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great product for a great price
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Always my favorite cheap primer. My shadows go on brighter & it lasts between 6-7 hours through the day.Price is always great. Worth the purchase even if it isn't your every day go to primer just to keep it on hand is a good idea.

There isn't a noticeable difference when using this primer around the eyebrows or under the eyes.  I bought it because it's was a fourth of the price of the M.A.C primer that I'm used to using.  It was a big mistake on my part because I thought I'd be saving money, but that's no the case.  I pretty much just wasted money because I don't want to go through the hassle of sending it back when I have an foreign address.  Please don't waste your money on this product.

I don't hate this product, but it seemed like it may have been old or sitting for a while as there wasn't much in the container, perhaps like it had dried up some. To me, it works more like a nice concealer on your eyelids than an "anti eye shadow creasing agent", but it's not terrible. I don't think I would buy it again though, mainly due to the dried out contents, not how well it works.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: DIDN'T WORK FOR ME WITH MY OILY EYELIDS!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: For me with my oily eyelids .. VERY creased by evening .. sorry!  Carefully applied .. but was interested to see if it would work alone or would require an additional layer of loose powder.  NOPE!  Alone it was VERY creased by evening.  Am not going to bother to use with layers of loose powder .. than can work with my current primer .. I was hoping for an improvement .. NOT just an equal or lesser!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This is a stunningly cheap and effective eyelid primer. ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is a stunningly cheap and effective eyelid primer.  There's no reason (imo) to pay twice or three times the price for the same effect.  My eyeliner (felt tip) doesn't run when I use this product.

My 9 year old daughter is on a competitive dance team.I use this when applying her make-up; and don't have to worry about re-applying! Eyeshadow stays put, but comes off easily at the end of the day. Before I found this, I would have to apply and reapply throughout the day. This year I've only had to touch-up once, and it was rainy and VERY humid that day!

I've tried quite a few eye primers, but this is by far the most inexpensive and great working one yet! I'm in high school and Im just busy all day, running around to classes, getting things done, but my makeup never creases with this, doesn't fade as easily, and the colors are so much more pigmented and vibrant. For how cheap it is, I really wouldn't confide in any other primer. Of course more expensive ones like Urban Decay work fantastic as well, but I don't have the means to purchase it as easily. I recommend this to any and all of my friends that look for a good primer :)

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It is the best one i tried
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I gave this one to my sister, but i'm currently using the one I bought before, and it is my absolute favorite primer. While all the other primers i tried were in this price range this one was the only one that worked. It keeps my makeup perfect the whole night, and that is not the easiest thing to do because i have slightly hooded eyes that get oily in the crease, so my eyeshadow always creases in a couple of hours. But not with this primer, it's great.

I LOVE this product! I've used other ELF products but never the primer, this is actually the first primer I've ever used so perhaps my opinion is a bit biased, but I really love this product. I used it today and my powder seemed to be more pigmented than usual and it stayed on all day with no fading or creasing. I highly recommend it, especially if you are on a budget. Peace.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Do not buy this if you are expecting a smooth ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Do not buy this if you are expecting a smooth long lasting primer prior to eye shadow.  Might as well stick a glob of foundation to your eye lids let that dry for a few minutes and then blend to where it's chunky/uneven and walla you got elf essential eyelid primer.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I like this product very much
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I like this product very much, goes on smooth, lasts all day and the price is great. I used to be able to buy it for a $1 at Target but they have stopped carrying it. This is still a good price for this product. Only downside is the very small quantity.

To tell the truth, I was running out of Urban Decay Primer Potion and needed a cheap, quick fix before I had the $20 to buy more. To my surprise, this stuff (in my opinion) works BETTER than UDPP! It is a bit thinner, like slightly lighter in consistency, but that didn't bother me. I put my makeup on at 5:30pm tonight, and it's 11:40pm now. My eyeshadow still looks as vibrant as it did when I put it on, and no creasing! I don't know if I got a bad sample of UDPP, but my eyeshadow would crease and fade within 3 hours when I used that. For this price and this quality, I am a new fan of this primer.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: it kept my eyeshadow on much longer and i love it!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It was just as expected!!! it kept my eyeshadow on much longer and i love it!!!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I'd probably buy this again for everyday wear
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I'm not particularly hard on my eye makeup, but I prefer that it stay where I put it in the morning.  This product has a similar consistency to the Urban Decay primer potion.  It's not an exact match and the performance is not identical, but if you're not putting your eye makeup through tough times, this might be a nice stand-in for those days when you don't need to call in the big guns.  This works perfectly well.  My shadows are easily blended, the color is perfect, and there is no creasing at 3:00 PM.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Moral of the story is, it's better to buy it from E.L.F.'s website rather than on Amazon..over priced!!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: So there's a dilemma with my product. While I DO in fact love it, I am utterly upset with Amazon! Over priced!!! For someone like me, who just knows the basics about makeup, I honestly thought that (since being an E.L.F. product) that the price was right. Well, it's not. IT ACTUALLY COST ***LESS*** MONEY than what you would pay buying this eyelid primer on Amazon. You might think "$4 dollars isn't much" but how would you feel it you found out you had just purchased this amazing stuff and little did you know you could of gotten it for $1 on their website.Message me for the link.It's THE exact one for dollars less!Ok, now to move on to the actual experience: Like many, I watched Youtube videos on makeup tutorials and have been raving about this eyelid primer from E.l.f. I read some reviews (on here and from the youtube channels) and was hooked. Now, I noticed that none had actually mentioned the price on the product, (which is why I thought Amazon's $4.00 was correct) but soon felt ripped off when come to find out it's one measly little dollar, as opposed to  Amazon`s price. Anyway, when my packaged arrived at the doorstep I quickly opened it up and began playing with my primer and my e.l.f. 100 shades palette. I found it rather thick at first.. almost like concealer, which I did not like. That is all I have to say so far. I will play around with it some more and keep you guys updated(:

This works amazingly I could put my makeup on at 6 in the morning & it still look like I had JUST put it on at 4 in the afternoon, very impressed. Very easy application & isn't to expensive! Definitely recommend this product!!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Best drugstore concealer on the market
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I honestly prefer this concealer over some of the high end brands version. I like to use it as a highlight and eyeshadow base, but using it that way will end up in you using a lot of product quickly. For the cost I think you get a fair amount but having more wouldn't hurt ;)
Love this product. My eyelids usually get oily but not when I use this. Great product for the price. Lasts a long time.

not the best ive had...when applied i find it gets white in color when dried then when i apply my eyeshadow the white is so hard to cover. i have to be dabbing alot of eyeshow just to conceal the primer it should not be like that.

Package arrived promptly. When I opened it up, the package around the concealer was completely open and taped back together. I have never tried this particular product, however it feels a bit light to me like some is missing. For the measly price of 3.00 plus free shipping I will not be returning it, but im skeptical of using it, and would not recommend you purchase

Excellent. I buy them 3 at a time. I wish they were bigger so they lasted longer but, I love this stuff and hope they never quit making it. I use it as my base color before I apply the darker ones and it gives a beautiful light color base and accentuates the other colors.

Honestly, when I read the reviews saying "my eye make-up lasts for the ENTIRE DAY" before buying this, I was doubtful. I thought it would hold the make-up just a little longer than usual. But after using this primer for over a week now, I totally agree with the previous positive reviewers. This light and sheer primer keeps my eye make-up from morning until after I get back home from work! No more smudgy, dirty eyelids in the afternoon at work! Plus, after putting it on, your eyelids look matte and dry, but it doesn't FEEL dry at all. I love this product.
I like the product. There isn't much product in the tube so it ran out quickly, but it was inexpensive, so I feel I got my monies worth.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: The BEST primer for your eyelids!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Do you hate having your eye shadow crease in the middle of the day? I sure do!I used to use L'oreal's version of eye shadow primer, and it was pretty good but SO hard to get out of the bottle because it was too thick. I can't even get it all out so I'm sure half of it is still in there.But then, I tried e.l.f. and it was 10X better. Comes out smooth and light feeling. A small amount is all you need to make your eye shadow last ALL DAY long.Highly recommended product.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This is a good cheap option for eye shadow primer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is a good cheap option for eye shadow primer. The one problem I ran into was that it creases after about 15 minutes of wear and had to touch up my eye makeup more than I expected.

I love this h thing. The only eyelid printer I've ever owned was cover girls photo ready eye primer and this was muvh better it doesnt take 5 minutes to pat on you just rub it on and your done. Much more convenient and its got a really nice creamy felling unlike covergirl thats alittle chalky plus its a great price . good for anyone with oily eyelids .
its a bit liquidy going on, but boy does it live up to its job. I haven't had my makeup disappear on me like it usually does.

The price on this is definitely worth it. I tried a few times to see if it really did do the job by putting the primer on one eye then shadow and the other eye just shadow. The one with the primer by the end of the day definitely left the shadow darker and less faded.  I do use my Nars primer for special occasions as that by far is the best but the cost is about 7 times as much.

I've been picking up e.l.f. products here and there lately, and do like most of what I've tried thus far. This product works very well as eyelid primer, but would suggest applying a light moisturizer first, as it can be slightly drying. (not what this 48 year old lady needs!) It gave a nice base color to my lids, and eye shadow did stay put longer. Additionally, this seller went above and beyond in making up for a delayed order - thank you!!

good product.  Hard to control the amount that I use and where it goes with this type of applicator.  However, once it is on good luck getting it off if you get a little in the wrong spot.  You practically have to wash it all off and start again. The product definitely works and I partly attribute my problems with the product to my own inexperience with it so I gave it 4 stars in stead of 3 or 5. As I said it definitely keeps your eyeshadow in place allllll day!!!!  That I love
I love ELF products! They're all I use on my skin, I use L.A. colors on my eyes
cakey and doesnt cover any veins on my eyelid

This is a good primer that makes a bunch of difference in the life of my eyeshadow.Recently, I bought a palate of eyeshadow for smokey eyes but couldn't use it well because the colors would all blend together by midday and just look purple or brown. This primer helps keep them separate and clear.Obviously it isn't perfect since it is on the cheaper end but it seemed like a waste to pay upward of $10 for a product I would not use daily. I am pleased with what I have gotten from this primer.

I was originally using my foundation as a primer, but it wasn't keeping my eyeshadow on for very long without it creasing or looking like crap.  So I invested in an e.l.f. primer.  It is a great product... my eyeshadow stays put all day and looks good.  I think it was reasonably priced too, under 5 dollars.  So that's always a plus, as brands such as urban decay's can be 20 dollars or more.  Wish it was bigger though, and fuller.  i think mine is about gone and I've only used it like 6 times.

While this primer is inexpensive, you get what you pay for.  I use MAC primer most of the time but was encouraged by my friends and finances to try this less expensive alternative.  It looks great upon application but its staying power is short lived.  Whereas my MAC primer enables my make-up to last a 12 hour shift, this left my eyeshadow dim and flaky after about 4 hours.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: My first eyelid primer- I like it!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I don't have the experience with eyelid primers so I can't compare, but I like this product! There doesn't however, seem to be alot of product in the tube. I have had it a short time and don't use it everyday but I still find myself having to dig around for the product. Price it right though and it works!
My favorite primer, and it matches perfectly with my skin. Going to be buying more of these.

New to the world of eyeshadow base, I don't know how I ever lived without it. My eyeshadow would always fade before I even left the house but NO MORE! Makeup stays where it's supposed to. No more dark lines on my upper lid from my eyeliner. Shadows stay put for the most part, maybe some subtle fading after a few hours, but a vast improvement from using no base at all. I definitely recommend.
I'm giving this primer only three stars because:  Even though it works ok it only seems like it's only half full at least

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: you get what you pay for
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Eh honestly I had higher hopes for this product. When I got it in the mail I thought it would go on thick and have a better prime but it was very thin and oily actually. Its ok but you do get what you pay for.

This is an affordable primer that does the job. I have very oily skin and I often find my eye shadow running into the crease of my eyelid by midday. This primer definitely helps keep my makeup in place. I wear contacts and it doesn't bother my eyes.

Was very excited to use this eye primer, but FRESH OUT OF THE PACKAGE the tube was practically empty. There was enough product to apply only once, and it did not dry smoothly. Also dried too quickly and did not allow me to apply pencil eyeliner. Very disappointed.

Awesome product for the price...by the end of my 10 hr shift, wearing eyeshadow approximately 14hrs a day, I had no creases in my eye makeup.  It goes on in the color of the primer, but doesn't change the color of the eyeshadow you are applying.  Would highly recommend!!
I really like this primer. It makes my liquid eyeliner last all day! I even use it as a concealer and it works so well for that! However the color is a little to light for my skin.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: A bit disappointed. Wishing I would've bought from a more reputable ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: When I received it in the mail I immediately opened it excited to try it out. When I went to apply it, it was a bit dried up and had some hard chunks throughout. A bit disappointed. Wishing I would've bought from a more reputable seller.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Bought one for all three of my teenagers!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: After I tried this-and really liked it-I bought it for all three of my teenagers. It works great! I think it is just as good as Too Faced. They have it for a dollar at Target, which is where I got more. It is flesh toned and really held my eyeshadow all day. I have sensitive skin and it did not burn or cause any discomfort. No smell either. Great bargain!

It shipped fast, that was great, but it is a really small bottle, there is much primer in it (I got about 10-12 applications out of it) and it doesn't really work all that well, does not make the eye shadow pop like primer is supposed to. Really disappointed by this one, I really love ELF products. All in all, just buy a cake of Ben Nye white creme foundation. Works way better, stays on better, and you get more uses out of it.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: The primer itself was nice, but trying to blend shadows was a bit ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: The primer itself was nice, but trying to blend shadows was a bit more challenging. Unlike many of the other primers I've used, this still ceased when it came to wearing eye shadow throughout the day. Those who are just looking for a primer for a small/short event, this one is pretty decent.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: 4/5 Only bc you can get it cheaper directly from E.L.F.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Great lid primer that keeps shadow and liner going all day and all night. Lightweight formula that great for all skin types. I bought here bc the e.l.f. site was out of stock at the time, but it is cheaper to buy directly from them.
Good stuff, but better to buy direct from site. For the price, it is high rating. However, you don't want to over apply it, as it gives a crust, caked on look - which adds age.

The only elf product I like. I have oily lids so by  mid day my eye shadow is basically gone. This solves the problem. I use it everyday and one of these last me for up two months. Before this,I used the urban decay one and honestly they both last the same amount of time so I usually go for elf since is so cheap and good.

As I have gotten older I have started having problems with my eye shadow creasing. I found this cheap alternative to Urban decays potion primer to be a great asset to my make up collection. And its easy to find in your local Target store for just a little over a buck.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I'm baffled that this product even has negative reviews! ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I'm baffled that this product even has negative reviews! The price is cheap and it does exactly what an eyelid primer should do: keep the color on without the shadow creasing for a loooong time. Before, my eyeshadow would be gone by 3-4 hours. Now, even if the eyeshadow is very minimal, it stays on for the entire day.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Dries before you can rub it in
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It is NOT sheer. It dries very quickly and it's white. It took 3 seconds to dry before I could even rub it into my eyelids, so I had dots where I had applied this product and it's hard to wash off. Not very good quality.
Great product!  I have found you can get the same results with Covergirl concealer.  Just a side note!!!

I had never used primer before and I got this one to try it. The primer worked, but the reason for the two stars is that; the primer looks some what old, it's thick and in my case it seems to have less then half the primer in the bottle. I'm sure if the bottle was clear we could really see how much is inside. I did like this primer, but I won't be buying it anymore, its not wroth the 3 bucks. When I get less then half a bottle.
Its a good product... At least while ot lasts. It lasted me only 6 days. Its a waste of money overtime and I wouldnt buy this if I were you. Look into investing i na higher quality primer.
There was barely ANY product in the bottle. Very disappointed as this was my first elf product and obviously I'm in no way impressed.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: My eyeshadow stays on all day now!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I am extremely happy with this product. (btw i did buy it off of Amazon though i found out recently you can buy it at Target for $1) It is very liquidy at first but after you rub it in its fine. It really does work. Once you start wearing this with your eyeshadow you will never go back to the expensive brands. It makes my powder or my cream eyeshadow last all day. I am very impressed. I am so going to buy more of this Asap. This product is Amazing!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Excellent product - all Elf cosmetics go beyond those name ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Excellent product - all Elf cosmetics go beyond those name brands that cost 4x as much.  Elf brushes are TOPS.  They come small but then the price is very small.  The packaging goes far beyond the tops named cosmetic brands AND every package has clear directions.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: You get what you pay for.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: e.l.f. Essential Eyelid Primer worked decently for the price I paid for it, but it only lasted a couple of weeks before it ran out.  There is not a lot of product in the package, and you have to use a decent amount each time for it to be effective.  Ultimately, I decided a higher-end product would be better instead of replacing this primer with another e.l.f. primer.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Id rather pay more for a better product
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is horrible. It's a lot lighter than my skin tone and I'm pale. If you don't rub it in as soon as you apply it, it won't spread at all and it dries on the spot.

I love this product. I use it everyday. I didn't have high hopes with it being so cheap, but since I've never used a product like this I figured I'd start cheap. I don't know how it compares to more expensive products but this product does what it says it will do and hasn't failed me yet. My only suggestion is when using it is wipe the primer from the wand to your finger tip. The wand is a little hard to use for me. I HIGHLY SUGGEST!
Works great and makes my eyes look lighter. I love it. The only thing that I disliked is that I wish the container was bigger and would last longer!

I have oily eyelids, and use primer daily before applying eyeshadows and eyeliners. For ELF primer, my eyelid was creasing and oily after a few hours. Also seemed like not much liquid was in the bottle, very light!I've tried 2 Faced primer, and that really lasts all day with no creasing and non-oily lids even in hot days of summer.

Perfect as an inexpensive eyelid primer. When I ran out I've tried regular face concealer and it would just crease my eyeshadow && not keep my colors as vibrant && long lasting as this product! This a definite product !! Go buy it ! You will not regret it ! Perfect for every skin color && skin type .

Makes a huge difference. The crease in my lids almost always ruins my makeup after a few hours, but this stuff kept it looking like new until I took it off myself at night. Definitely worth the price.

I bought this because it was only 30 cents and it had mostly good reviews but after putting 2 dabs on each lid, my shadow lasted from from 7 o clock this morning until 11 o'clock at night. It usually only lasts a couple hours with me being notorious for forgetting im wearing makeup and wiping my eyes. This was so good I ordered 3 more while the price was still low. Definite buy!

After reading the reviews online I was expecting this product to be awesome and-then-some. But the consistency was too watery and I often found myself having to mix it with one of my thicker liquid foundations to even see a difference. Don't get me wrong, the price is right, but I think I was just expecting more because of all the awesome reviews.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Will buy again and suggest to friends
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I love this primer the applicator is perfect and the directions are simple. I work in a very active and sweaty environment and my eyeshadow still stays on thru 10 hours of sweating!! I'm highly satisfied!

I love this stuff.I never have problems with my eyeshadow getting creased anymore. I just swipe some of this on, do my eyeshadow, and 12 hours later, it still looks perfect.Only thing - this primer is a little runny, so however much you think you need, cut that amount in half.Gah. I just love it.

It really dry and chalky skin. Basically, the price is equal to the quality of this product. When I added in the product it was liquidy but then when I blended it into my eyelid it suddenly came out chalky, chap, dry, and flaky. I definetly recommend if you buy something a bit more high end
Never Used A Primer.  Great Results!!!!!
I love elf products,but this one had like a burning sensation on my skin

I got the primer 3 days early! I used it right away. I was going to camp, and I did sweat a lot! My eye makeup never came off! By the end of the day, it has been 8 hours and I checked to see my eye makeup. I got a *tinsy* bit of smearing in the crease, but i didnt mind. I rather pay for this than what i used to pay ($28) for my urban decay primer potion...

I've only had this eyelid primer for a little while but seems to work better at keeping my eyeliner and eye shadow on (less smearing) than not wearing the primer so I suppose its job.  I still think MAC's eyelid primer from 2 years ago was the best (went on dryer but kept makeup in place and stayed that way versus the e.l.f. seems to stay creamy until it dries).
Works good, but doesn't come with very much in it! Worth it for how cheap it is
Bad consistency. As a makeup artist I always give new products a shot, but will avoid their products going forward. It is very dry and cakey. Not easily applied at all.

I recently bought this and tried it out for the first time. It's the first eyelid primer I've used. So, I don't have much expertise on the subject. However, the colors remained vibrant, and it didn't wash out--not even when water was accidentally splashed onto my face!!! My cleanser was able to wash it out when I got home though, which I was glad about. I'll definitely be buying this again when I run out.
I have ALWAYS had trouble with my eye shadow creasing.  I have put this to the test.  Humidity, drizzle, normal wear and tear and it holds up.  I will never wear eye shadow again with out it.

I've always been told that if you save your money for anything having to do with makeup to save it for a primer...well I didn't exactly save, I purchased this on a gift card, the shipping was fast, as always with Amazon, I liked the product and it did what it claimed (keep my eye makeup in place for a day).I feel like I may have wasted my money on this because for me it did exactly what dabbing a little foundation on my eyelids already does by itself, so maybe try that trick before you decide to actually buy a separate eye primer, I would recommend this to people who either take time and are very elaborate when putting on makeup or for those who have extremely oily eyelids and makeup just does want to stay put.e.l.f. eye primer has a very creamy substance, only a small amount is needed, and it gives the eyelids a matt finish, if you want more shine or shimmer then go with this primer in another shade (I believe there are other shades).One of two things I prefer to use this eye primer for is to put a small amount under my eyes before applying my foundation because it looks like I'm awake and alert. The second thing I absolutely love to do with this eye primer is to create a very fresh, natural, soft, dewy look, it blends beautifully with other products to help create this look.Otherwise, as I said, I highly recommend this for anyone who is elaborate in the way they put on eye makeup or anybody whose eyelids are incredibly oily and eye makeup doesn't stay in place. Give putting a small amount of foundation on the lids a try first though.
Works great and the price is great too.

I have really greasy eyelids. .. neeeever been able to wear eyeshadow without it creasing within about thirty to forty five mins,  UNTIL this product!!!As long as you don't apply gobs and you let it dry all the way it works as described. I've used this for years. Always works :)

This is a good product. I am older and hoped it would make my eye shadow look better and it does!! It goes on  easily and a little goes a long way. Then put the eye shadow on top of this product. My eye shadow goes on much easier.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It didn't work great on me
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It didn't work great on me. I probably need something more advanced dueto my age. I'm sure this product works good on younger people.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Excellent - I use on my eyes and lips
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I love ELF primers. I have this eyelid primer which I use on my eyes and my lips before putting on my liner and gloss. And I also use ELF Face primer, my makeup stays on all day just perfectly.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: On the description of the product it states the primer ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: On the description of the product it states the primer is sheer, however it is not. It is actually white and is not sheer at all.Whether it works at keeping my eye shadow on longer,  I don't know if it actually does.
finally a decent primer to lighten eye area and leave a base for shadow.bets my Clinque, and other high end primers!
Great primer, really works well. Only issue I've come across and I've seen other reviewers with the same issue: way too little product. I've used it a handful of times and it's already gone.
Works great to keep my eyeshadow on. My eyelids are very oily. Keeps the shadow from sliding off.

The primer does work for a night out or so, I dab a little and blend it with my finger tips. However, I tried using it for work, but at the end of the work day, the shadow just does not look the same. I don't know, maybe it could be the hot temperatures during the day, before lunch time it looks ok, but somehow afterwards it changes.. It works fine at night..

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: For the price this is great!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I do makeup and hair for a living and this product is great. It keeps your eyeshadow on all day and when you're putting eyeshadow on it stays on and allow you the freedom of being creative with bright colors. I'm very fair skinned so if you have tan or darker tones it may be too light.

First of all, the product doesn't even come in its full container. My primer came about 1/4 of the way full. I don't recommend using it because it only dried out my eyelids, making my eye shadow look clumpy and uneven.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I FINALLY FOUND WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is the perfect purchase.  It is exactly what I have been looking for and was unable to find.  Then I looked here and VIOLA, there it was!!  I am very pleased and satisfied with this product.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: WOWEE THIS STUFF IS DA BOMB
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: i bought three of these for VERY CHEAP off of amazon- 60 cents for three!  the texture when i first got it was a little chunky/creamish but after i swished the applicator thing a few times it became more creamy.  the color might look a bit strange at first (it appeared orange when i opened the bottle!) but after i blended it out on my hand to test it out it looked fine.  the color actually appeared more pale on my eyelids (i have asian yellow skin that has a slight cool pink tone)I do not have the urban decay primer potion, but i will probably not buy it because this does a great job of making the eyeshadow stay!  i used l'oreal infallible eyeshadow in amber rush and the result was beautiful!Pros:-cheap cheap cheap!-adequate amount of product for the money-creamish texture, goes on eyes easily-dries nicely-holds eyeshadows SUPERBLY-eyeshadow will not budge after applied!!-no weird smell-does not make eyeshadow ball up on applicationCons:-doe foot applicator might be a pain for some people-weird color at first-might reduce the shimmery quality of some eyeshadows, as it did with the infallible amber rush i used, but the difference was minimalFinal verdict-This eyelid primer is wonderful.  It goes on smoothly and makes my eyeshadow last all day without touch-ups.  I did have a slight problem with creasing after about 6 hours, but it was minimal.  The shimmer quality of some eyeshadows might be reduced a TINY bit, but with matte eyeshadows this works WONDERFULLY.If the price for 1 bottle of this primer exceeds $1 on amazon.com, go to target to buy!

The problem with the primer (and possibly all primers, I've never used one before this one) is that it makes the whole area you cover with it the color of the primer, so you have to apply eye makeup to that whole area. I also couldn't really tell a difference between when I wore it and when I didn't.

I'm a bit disappointed as this seems to do nothing for me. I wanted to start wearing primer and not spend too much on a trial hence I bought this... but now I guess I should spend my money on the better brands to get actual results.

I had never used an eyelid primer before but my eye shadow always creased by the end of the day so I wanted to see if this would help. It helps immensely. No more creasing. Goes on smooth lasts all day. I am an eyelid primer believer now. I was also happy with the price & the fact that E.L.F is cruelty-free. Love this product & will continue to buy.
This works well, especially considering the price. I put it on early in the morning before school, and at night when I take it off, my eyeshadow still looks great.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It was not hard to apply but I had to ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: It was not hard to apply but I had to use my finger to spread it on because using the wand applies to much.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: There Wasnt So Much Product In This
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: When i first got this i was suprised of how small this was. I was expecting this to be a little bigger. But that dosent bother me much. What had really bothered me was that there wasnt so much primer in the bottle. I was displeased and upset. I was hoping that mine would be full. I had read other peoples reviews and I was hoping that mine didnt come half empty. But it did ): ):
Works as described and it even smells good.
Compared to Urban Decay it is too watery and sheer but easy to apply and gets the job done.

Honestly for being E.l.f. and for the price I didn't expect much, but truth be told this primer makes Ny eyeshadow stay on much more longer than usual! I actually am very impressed. Only down.side is that because I have really oily lids it rubs off easily. A waterproof primer would be very appreciated. I think this is water based....

It works as it is supposed to, but I think I may be allergic to it? I wore it every day the first few days I had gotten it, and my eyelids got all red and flaky. SO now I only wear it every few days, which seems to work better.

It's amazing! I put it on before applying liberal amounts of eyeshadow in the morning, went to the park, was out in the sun for several hours. I went to a party that night, all the while not needing to worry about my makeup. I zonked out without taking my eye makeup off, and the next morning my makeup had not budged. This primer is fabulous, cheap, and worth every penny.

There's a certain way you have to put it on and if you don't then eyeshadow comes out streaky or faded. When using this my makeup has never creased though and when applied just right colors are vibrant and even stay on while I sleep. You can't put it on too thin or your makeup will look faded and if you put it on too thick it looks cakey. I recommend putting a dab on with the applicater then using your own makeup brush to spread it (Concealer or eyeshadow brush work well). Also while drying keep your eye closed or it will move up to the crease and makeup will show more there when applied. All around it does do the job but I wouldn't recommend for a beginner.
