Consumer_Reviews.review_title: There Was No Product in Tube
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was astonished when I tried to use the primer for the first time and there was nothing in it...brand new from original package!!

I've always had very oily eyelids- whenever I tried to wear eyeshadow, it would begin creasing before I was even finished putting it on. I considered trying Urban Decay's or Two-Faced's eye primer, but didn't want to waste $18 on a product that might not work. So I bought e.l.f.'s essentials eyelid primer, cheap enough that I wouldn't feel guilty if I threw it out.I had very low expectations for this primer when I first tried it, but WOW. It worked like a dream! Just a bit dabbed on in the creases and on the rest of my eyelids, and the eyeshadow stays put. The last time I used it, I applied grey and black eyeshadow at 4 pm to see exactly how well the primer would hold up. At 2:00 am, the eyeshadow looked the exact same as they had 10 hours ago-- and not the tiniest hint of creasing! I'm completely in love. I only wish that the tube wasn't so tiny and had more product, but with it costing less than $1.50, reordering won't be a problem.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Urban Decay Primer Potion Dupe Alert!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I decided to try this product before the Urban Decay Primer Potion to save some money. A few years later I still keep coming back! This product is practically the same, if not better, than the UD primer. I love the soft application brush and it goes on so smooth.

I have just now got into messing with eye shadow and creating looks. Normally eye shadows dont last long so I ordered this primer as well as an Eye pallet from Shany make up. I just received both in the mail so I instantly started playing with it. I used the primer before the eye shadow and tried to take it off so I could try some different color eye shadow and it took a little bit to get the eye shadow off. I can only assume that this will make my eye shadow last for a long time! It was a little liquidy but if you put it on your eye and then rub it in with your finger is all works out!!! They say you get what you pay for. I honestly think I got more than what I payed for :) I love it!

Yes--buy for a buck at Targee (although if you buy 3 at a time on Amazon the price drops to less than $2 apiece and not all Targets carry this e.l.f product)..  I've tried maybe ten brands.  Most of the expensive department store ones are heavy and tinted, sort of like foundation or under eye concealer. Besides costing a fortune, they are definitely not for older eyes--they accentuate every crevice and wrinkle.This e.l.f product is consistently my favorite--it goes on light with almost no color, does not emphasize wrinkles, and stays on all day.  Most companies tell you to wear it with colorless powder although almost none of the reviews mention that.  I do think it works even better if you powder first but I understand that doing so adds another step and more expense.BUT if you powder first you have a lot more control putting on powdered eye shadow--it's much harder for the eye shadow to go on unevenly (and really if you're going to all this trouble then get a good magnifying make-up mirror and you'll see what I mean).  If you have oily eyelids (or you put other products on your eyelids first) powdering is essential.  (And yes, I've tried powder alone and it helps but the combination is amazing.)The only thing that comes close is another cheap one--NYX creme that comes in a jar.  It goes on whiter but sort of fades (that's good)..My major complaint with the e.l.f product is that so little comes in each tub--and all that packaging is deceptive and wasteful. I travel a lot and I always carry two in my make-up case because if you're gone for a week, one can easily run out.  And I only use the sponge brush as an initial applicator--I still have to use my finger to even out the product.

!!!Just want to put it out there that I did not buy this product from this seller, I purchased it from Wal-Mart!!!I use this product to prime my eyebrows when I fill them in and it works sooooo good!  Without primer the product on my eyebrows would look shiny and too dark. It seem like no matter what shade of brown I used on my eyebrows it always comes out too dark on my skin tone.Well I was watching a YouTube video on eyebrows and a Guru used this primer for her brows and hers look great. I went to Wal-Mart and bought it for myself and it has made sooooo much of a difference. When I fill my brows in it just looks so natural and smooth and they dont look dark. I work 3rd shift from 11pm to 7am as a cocktail waitress and after my shift my eyebrows are still in tact with no touch up or fading. I've had days I would come home from work and go to bed without washing my face (i know that's gross), and wakeup to my eyebrows looking the sameway they looked when I filled them in 20 hours ago. I swear this has been a game changer for me I highly recommend it for eyebrows!!!!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: What came out of the tube dried into flakes
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Let me start by saying that I usually love e.l.f. products, but not this one.I thought maybe I was putting it on with too heavy a hand, so today I was very careful, used a light touch, and smoothed it with a foam tipped application brush.  When I went to apply make-up over it, I saw what I thought was a speck of tissue paper or a bit of a cotton puff.  No--the primer had dried into flakes, just seconds after I'd put it on.  And it wasn't easy to get the flakes off either.Now, it's entirely possible that I got a tube that had been around since 2007, but for me, no more of this brand of eye-lid primer.

If you had asked me three months ago whether or not I recommended this product, I would've said yes.  However, now that I've had some time to use it, I have some reservations.A point in its favor is that it is one of the least expensive eyelid primers out there.  It's easy to apply, thanks to the applicator, and it dries fairly quickly.  And it has worked well for me with some eyeshadows (most notably, an "ML Collection" palette I bought here on Amazon).  It's also non-irritating; I wear contact lenses and have sensitive skin, and this product doesn't bother me.However, and this is something I find quite odd, it doesn't work very well with e.l.f. eyeshadows.  I've tried it with several different eyeshadows from a 32 color geometric palette from e.l.f. and I got creases with every color by mid-afternoon.  I also tried it with the e.l.f. mineral "naked" palette eyeshadows and got creases.  The creases usually didn't appear until mid-afternoon, so I guess maybe this just isn't very long lasting.Also, for what it's worth, this is inexpensive, but there doesn't seem to be very much product in the tube.Bottom line: this may work with some eyeshadows.  It doesn't work with all of them, though.  It's probably worth buying a tube to check out with your favorite eyeshadow, because if it works, it's definitely one of the most economical primers around.

I ordered this, because I was looking for something to stop my eyeshadow from creasing without denting my wallet unnecessarily. I've been using this for a couple weeks now, and it works for me. I put a couple light dabs on each eye and rub it in with my finger.The sheer is a couple shades lighter than my skin, but I rub it in a bit so it's only a shade lighter. I like how it sort of sets up my eyeshadow and makes it pop a bit more. I also use a bit under my eye to lighten that up as well. After rubbing it in, I wait for it to set while I get my eye makeup out (eyeshadow, mascara, etc.), so usually only about a minute. I try to keep my eye shut, so my eyelid isn't creasing, but cracked enough so I can see. My eyeshadow lasts all day at work without creasing and without any touch-ups. My eyeshadow might be a bit more dull than when I first apply it, but I haven't been paying attention to that, just the creasing, and in that regard, I've been perfectly satisfied!I gave this 4 stars, because it has a strange smell to it. You can't smell it when it's on your eye, but it's something that can be improved. It's minor to me, so I'd really give it 4.5 stars. The major part was getting my eyeshadow to stop creasing, which it did, but the smell might bother you if you know you're picky about that kind of stuff, so just warning you. Overall, I'm definitely going to buy this again.

This product is amazing and as always I LOVE using e.l.f products. I love purchasing everything of theirs. It goes on smoothly and easy, and its great especially if you have oily eyelids like I get at times. I usually apply this and wait about 5 minutes to give it time to dry before I apply any eye makeup. But after that, the eye makeup applies smoothly and lasts so much longer and the colors seem to be more vivid and pop more. And given that my eyelids are oily and I sweat, I don't lose my eye makeup with this on, and it can last for hours. I've not had to reapply this multiple times, so I'd say it lasts quite a long time. And for the price, you just can't not have this in your makeup bag. I order this every chance I get, and trust me I've tried every kind of eyelid primer out there and this is the only one that's worked the best for me.

I was home all day and decided to see what this product can actually do. Does it really make a difference? Well I'm here to tell you ladies that it does! Just a dab, spread around the eyelid makes a world of difference! I put it on one eye and applied the exact same eyeshadow to both eyes (so one eye has the primer and shadow, whereas the other only has shadow). Right away, the eye with primer looked smoother and the color looked richer. By the end of the day, the eyeshadow on the eye without primer was oily and slightly creased. The eyeshadow on the primer eye was just as bold, smooth, non-oily, and non-creased as when I put it on hours and hours ago. I highly recommend and suggest you buy this product if you wear eyeshadow.

I ordered this several months ago and used it for over 5 months while in Europe. It worked miracles. It helped keep my eye shadow fresh all day even when I was sweating with high humidity in the middle of hot summer days. No creases or streaks. I'm back online right now ordering another tube for this winter. Next time I just might order the 3 pack which is very economical. I had no issues with this primer at all and would recommend it to anyone who uses eye shadow and want it to last all day.UPDATE:  I doubt if I will be ordering any more of this product on amazon because I just found out that Target Stores carry this (drum roll please)...........for ONLY $1.00 each. So, check your local Target store. You can see the price advertised on their website, but they only sell in stores. So, you can buy 3 of these for $3.00 and stock up.UPDATE 1/2/2014:  I went to Target, and I can confirm that these are just $1.00 each. I purchased 3 as planned. Can't beat the price. Also, you may have to really search for these, because they were not stocked with the other ELF products, but they were stocked nearby hanging on a peg near ground level with some other brands. The inventory number for these at Target is #052-03-0605, so if you can't find them just provide the number to one of Target's associates, and they will help you. Enjoy!

I tried this (purchased it at Walgreen' about a year ago) and it SUPER SUCKED....it was greasy and just sat on top of my skin, if I tried to blend it I mainly succeeded in wiping it off. Once I finally got it applied I waited a few minutes before applying any eyeshadow, to give it a chance to set or dry or whatever. Then, I applied my eyeshadow. I thought that if anything I would use less shadow than usual because primer is supposed to make your shadow appear brighter and make your eyes "pop" right??? So I began applying my eyeshadow sparingly at first but wound up using well more than I usually would because the primer seemed to suck all the pigment out of it and make it appear diluted and faded. An hour after I finished applying my makeup I checked my face in the mirror before leaving the house and found that my eyeshadow looked HORRIBLE...the little bit that was still clinging to the outer edges of my eyes and bunched up in my crease did anyway. The rest of it was gone. Where did it go? I can't say for sure. Perhaps the e.l.f. Essential Eyelid Primer ate it. I took that stuff out of my makeup bag and I buried it at a crossroads at midnight just to be sure. I like my eyeshadows and I didn't want them to be devoured.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: A very good product for a low price.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is my first Eyeshadow/Eyelid primer. I am pretty happy with it, I don't have a lot of vibrant and high end eyeshadow so I'm not sure how well it brightens up those. I'll update this when I do ;p.It does do a very good job at keeping eyeshadow from creasing and fading, I have a huge issue with eyeshadow creasing and kind of 'pooling up' between my eyelid and brow bone, this helps quite a bit with that, I've used it for about a month now and I've had no creasing, just smooth, long lasting shadow.It also does wonders for eyeliner, it prevents it from fading or getting smudged off, or getting crackly at the corner of my eyes, it last all through the day, it's even lasted through naps un-smudged and I roll around a lot when I sleep.It kind of smells weird in the bottle though, it has that funky fruity cereal smell, But when applied and dried it doesn't smell.I also read from previous reviews that some people had dried out products when they ordered them, I had no such problem and the product was fresh and not dry.Overall, should you buy it? Yes! if you can't afford UD's primer potion or Too Faced's Shadow Insurance I think this would be a good dupe. Should you buy it online? No, you should get it at Target if your store carries it! It's only a dollar.Pros:-Lasts all day.-Prevents eyeshadow creasing.-Prevents eyeshadow fading.-Keeps eyeliner nice looking all day, creasing, cracking or smudging.-A little goes a long way, an extremely good deal for a low price.-E.l.f. conducts no animal testing!Cons:-Smells like funky fruit cereal in the bottle.-More expensive to buy online.-Some people (In previous reviews) had products arrive dry and unusable, I'm not sure if this is an issue anymore, but people should be aware when purchasing.

This did nothing for me.  I gave this to my younger sister and went back to my Urban Decay Primer Potion.  I don't expect this product to beat Urban Decay, but it did NOTHING for my oily lids.  It wasn't really sheer on me either.  I'm sure this product may work for some people with dry or normal skin, but my oily lids need taming and UD Primer Potion does the trick.  I learned my lesson and I won't buy a cheap alternative again.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: and while this may not be advertised for this purpose it works GREAT!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: read a review in a magazine looking for a product that can set my mascara as I usually find my mascara under my eyes at about 4:00 PM ever day, and while this may not be advertised for this purpose it works GREAT!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: okay so a little bit goes a long way when ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: okay so a little bit goes a long way when applying this. All you need is to apply a small amount on your eye lids because the sheer color give you a blank lid. So putting to much on makes your eyelids kinda white. Also blend it fast because it drys quick. It does make your eyeshadow and liner last longer. I been using it in this 90'F weather and though I sweat it lasts.

I’m not a big spender when it comes to makeup. I buy expensive foundation because I can’t match my own color very well, but that’s about it. The rest of the stuff I buy is from Target. I came upon this E.l.f. primer. I have used an expensive primer in the past that I’m comparing it to, but I forget which brand (I got it at a department store makeup counter).The Elf primer goes on well, you have to even it out with your fingers. This one is completely sheer, but I also bought it in “pearl”. The consistency is a little less smooth than the more expensive one I’ve used, but it’s not a deal breaker for me. What I LOVE is that my eye shadow adheres great to it, comparable to the department store one. The shimmery eye shadow I wear would always have a hard time staying on and it would end up falling off quickly. This has really helped it stay put all day. I love the sheer one for my brown and natural colors. I use the pearl primer if I want to do something more colorful and vibrant (which is rare, but I did use it to blue and green up for the superbowl). Pearl gives me almost a white paper, blank canvas effect. It works great for bold. I lean more toward browns and natural, which the sheer is great for.Like others have said, Target has stellar prices on their E.l.f. products, so if you live close to a store that’s a great place to buy them. I did like the more expensive one better, but again I really pick and choose what makeup I spend my money on, it’s usually foundation and powders that I splurge on, the other stuff I don’t mind going cheap on. Primer is just something under my makeup and this one does the job just fine.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: better than my high end primers
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This primer may fall short next to the higher end Urban Decay brand, but for the most part it still gets the job done if not even better. I have naturally oily eyelid so it does smudge and crease a bit throughout the day especially if it's hot, but overall this product gives you a bang for your buck.Such a great concealer great for hiding those red pimples, I recommend 100%. Also buy it at your local target for 1$, in amazon its really overpriced.Thats the only reason for 4 stars, its not for the product but for the price on amazon

This stuff is amazing. I got it at Target for $2. I never wear makeup except concealer and occasionally eyeliner. Eyeshadow always creases shortly after I put it on because I have oily skin and my eyelids are especially oily. I put this stuff on first and the eyeshadow didn't crease. After 5 hours, I just had the tiniest line in the crease. It lasted a very long time with no reapplying. I took the wand and put some on and spread it with my ring finger. It has a wonderful satiny, powdery feel to it. Not oily or lotiony or anything like that. It's very nice. I will definitely buy this again. I got it in pearl. I like it. You could even wear it without eyeshadow.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Too thin/watery for a solid base
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I took the advice of other reviewers and got this at Target for $1 even. I'm not impressed. It's very watery and doesn't coat the eyelid enough for a base, especially if you need good coverage (I do because my makeup creases otherwise). I bit the bullet and got some MAC paint pot instead...it's much more expensive, but will last a lot longer (this tube is seriously so tiny) and is quality and thick.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Super product! Not so sure about the "sheer" aspect, though.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I purchased this after reading rave reviews, and I have to say I agree with everyone-- this product is inexpensive and it WORKS. It's important, however, to make sure you don't get a crease in the product while waiting for it to dry on your eyelids. I found that applying the product and then using my blowdryer on the low cool setting dried my eyelids in less than 20 seconds. However, you do need to make sure to blend the edges. It highlights my lid and you can definitely see where the primer stops if you don't smudge it a little while it's still wet to blur the edges. Great product; seals my make up nicely!

Elf eye primer went on nicely and my eye shadows set nicely over it, however after several hours there were oily looking creases and the shadow gunked up.I tried adjusting the amount I applied and use my own brush etc..then it just looked as if my shadow faded away completely and I was left with eye liner only.I guess if you can make it work for you then it's an unbeatable price.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: My eyeshadow looks just like it did when I applied it
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I bought this on a whim. I have hooded eyelids and have never been able to wear eyeshadow because of this. I wasn't expecting this to work very well because it's so cheap, but I was wrong. My eyeshadow looks just like it did when I applied it. No creasing. I have sensitive skin and have not had any issues with irritation. I will be buying this again when it runs out!

I have been using this for about 2 weeks now, and I am amazed. For the price (and yes I paid for it) I really didn't expect too much... I have been pleasantly surprised. I tend to wear some dramatic looks (especially smokey eyes) and without primer it just doesn't last throught out the day/ night. I can put this on and my shadow stays put until I take it off. I even took a shower thinking I was going to get out to a pair of racoon eyes....lol Imagine my surprise when I got done and looked in the mirror and my shadow was still PERFECT!!!  I am not kidding, it was just as it had been when I had put it on that morning!!!!!  This is def a permanent product in my makeup arsenal from now on!!

This stuff is really great! I almost get upset when I see bad reviews for E.L.F. products because, using the right techniques, they are amazing. I found that the best (and somewhat strange) way to apply this is to use the applicator to spread the product mostly over the lid, and use a fresh piece of toilet paper or tissue to spread it over the eye. If you use your finger, it will look oily over time. The only time it has ever let me down was when I had used my finger to spread it, and I had been wearing my shadow for 30 hours straight (no sleeping). Yeah. It's that awesome. Really hope you give it a try! It is available at my Walmart for $2.

I am so happy to have found this primer. I bought this at Walmart for a dollar after my Urban Decay Primer Potion ran out. My expectations weren't very high for the price, but I was pleasantly surprised. The primer has a doe-foot applicator and a smooth consistency, which makes it easy to apply. It doesn't make my eyelids oily like some primers tend to do, and my eyeshadow stayed on just as good as if I had used the UD Primer Potion. Not a lot of product is needed, it lasts all day, and removes easily with makeup remover. I will continue to buy this as long as it is in stock.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: A NECESSITY for my makeup bag!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have VERY oily skin.  When I say VERY - I mean VERY OILY! Before I discovered this product my makeup would look a mess by noon: my eyeshadow would crease and wear off, my eyeliner would smudge and my filled in eyebrows would wear off.  I started to use this on my entire eye area and the first thing I noticed is that my eyelids don't get oily anymore!  But honestly - at night, I hate to wash the makeup off my face because it still looks so good! Also, you don't have to use alot of this to see results.  I only place 2-3 light dabs on each eye area and blend in (including right under my eye to help my eyeliner stay in place).  I usually buy most of my makeup from MAC, but this product works so well, there's no need to buy a more expensive primer.  I use this every single day.

I actually didn't mind this as a primer. It did make my eyeshadow last longer than without it but it ruined my contacts. If my eyes got greasy during the day, the product would seep into my eyes and leave a film covering all over my lenses until I couldn't see out of my eyes. My contacts would become stiff and not wearable at that point. Therefore, I had to stop using this stuff. I'd love to find an eye primer that was truly contact lens safe. Maybe ELF can update their ingredient list to accommodate this issue!

Not impressed. I ran out of my shadow insurance and thought I would give this a try under my smokey eye. By halfway through the day I had creases in my shadow. I have oily lids so it just didn't seem to take to the lid very well. I'm going to stick with my current brand. Might be better suited for less oily skin.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: My Go-To Makeup Item for Hot Days
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have combination skin but for some reason no matter how dry other parts of my face are, my eyelids get oily over the course of a day and my eyeshadow creases and fades.  This product successfully prevents creasing for a full day.  I've tried other products and they are either too difficult to apply or they don't work but this one does the trick and the price is better than any other product I've seen.  It goes on without adding any color to the eye if applied properly so it is not meant to be worn on it's own.  This item is an absolute must for hot weather - my eye makeup stays put all day with this!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: ... less and it works just as well if not better! If I don't wear primer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I switched to this from Benefit brand's Stay Don't Stray primer because it cost 6 times less and it works just as well if not better! If I don't wear primer, I have creases in my eyeshadow after only a few hours. This instantly mattifies my lids making shadow go on more smoothly and I NEVER get creases, even after wearing shadow all day.

I wasn't expecting a lot when I went to target to buy this because it was only 1$. But I was very pleasantly surprised by this product. It actually works really well to keep my eye shadow on my oily lids. I didn't wear it with my cream eye shadow once because I just assumed I wouldn't need it but even my cream shadow melted off. The next time I wore my cream eye shadow I wore this under it and it lasted all day with no creasing! This product is really amazing and it only costs 1$!!! I would definitely recommend this product it works really well!!

For being pretty inexpensive (I bought mine from elf, not amazon), this works really well.  I do not have exceptionally oily lids, but my eyeshadow likes to fade through the day.  This primer helps it last longer.  I've used  before, and for me, this product works almost as well.  This product is a little wetter than the UDPP, but it dries quickly.  It makes my eyeshadow last longer and allows me to get brighter colors than if I had no primer on at all.  I would check around for the best price (target, elf, etc.), but it's a great buy.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This is great!! I can honestly say I will continue ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I got this stuff at Target for $1, I've also seen it at Wal Mart for the same price. This is great!! I can honestly say I will continue to use this product over my Merle Norman product that cost over $20. It does exactly what is should, keeps your eye make up looking good throughout the day. I would highly recommend anyone who is looking for a primer to try this. I am branching out to other E.L.F products because I have been so impressed with this.

I've used a handful of eye primers, and this one REALLY is my favorite!It is a little slick, but you can still "feel" it so it isn't like applying water on your lids...which is good!It's not sticky at all like some primers can be.I know it's more on here, but at the store its $1 and even for the price on amazon, you really can't beat it!I used to use Too Faced Shadow Insurance (which is equally amazing), and I was desperately trying to find a cheaper alternative.... I know for a fact that I found it!I hope ELF never messes with the formula or discontinues this... I'm planning to stock up. :)

This is my go to eyelid primer! I have oily eyelids and it works wonders. I have all the shades and all works very well with all types of eyeshadows , from the Wet n Wild to Mac brands, it works great! no T. no shade but..... if you live near any Walmart, Target,Walgreens, CVS, some grocery stores ,$.99 store, Ross, or simply to visit elf.com you can buy this same product for $1 to $2 maximum..

I was so tired of looking like a raccoon by lunch time every day and decided to try this eye primer (like everyone says, it's at Target for $1 so don't bother buying it on Amazon). I did not have high hopes for this b/c i have very oily skin but was amazed the first day I tried it that my eyeliner was still intact at the end of the day! I tried waterproof/smudge proof eyeliners with no success but now I can use any eyeliner with this primer and it stays on! I can now wear eye shadow too without seeing creases! I love this eye primer and will be using it for the long haul!

I LOVE this product. A few years ago, I was new to applying makeup and completely missed out on primer. I didn't think I needed it as much as I did, but decided to try it out. I'm so glad that I did!It lasts incredibly long. I will apply it over my lids and as soon as it stops being "wet," I put on my eye shadow... and it lasts HOURS. Before, I'd just use eye shadow and then an hour later or two, it'd just disappear or run a bit. After using this eyelid primer, my eye shadow (typically brown) lasts for up to ten hours. I love how my eye shadow looks on me!This product is "sheer" and mine typically dries to match my complexion (I am very pale though). It obviously shouldn't be a problem since most people would apply eye shadow on it anyway.I would definitely recommend looking for this somewhere else though. I got mine at Target and the Dollar Tree for only $1. It's rather expensive on amazon! It lasts a good while though and is definitely worth the price!

I have oily eyelids which I blot before applying this. I have to keep my eyelids closed, head tilted back, for a moment to let it dry.It keeps my eye shadow from creasing during the day. The only thing that bothers me is you can see the line of demarcation where the application stops.Not bad for the price ($1 at Target).

This product gives you a great bang for very little buck. I've used several e.l.f. Products & have always been pleasantly surprised by their quality. The same is true for this primer. It looks like concealer, glides on effortlessly, & blends right away. You may think that you don't have enough on for it to work well but you don't need much. I apply this after my foundation & my eyeliner & shadow stays put all day. As with the other products from this line, this has now become a part of my daily routine & I would recommend it to anyone. Thanks to the company for making a quality product at a price anyone can afford!

I have extremely oily eyelids; putting eyeshadow on without primer simply isn't possible for me. For a while I used a Too-Face Shadow Insurance primer but it definitely didn't help. After five hours, my creases were oily and the makeup was nowhere to be found. I got used to cleaning my face at lunch, but I figured there had to be a different option.I picked this up at my local Target for $1, figuring that if it sucked I could toss it out and maybe swallow the idea of dropping $25 for the Urban Decay primer at Sephora--an idea I wasn't exactly looking forward to. But after five hours, my eyeshadow was still intact! It got ruined a bit later but that was also because I was out in the rain, so I figured that had to be the reason. For $1, I'll definitely keep on buying this. The Amazon links are a little overpriced though, so if you want this product, either get it locally at Target or go to the E.L.F. website.

i love this stuff.  i didn't even realize i had a little shine to my lids until after applying this.  Dries pretty quick.  A lil goes a long way.  i have a natural reddish,bronze copper color on my lids, so wearing this alone just makes them ashy maybe with a tint, but it's fine if i want them to look that way.  they have no wrinkles what so ever!!  after it dries my eyelids r so smooth!  Anyway, only $1  ONE DOLLAR at Target.  Buy it there!

Bought the 3 pack because it had great reviews , first time it worked great well the 2nd day I put it on it started to burn my skin so I washed it off but the damage was done ....nit a great product esp when it burns your skin

I can't believe I handed over money to get a red rash from hell all around my eyes!  After the first use the skin around my eyes were burning but I thought maybe they were just dry.  After applying it the second time I got a full blown angry bumpy burning red rash around both eyes that took 2 weeks to completely heal!  Complete junk!

This product is a 5 star product in my eyes. I love how versatile it is. Not only is it a good primer on your eyes, but it helps to hide any darkness around your eyes or possible veins from having thin eyelids/very light colored skin. The only reason it's receiving a 4 star review instead of a 5 star is because it is cheaper to buy this particular product on elf's website. Go to eyeslipsface,com and they have this product for 1$ per bottle. WAY cheaper there. For the price of one here, you can get 3 on their website.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This product works better than UD!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: While on vacation, I bought this primer at Target when I accidentally left my Urban Decay primer at home. I now exclusively use this shadow primer as it really holds up ALL DAY. I don't always wash my eye makeup off before bed, and using the UD primer I would wake up with my shadow falling and smudged. Using the e.l.f. brand I don't have that problem and can wear my shadow flawlessly until I shower or wash my face.

I recently purchased lots of new cosmetics from e.l.f., including some types of products that I've never used before. The Essentials Eyelid Primer was one of the best of the lot. A little goes a long way, and it helps keep eyeshadow from creasing during the day. Don't make the mistake of lavishly applying this product, or it will actually make your eyelids seem greasy as the day goes on. You just don't need much product to have great results. Shadow stays put, and colors pop just a bit more.This is a nice product at an amazingly good price.

I have heard a lot of good things about the e.l.f. eyelid primer so I started my search for it in stores. I found it online and in Target for $1 so I thought I would give it a try.. I was very sad to see that this product is to oily for my eyes.I am a huge fan of Urban Decay Primer Potion however I was hoping to find a cheaper product. I even tried mixing my Urban Decay Primer Potion with this e.l.f. Essential Eyelid Primer and sadly my eyeshadow still melted away and/or creased.

This is the best primer I've ever tried, and it's elf! The company that's known for cheap crap! But this is not crap, it's amazing. I have ultra oily eyelids, any kind of eyeshadow, even so-called 24-hour-wear stuff, just smears in the crease the second I blink. Not with this primer! I can't believe how well it holds makeup! And it's a dollar at Target! A dollar! Not 20 bucks like MAC or Clinique, but same quality.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It is great and a buck at Target!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I saw this at Target and decided to give it a try for a buck. So for two bucks got one for me and my daughter. We bought loved it. Works great in the Florida humidity. But please also note I said it is 1 buck at Target. While there, go ahead and try a few things. I love their brushes. I do not like the mascara though. We tried a lot of Elf products because of the cheap cost. Many were hits to include this one.

I've been updating my makeup techniques and saw on YouTube that this particular primer was great, so I ordered it. Today was my first time trying no it out. My eyeshadow looks wonderful, no creases and very vibrant color. I'm a darker skinned African American woman and the primer looks and works great for me.

I bought this stuff initially because I love eyeshadow and have had a lot of problems with creasing.  This primer was $1 so I figured I wouldn't lose anything if it sucked, but lo and behold, this stuff is amazing.  I will never need another eyeshadow primer again.  If you want to buy it though, I'd recommend going through elf's site.  It's $1 there but you can usually get free shipping on their site with a $25 order (and believe me, you can get a lot of stuff for $25 at elf!)

This was actually the first primer I've tried. Don't really buy expensive makeup, and this was right in my range. It goes on so smoothly - you really don't need to use a lot at all. Eyeshadow stays on all day, and we're talking dollar store version eyeshadow, which for me, at least, wouldn't stay on regularly. It's perfect, I love it. Definitely reccomend.

This product works great and makes my makeup last all day. I use it when I do eye shadow and even when I draw on my eye brows. The only thing is, the bottle does not have much product in it, the tube was almost empty when I received it, but other than that I love it. Good product!

I got this product from target and i've fell in love with it. My eyeshadow doesnt crease for about 8-12 hours and it keeps my eyeshadow on all day :) BUT I WOULD EXPECT FOR AMAZON TO HAVE IT FOR A CHEAPER PRICE BUT INSTEAD THEY CHAR 3-4 DOLLARS MORE THAN RETAIL PRICE!!!LISTEN, IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN THIS PRODUCT; BUY IT FROM TARGET OR EYESLIPFACE.COM...

This product is only $1 from Target. You may have to try a time or two to get product out of the tube but I'll do that for something that only costs $1 and works so well. I have very oily eyelids and my eyeshadow is not creased at all after 12 hours.

It doesn't really last too long my eyes will start creasing by the end of the day. It dries up too light on my eyelids you can clearly see the primer peeking out from behind my eyeshadow on my tan skin and one tube won't last me 2 weeks.

I've been using alot of elf products and i'm very impressed with the quality and performance of the products for only costing $1 to $5 dollars and this eye primer is no expection. it prevents my shadow from creasing and smudgeing, makes my eyeshadow pop, and gives the shadow excellent staying power. i love this primer because it performs just as well as those eye primers that cost an arm and a leg.

This primer works okay. It definitely works better than just shadow by itself, but it doesn't keep my shadow from creasing by the end of my 10-hour work day. But for a Saturday night makeup look that only has to last a few hours, it's perfect. And the price can't be beat. If you have a little bit more money to spend, Too Faced Shadow Insurance is a better product than this one.

I was kinda skeptical to try out this product but I took a risk. And I am very glad I did. It goes on easily dried  quickly and my eye shadow stays on all day. I would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone looking for a flawless look at a low price!

It's my first time using primer so I don't really have anything to compare it to.  It seems to work fine, but it takes a while to dry, and also because the color is so bright peach I would find it hard to put a darker color on my lid over it.

I've been pleasantly surprised by this very affordable product. I do not have super oily lids, but they aren't dry either. I apply a little of this, allow it to dry and then I do my eyeshadow as usual. I am happy to say that I get NO creasing with this primer, not even after a whole day at 114F (46C). What more can you ask for, especially for the money?

I usually use Urban Decay's Primer Potion and decided to try this on a whim because it was only $1 at Target. I've finally found my HG in an Eye Primer! I've tried a number of brands over the years from L'Oreal's DeCrease and NYX's High Definition Eye Shadow Base to Elf's Eyelid Primer. Of the three mentioned, NYX was the best BUT it still wasn't the be all, end all for me...so I kept looking...I saw a gal on You Tube talking about a number of eye primers so I thought I'd see what she had to say...enter the 360 Creaseless 12 Hour Eye Primer from Tarte...WOW...I can't believe how long my eyelids stay "dry" and look matte...it's incredible!Usually my eyelids would look like they needed to be dabbed with a Clean and Clear Oil Absorbing Sheet about 3-4 hours into my makeup application and now after using this brand it's amazing how good my eyes look and feel for a good number of hours...actually I find that the Tarte 360 Creaseless 12 Hour Eye Primer lasts longer than 12 hours it touts! Even if it's warm outside, it still holds up nicely!The primer itself looks a bit different than what most of us are used to seeing...it comes out looking like a white lotion vs the usual tinted appearance that most primers have...the best part is you need VERY LITTLE...I put a small dab on my right hand middle finger and then I take my left middle finger and dab them together so I have and equal amount of product on both fingers and then I close my eyes and gently tap, tap, tap on my eyelids (very lightly)...I actually put a bit of foundation on my lids before I use the primer...to be clear, I've worn this eye primer over my foundation as well as under it and I have had the same results either way...it's just a matter of preference as to which I grab first to apply...I only use foundation on my forehead and eyelids because that's where I tend to be a bit oily so the rest of my face is au natural....anyhow, once I finish tapping my eyelids and generally have what feels to be no product left, I will do a quick tap on my forehead (right between my eyebrows in the T Zone) and it actually helps to keep that area on the matte side...there appears to be a minute amount left on my fingers because I tap and don't rub my eyelids so that's why even the teensiest bit of product left on your fingers (even if you can't see it) is quite helpful for other areas as well...then I finish off with a quick press of a translucent powder to set everything...I initially bought the Tarte eye primer from eBay in a sample sized tube just so I could try it without sinking money into a product I might not like...I'm glad I tried this primer and since then I purchased the full size product here on Amazon...this is one product I wouldn't want to be without!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Nothing is 100% perfect, but this comes dang close!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is a miracle product for fair skinned peeps with seriously blue-bruised under eyes! I say "fair" but as a half-ginger, it's more like see-through. As in you can see the veins under most of my skin, especially my eyelids: the complete super pale package. After a lifetime of trials and errors, I finally found an all-star concealer (). However, it would fade half-way through the day, and honestly on the worst sleepless and/or hard partying nights, it wouldn't be enough. After some research I learned I needed to find me a good primer to keep said fab concealer in place/help with coverage on said worst days. I come across this and BOOM! everything I needed. Provides extra coverage and keeps concealer (not to mention eyeshadow and liner) in place all day.The ONLY caveat is that for whatever reason, the stick likes to break off. Like, very easily and early in use. It happened with my first tube, so I vowed with my next to be more gentle/not turn it up as high when using. Alas, still broke. Not sure if it has something to due with product from this seller or if they all do this as a fault, but even so I will continue to put the stick back in the tube and use gently, because this stuff rules too much to let the applicator design flaw keep me from fabulous eyes!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: til I go to my grave
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Bare Minerals  is hands down, the Very Best Makeup I have ever bought. Fell in love with the mineral base, the first product. I Started wearing this when QVC first aired it waaay back when. Through years, and years of winters, summers, hormonal changes, it still looks better on my skin than anything else on the market. Never had a breakout, that I had to stop wearing, clear up, and start over. With wearingBare Minerals, my skin, no matter the season, always looks fresh, never dry, or caked on. At 55 years old, with sun damaged skin, which it does cover, I still get compliments on my makeup. I hate the feel of any other foundation now days. Gooey, smears off on my clothes, yuk!Bare Minerals  will be with me til I go to my grave. I Love It!

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Love it! I use this on a daily basis to prime my eyelids as well as brighten up my under eyes. First I apply my foundation, then I apply the Bare minerals CC eye primer in a triangular shape under my eyes as well as on my eyelid, next I blend this in with a beauty blender, lastly I apply a concealer over this product. My dark circles are gone, my under eyes look brightened, and it serves as a wonderful primer for my eyeshadows. The cooling effect is nice, but it doesn't last very long. Consumer_Reviews.review_title: THE best eyeshadow primer for "mature" skin!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I almost cried when LimeCrime discontinued their eyeshadow primer. I didn't think I could find another primer that gave me the staying power with my oily lids. Based on reviews and the quality of Urban Decay products, I tried this product. Oh my...it's so much better! LimeCrime eye primer was a bit drying, even though my lids tend to be oily. I guess it's my age (51) and some weird delicate balance between oily and dry, but my lids started to get a bit flaky if I left my eye makeup and primer on all day. Not so with UD's anti-aging formula! Not only does it keep my shadow and liner on every bit as good as LimeCrime did, but it seems to condition my eyelids so I don't have one bit of dryness and flaking. Who can't use a little anti-aging? For me this is the perfect formula for an eyeshadow primer. The seller shipped it quickly, it was in the original packaging and the product seems to be in perfect condition. I'll buy this as long as it's offered and recommend it highly.

Have never tried another brand so I can't compare it against another. That said, this stuff is awesome, my skin is oily and eye shadow never stayed on all day until I tried this UD product! Another good thing about this purchase is that it was the squeeze tube vs the one with the wand. I hate those wands, they seem like they would get germy and you can never get the very last bit of product out of the tube with them.

This product was recommended by my niece who is starting her makeup artist career. I heard other people liked it but afterwards using it, I thought it would be better. I am not sure if it is that my eyelids are becoming more oily but the eyeliner and eye shadow still runs after a couple hours.
It's a bit thinner than I expected (compared to other brands I've used) but has good staying power which is the entire purpose.
While I can't say I notice any anti-aging benefits,  UD primers are the best.  It helps your eyeshadow to go on well and keeps it fresh all day.  It makes a big difference.
Really keeps the shadow from creasing...just as promised. Used this for a long time.
I hated this stuff.  Burned on my lids for a minute after application.  Most unpleasant.  Can't use this product.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Go GOLD -- or prep eyelid a little differently for other shades...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I ordered three shades -- 5th Ave Gold Rush, Wall Street Bronze, Murray Hill Champagne.  Packaging -- the crayons were loose, stuck to the inside of the lid, as reported by others.  Not a big deal for me, just tap the bottom on the table to unstick it from the lid, twist up a little, then lightly press as you twist the crayon back down.  It will hold the crayon if it doesn't get banged around.  Wearability:  This was all applied on top of silicone-based primer, and CoverGirl neutralizer concealer stick.  The Bronze and Champagne both seemed to "clump" color, almost waxy, where pigment would stick in some spots on my eyelids, but not in others...Bronze reminded me of age spots!, neither of these two were very blendable.  The Gold went on better, a bit smoother and much more even-coverage with pigment, more blendable.  Subtle shine and light bounce for all three, very good for daytime makeup, blending will make a lot of the shimmer come off onto your finger/sponge.  THEN I tried the Bronze and Champagne on top of silicone primer only, no concealer or lid primer which can sometimes dry out or cake on my eyelids; they smoothed out and acted more like the Gold with the slick base of the primer.  Gold was a dream in this instance, like silk.  Overall, a great product for the price and a good staple for quick-do makeup.  I can't attest to staying power -- I wear minimal makeup, and don't usually wear it for more than a few hours at a time.  I work a job that's half physical and half public relations, a lot like a park ranger; I carry the Gold in my bag with a plum lip/cheek tint for pop-up meetings with the press.  Simple & understated, perfect for my needs.  Minus one-half star for the variability of the pigmentation and having to go without concealer on Bronze and Champagne, and minus one-half star for the way the crayon comes unstuck from the twist base (there are better designs out there for twist-ups).  4.5 stars for Gold, 4 stars for Bronze & Champagne; overall product 4 stars, b/c more shades seem to pigment clump than don't.

I wanted an eye primer that would camouflage the discoloration on my eyelids.  This product is quite thick and is a bit cakey. It's very thick and not blendable and is quite dry.  However, when I wear eyeshadow over it, it does prevent creasing and keeps the color vivid and true all day.  I think the secret to applying it is to dot on just a little and then blend it really well.  I like it much better when worn with shadow.  I don't wear eyeshadow very often.  Instead I go for a nude look with just this primer (or foundation) and ELF HD powder.  I will continue to use it though because it does help powder shadows stay true and to last all day and into the night.  I like several Benefit products and will likely repurchase this product when it runs out.  I recommend it strictly as a primer for eyeshadow and not if it's worn by itself.

Vanity stops me from admitting the terrible truth.  I will certainly repurchase this again.  Oh, and it appears it will last a long time as you use such a small amount each time.

(trust me this helps) So I put a little on my fingertip and patted some on my right eyelid, nothing, I look in my magnified mirror, still nothing. I put a little more on my fingertip then on my eyelid, still nothing. Now I know there's product on my eyelid as I can feel it AND when I blinked I saw a faint yellow crease across my eyelid. I figured ok maybe the product needs time to dry so I try the same method on my other eye, only this time I didn't blink, I left my eye closed for a few seconds then blinked, nope, still saw the same faint yellow crease and it didn't cover up any of the redness on either of my eyelids, it just seemed to disappear on my skin.I got better results just using a little bit of my regular (and less expensive)concealer on my eyelids, Shadow Insurance as a primer and some white eyeshadow on top of that, covered up the redness and made my eyes look much better then this waste of money.

this is meant for eyelids i think, but some of the other reviewers said they used it under their eyes for under eye circles. i tried that & it looked, well, yellow and weird. i had to wash it all off. i was disappointed because i wanted something for underneath my eyes, but it still gets 4 stars because it works well on the eyelids as it's intended.

I was introduced to Lemon Aid at a local cosmetic retailer where I was given a small sample with purchase of something else.  I have used every conceivable type of concealer and I keep coming back to this stuff.  It really helps with the dark circles under my eyes and I use it on my upper lids when I want to wear a pale eyeshadow.  It really brightens my eyes and makes me look rested and healthy.  Which I am not.  I don't really care for their other concealers (Boing and Erase Paste), but this one is perfect.  I have a very pale complexion with yellowish/greenish undertones.  It also works well to counteract the redness of my mild rosacea.I went back to the retailer to get a full size of Lemon Aid and they didn't have it and talked me into a traditional flesh colored concealer that was okay, but not great.  I used it for a few weeks and decided to go back to Lemon Aid.  I am so happy I can buy it on Amazon.  :-)

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great Concealer for the under eye area
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Great concealer for the under eye area. I have dark circles that are very difficult to cover and this works for me. I have oily skin and unlike other reviewers I found the consistency just perfect.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Conceals well for dark circles and uneven tones
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I like to use this product over my eyelids and around the sunken areas around my eye to give them a lift. I apply it like any concealer. I found it helpful to moisturize beforehand, to avoid the creased, cakey-look. I read that others have used a makeup sponge to mitigate creasing and cakeyness.The reason I like this concealer is the yellow tint truly does conceal dark circles and balance uneven skin tones, giving them a youthful lift. However, if not applied with care, it can be aging. Another review indicated it works great for concealing leg veins - I didn't find that true for me since I felt it sort of 'highlighted' the area being the concealer is so much lighter than my own skin tone. I will stick to using around my eyes and on eyelids. Also, don't know why it's so expensive here -- up to ten or twenty times what it costs elsewhere. Definitely price shop before you buy this product. Sometimes you can get the best price here and sometimes it's drastically more.

Ehhhhhhh........for the price, I don't think that I would buy again. It's ok, but honestly nothing special. Based on the amazing reviews, (and price), I expected more. I use for under eye circles, but still have to put concealer over it so it doesn't look so yellow. Won't re-order.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Came in box, but is not easy to open
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I do love this product and I will order again, but the packaging that the product comes in has a defect. It's very difficult to open, I have to use a pen to Jimmy it open every morning .:-( other than that it's a great product.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I don't go out of the house without wearing this
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have tried so many other highly rated (and very expensive) concealers, but nothing works as well as this one. I use this as both an under eye concealer and eyelid primer. It never cakes or creases and lasts all day long. The yellow tint helps camouflage any darkness or red undertones. The color works any time of the year, no matter how pale I am in the winter or tan in the summer. If I wear no other makeup, I don't leave the house without this!

From the reviews, I took this item to work well as somewhat of a concealer for around the eyes.  It was very promising.  I thought the color would work very well and you get a good amount of product for what you pay for, considering you should use a small amount.However, I am returning this item.  I expected the formula to be fairly creamy to make blending it easy, however it was pretty dry and was very difficult to spread.  I used my fingers, a brush, a makeup sponge wedge and nothing worked very well.  I tried adding some eye cream as recommended, but it didn't blend well at all.  Instead, it went on really cakey-like and made deep creases in the fine lines around my eyes.  I also tried heating it up a bit with my hands, but that didn't soften it any.  I tried using it just on my eyelids, but again, that cakey look was all I could achieve.Maybe I got a bad batch, and I usually try to use products even if I don't love them, but I found this to be pretty much unusable for my needs.  There are a ton of fans of Lemon Aid, but unfortunately, I am not one of them.2 stars because it had potential, it just didn't live up to my expectations.Also, on a sidenote, I ordered this on Thursday AM (10/4/12) with an estimated delivery date of 10/6 (Saturday).  Friday evening (10/5) I got an email from Amazon saying shipping had been delayed, but that the product would ship soon.  Sunday (10/7) I found it had been delivered the day before as expected, then Monday (10/8) I received an email from Amazon saying it had shipped.  Not sure why there was the confusion and I wouldn't rate the seller down for that because I think it was a fluke, but it was kinda confusing.  Just keep that in mind if it happens to you.  I have Prime and it arrived as promised.
My wife really enjoys this product. And I know I do too. Her makeup lasts long and she looks damn good!!
Nothing misleading about this it goes on smooth and does quite well at hiding dark circles. I would recommend it.

Ok...I have puffy eye pouches which look worse in the AM if I ate salty food the day before. I was seriously considering getting them surgically removed, but then I started using Lemon Aid, and I am not thinking surgery anymore. Honestly, I am pretty much all thumbs when it comes to most makeup, but I can really work with this stuff and see a big difference.I picked up a few tips to best use this product:1. Dip your brush into some type of thick creamy moisturizer(I use Nivea), then into the Lemon Aid. It just glides on, and is very easy to blend.2. To best cover the awful pouches, tilt your head slightly down while looking into the mirror. See those dark rings at the bottom of the pouches? Put the concealer on just those dark rings...not on the pouches themselves. I learned that the pouches cause shadows that form the dark ring, so if you can make those shadows go away....voila... you can no longer see the pouches...amazing but true. Gently blend in...and you are 10 years younger, and good to go.I love stuff that works this well..

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: quite possibly my new favorite eyelid primer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have been using this from a sample container for awhile so I did not even realize it was meant for color correction.  I just thought it was an eyelid primer (though I'll admit to being a bit puzzled about the color).  I do not get dark circles and don't have redness around my eyes, and yellow concealers look wrong elsewhere on my face due to my skin tone, so I have only been using this as an eyelid primer.  Thus, that's the only use I will talk about today.As a primer, this is wonderful.  It has a somewhat creamy texture but isn't too liquidy like other eyelid primers.  Texture-wise, I think I even like it more than the Urban Decay Primer Potions, and that is saying something, since I have been using those for years.  This can't separate like the liquid primers, and it dries faster (because it's not really "wet" to begin with).  I find this easy to spread around on the eyelid; I prefer to apply with a finger.  It does not cause any irritation (I have sensitive eyes and wear contact lenses, so this is important).You don't have to wait much (or any) time at all before putting shadow over this.  I think the lightness of the color of the primer really helps shadow colors stand out (in a way that other primers don't).  I have mostly been using loose powder shadows lately, some with a bit of sparkle in them, and they stick pretty well to this (I don't know that full-on glitter would; I would think you'd still need a special primer for that).  I am not getting any creasing, even though I have super oily eyelids.  That is pretty much all I can ask for in an eyelid primer.In the end, this may be edging out the UDPP for my favorite eyelid primer.  At twenty bucks new, it is competitive with similar products.

Very creamy product but goes on like silk. Makes my eyelids look uniform in color and not greasy/oily by the end of the day. A little goes a long way. Has a mirror on the inside too. Good for use by itself or under eye shadow. Definitely recommend.

Ok....so it's an eyelid primer...but I use it under my eyes as well....I have really dark circles under my eyes as well as naturally dark lids ....Ever seen "The Adams Family"? Uncle Fester style circles right here ladies, not kidding lol! It takes very little of this to cover my lid and under eye area....I use it EVERYDAY and one compact last me about 6-7months...it covers perfectly, lasts all day,doesn't look cakey, REALLY brightens my eyes and makes my eyeshadow last all day as well....I apply it with a small brush....it's my favorite thing in my bag of beauty tricks!!!

This is the best product I have ever tried, and I LOVE cosmetics. This is a must have for anyones makeup bag. It is perfect for eyelids which it was intended for, but also great for blemishes. This will cover anything that is red. So say a pimple sprouts up or even if you get redness around the nose in the winter months- this is perfect for it. Some other concealers I have used tend to get very dry, this one is nice and creamy so it doesnt get cakey looking on skin. Sometimes I use it for brightening eyes after I put makeup on. Or you can use it before makeup as a primer to even skin tone. Its perfect for people who use powder foundation too. This way you cover up anything but don't have to cover your face in a thick liquid foundation.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: it does what it says, but it DOES NOT stay on
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: maybe i just have really greasy eyelids, but this stuff rubs off and forms yellow lines in the creases of my eyelids within 10 minutes. So before im even done doing my makeup it already starts coming off. That really sucks because i LOVE how it looks when i first put it on, but it just doesn't stay on! How can it be used as a primer if it wont stick? Next time i think i'll just be buying a soft yellow eyeshadow and wear primer under it, at least that way it will last more than 10 minutes!!

I tried using this product as directed, but it didn't work. It creased terribly, and made my very fine lines appear gigantic. I then tried it on top of a variety of products, including a primer that normally makes everything stick and not budge, but this just kept settling into lines and creasing when I smiled. Terrible.

It wasnt as creamy as I though, it looked kinda hard but...once I used my finger to apply product on top of the lids and under eyes, miracle! It looked light and natural and not heavy and creamy. Apply lightly using ur finger, dont use brush. Product warms with heat of the finger and a little bit is all u need.

While it does color correct, it creases within a couple of hours, taking your shadow or concealer with it so that you have only a couple of yellow lines where you used to have a wash of color. I returned it within a week.

This product, by far, is the best on the market. After years of working in the beauty industry as well as using this product personally for 11 years, nothing tops it! It's light, brightening, and always the perfect pick-me-up. I never leave home without it. People wonder why my skin always shines brightly around my eyes-this is my best kept secret :)

I absolutely adore this product.  It really does cover-up any redness or other discoloration around the eyes, though I do wonder if it would work as well on darker skin tones than mine which is pretty pale.  There's a mirror in the lid, so it's easy to make touch-ups.  It doesn't last quite a full workday, but it's better than anything else I've tried.
I will never give this product up.  I have deep set eyes and by applying Lemon Aid it just really brightens the eye lid - when I add eye shadow it sticks and doesn't cake.  Amazing.

How refreshing to find a product that actually does what it claims to do!!  Goes on smoothly, not yellowish-in-color when applied and blended and no, you don't need a lot of product for use.  Used on lids and under-eye...works very well on both areas.  Would recommend product!!
Great for lids and covering other red areas.I gave it 4 stars because it's a little to spread without tugging at eyes. A concealer brush helps.

I love almost all of Benefit's makeup, but Lemon-ade was horrible for me. It was too dry to apply nicely and so I dabbed it carefully and thinly.Within a couple of hours I had swelling and redness under my eyes that was very noticeable. It took several days to calm down. I waited a week or two, and then decided to try it again, thinking I might have been reacting to something else. Within an hour it looked as though I had been hit under my eyes....with marked swelling and a deep reddishness. Normally I do NOT have sensitive skin and am a medium light olive complexion. Too bad, the idea was great. Obviously it works for some people. Just be cautious at first.
Great primer as well as concealer !!! Stays put!!! I've been a user of this product for years, would recommend

This eyelid primer is the best I have ever used!  It not only covers well, but keeps my eye  shadow on all day and in place.  I also pat it on my lips before applying lipstick and my lip liner stays put all day.  Love, love, love this product!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It does good to even out darkness
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: However, I find that even the warmth if my finger isn't enough to make this baby creamy. I like the product, but it's just too dry for me to use it well.

I'm used to using Benefit products, so I thought I'd try this one too.  I like the coverage Lemon-Aid provides, but it can be a bit difficult to apply on the eye lid.  It is not as creamy as Benefit's FY Eye.  But I find if I pass the blowdryer over the compact container before using it softens up a bit.
clumpy and flaky. terrible.
THIS PRODUCT SEEMED LIKE THE FORMULA HAS BEEN CHANGED OR POSSIBLY THE PRODUCT WAS FLAWED IN SOME WAY. HAS  A GREASY TEXTURE INSTEAD OF A CREAMY TEXTURE.

I even put it under my eyes just because it evens complexion and makes concealer last. It's the consistency of a cream shadow. Was introduced to it by makeup artist and Im hooked. This will be a staple from now on.

It glides on smoothly but even with powder applied over top, I was disappointed with its ability to hold-back those eye shadow creases. Granted, I have oily skin, so my issues may be more than the average gal out there. However I much prefer other brands over this one -- ie Benefit & Clinique for starters.
This is a lovely shadow base.  It smooths your lids and the shadow stays in place all day.  Highly recommend.
hELPS TREMENDOUSLY WITH EYE SHADOW CREASING
First time using it. Greta product and last during my job hours.

Have been using Sorme under shadow for years and love it
Great under eyeshadow coverage to keep eyeshadow in place and smooth base coat for eye.  Good base color for eye.
Works great

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Sorme Undershadow as Under Eye Treatment
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I discovered this product when it was included with beauty products I received while undergoing chemo treatments. It's supposed to be used under your eye shadow to keep it from melting away during the day.  But I found it's the best under eye cover-up I've ever used. Just a dab keeps my dark under eyes under cover all day and I no longer look like I've been on a drunk all night!  Best stuff ever.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I have used this primer for many many years and when I could not find it at the store I usually purchased it from, I panicked.  Thank goodness I found it here and hopefully will be using it for many many more years.  It is the best priced, best working lid primer I have ever found.  Shadow stays on all day and ever all night if you fall asleep before removing.

This is the best lid primer I have found, and I have tried a lot of them (including costly name brand products). I have used this product for the past 3 years, and I really hope they never stop making it! It covers my lid discoloration and keeps my eyeshadow looking fresh all day with no creasing. I also use less eyeshadow than I used to before I found this product. I also have very sensitive skin and have had no sensitivity issues with this product. Love it!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I ordered this for a friend because she is a ...
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I ordered this for a friend because she is a older lady and not very computer savvy, but she loves this product so much.
Very satisfied.

I love this product.  I purchased it from Sallys and they have stopped carrying it, I was delighted to find it on Amazon.  All day base, sometimes I just use it and no shadow.  No irritation at all and I am quite sensitive to some products.  Great Price, I just paid $20 for a similar product that I cannot use.

I bought this primer as I complain constantly about the bottle design of Urban Decay's Primer Potion.  I read some decent reviews and figured I would give it a whirl.  I used it for the first and last time today.  I applied my eyeshadow at about 6 am this morning.  The product itself is thick and applies much like other products; a little goes a long way.  At 0730 this morning, my eyeshadow had a bad case of the "creasies"-I was not happy.  Having no choice but to continue to wear my eye makeup in its current state for the remainder of the day, I have this to say, there hasn't been any "more" creasing.  Most of the time when my eye makeup creases, it will in fact crease, and then clump.  This wasn't the case with this primer.  I would suggest using this primer for makeup tutorials or if you don't plan to wear eyeshadow for extended periods of time.

I had to buy this from Amazon as Sally's no longer sells it. Thank God it is still on the market. I use it for under eye circles. I have the bluish kind ( so the orange in the primer counteracts the blue circles. I suppose it would work as intended as a primer but since i hardly wear shadow I don't know.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: A little goes a long way!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This product is on the thick side, so a little goes a long way. It is NOTtoo heavy for me. I have very oily skin, especially on the lids and around my eyes. It works very well to keep shadow in place. No scent. The sponge applicator at the tip is excellent for spreading the product without geting it on your fingers or having to tug on lids. The color is good for under all colors of shadows or alone with just mascara. I would buy this product again. The price is great for the amount of product and the staying power of the product.

It keeps the shadow on but it definitely creases within 5 minutes of putting it on. i do NOT recommend this product at all! right now it is all i have which is irritating, i do still use i have not tried putting on shadow without a base and will have to see if its any better. I wish i would not have bought this it is inexpensive but still a waste of money. i was very excited to get this, but now i'm very disappointed. Save yourself the disappointment and money!

I have been looking for a good eyeshadow primer for a while so I decided to try this out. My eyeshadow would always crease by the time school was over. With this, the eyeshadow is SO vibrant and stays in place way past midnight.I recommend it for people that don't want to shell out money on some more expensive things like the urban decay primer potion.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Literary the best primer i've ever used
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Im VERY into makeup i love my Urban Decay primer potion i only have the mini one that came with my naked pallete , i wanted to try this out because it was cheap i received it last year and it says it will be NO good after six months LIESSS ! i have it now and its november i've had for almost year now and i still have ALOT of the product i also use it as a concealer and on my blemishes i have very oily lids and this works i pair it with my nyx jumbo stick . LOVE LOVE LOVE this primer and 4.99 you cant beat it<3

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: IF THERE'S NOT ONE REVIEW TO TRUST, TRUST THIS ONE.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This product does it's job. It works really well. When I first got into makeup, I never wore any primer (aaaahh!!). But that Christmas night when i got this and did my makeup, i was literally like "WOWWWWW". Such a big freakin difference. Also, dont put too much on, b/c then it will crease. Just use what you need. It can be easy to squirt out too much, also.

This eye primer is amazing, it keeps my eyeshadows on all day long, I have never had to reapply my eyesahdow using this primer. It makes my eyesahdows look great and best of all it stays looking great all day long until I take it off at night. I have had this primer for a year and I still have plenty left because a little goes a long way. I will be buying this eye primer again:)
It works just fine for.the price. Ask the other brands are pricey but do the same thing. Not a bad buy

I like this item , which is now discontinued in Sally beauty and as under eye coverage it seems real good over total effect of oil of Olay
Super hard to find but the best cover up ever

Great shipping time and it does its job well. I only use eye make-up and it really does make the eye shadows look more pigmented and they DO NOT crease at all. Pleased w/ this purchase. The price was a bonus!

Nothing spectacular to review.  It is a primer and takes a little bit longer to dry then other brands.  Although I have to say that it is a great value for the price.Arrived way earlier then promised.

Love this stuff!!
Love this product.

This Eye Primer is wonderful.  It doesn't crease or cause the crinkly/crepe effect that some primers do.  My eye shadow goes on smoothly and stays on.  It's also good to dab on under your eye as a concealer.  I will be using this from now on, after trying so many and being disappointed.  The color is perfect for my light skin and I had no reaction, no itching or burning.  Just a great product and the price is so great.

I love this product.  I use Smashbox lid primer everyday including days I go to bikram yoga.  This product is amazing.  I go to work wearing this product and go to bikram yoga afterwards...my eye makeup holds all day even in high temperatures. (this product holds over 16 hrs). Consumer_Reviews.review_title: How did I live without this.

I wear smash mouth lid primer just about every day.  Put it on before your eye shadow and no matter what kind of eye shadow you buy it will not crease, smear or rub off.  Easy to apply and you just need a small amount.  Hands down this is the best lid primer out there.

Really like this eyelid primer.  Smooth feel and applies very easy and evenly.  Haven't had eyeshadow crease since using it.  I just purchased Urban Decay eyelid primer so we'll see how these two compare.

Although somewhat darker than another lid primer I have been using, it performed as expected keeping eye shadow in place and not sinking into the creases.  The darker color did not appear to affect the eye shadow color.

I don't know if my last (other brand) of primer was just old or what, but this primer holds much longer than my last one. It's a lot more opaque than I expected. I thought it'd be a bit more transparent. Not a big deal, though.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Doesn't work for more than half a day for me...

This product is light weight and easily glides on to a smooth finish.  Never cakey.  After applying this lid primer, my shadow stays all day long!
Very good lid primer.

Great product
