I've been using this for years and it works perfectly

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: It keeps the shadow on, but.....
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I had a hard time actually applying eye shadow.  This makes the eyelid a very, sort of 'dry, matte' base for shadow. Wich I guess is exactly what its suppose to do.  But the color will stay wherever you put it. So it was hard to blend anything with my brushes.  So if you just need to throw on one color like on the lower lid, would probably be perfect. But if you are doing any 'crease work' that would need blending, maybe not so much.  I had to end up using my fingers to blend and ended up pulling on my eye lid too much for my liking.  So it definitely keeps shadow put?It does, however, look lovely if you are wearing NO shadow.  Hides any darker spots.  Makes my eyes look very bright just with mascara and no shadow.

I ordered that Smashbox Trial kit, with the mascara, face primer, eyeliner...etc...this was definitely my favorite thing out of the box. I have pale skin, and it's always hard to get eyeshadow to show up well on my eyes, but with this, IT"S AMAZING! Of course, I had doubts that it would not last through out the day, or crease like so many others do, but it didn't. Hasn't. I've used it three days in a row now, and I am in love. I'm not usually easily so impressed, but with this product, I am.

Hands down, best eye lid primer I have tried. I was having trouble keeping my eye shadow on throughout the day, especially because I have deep set eyes. The primer first came out a little thick, but I smoothed it with my finger for a more even result. In the future I learned that a little goes a long way and you do not need to apply a lot of it. The eye shadow lay nicely on top of it and it lasted all day. I was very impressed and would recommend it to anyone. You can also purchase a smaller, sample version of it in a Smashbox sampler.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Nice product but a wee bit pricey
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I received mine as a gift included in a kit and think it is highly overpriced.  I have very oily lids and have tried many a "primer" product and honestly none of them can keep my shadows from sliding off my lids after 6-8 hours of wear.  I've been told that those with oily skin take longer to show their age and wrinkles so if that's the price to pay I'm okay with that.  So, what does this "primer" do for me?  It nicely covers all veins and such on my lids and leaves a smooth canvas for eyeshadow application.  Again, it doesn't really make them last longer on the lids, but it does help them cling better, show truer color and they blend better over this primer.  The primer itself has a nice consistency and blends quickly and easily.  It's not a necessity, in my opinion, and highly overpriced but a nice bonus to have around. I'm going to look for a drugstore substitute when this tube is empty because it has spoiled me a bit.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Too bad. Won't buy it again
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I can't seem to get any out of the container.  At first, 2 applications or so, it was okay.  I thought I had been sent an old one which had dried up.  Still struggling with it.  Too bad.  Won't buy it again.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: The only primer that works for me.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: As a professional makeup artist,I've tried a ton of primers. MAC's primer goes on like cement and does NOT blend at all. Urban Decay is too thin and watery. Smashbox Photo Finish Eye primer is the only one that actually works for me. Works so well that it's hard to get the makeup off--which I would prefer. No creasing, no oily eyelids. Maybe the other two reviewers got a bad batch, but it works like a charm for me.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Works perfect and lasts all day
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I use this for a lip primer and put it all over the area above my upper lip to hide lines. Works perfect and lasts all day.
Pros: it covers darker spots on the eyes and does help make eyeshadow pop and stay on longer.Cons: Very thick. Very expensive. Makes blending eyeshadow a little difficult.

The Smashbox eyeshadow primer is okay, but Urban Decay and Too Faced offer much better ones. This primer is thicker than the other two brands, which means it takes longer to blend. My makeup does last longer when I use this than it would without a primer, but I think other eye primers work even better. I do not recommend this.
I only wanted this for one thing, and since my eyeshadow still creased and melted, it was a completely worthless purchase.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I've been on a desperate hunt to find a method to help my eye makeup stay where I put it.  I have hooded and oily eyelids. My eyeliner always transfers to my upper eyelid making me look a mess. This primer was recommended for my situation.It is one of the best primers I've ever used. It helps my eyeliner to stay put. It also of course keeps my eyeshadow fresh all day. As with all primer make sure you don't apply too much. That will have opposite effect and your eye makeup will crease.I also tried the Wet n Wild celebrity photofocus primer. It is far less expensive and does the job just as well.  I would gladly pay the price of the Pür primer if there wasn't a drugstore alternative. Try them both you won't be disappointed.
Love this product! Really keeps my eyeshadow on all day long.

Before I started using this product, I was experiencing a lot of irritation on my eye lids from my eye shadow.  My eyes, and eye lids were burning from allergies to my eye shadow and mascara,.  But, this primer has helped me so much to relieve my eyes of this inflammation.  I put the primer on my complete eye lids, and under my lower lash line, then I let it dry.  I put an allergy eye drop in first, then I put on my eye pencil and shadow, and now there is no burning at all.  I also had a problem with mascaras irritating my eyes too, so I switched to Lancôme mascara which helped a lot.  I also take an over the counter allergy pill. I had been using the allergy drop, and allergy pill before, but it was not enough for relief.  This product stopped all my eye lid burning, without me having to quit or change my eye pencil and shadow.
I hope they never discontinue this product!
This product does what it says....nothing less / nothing more.  A little on the expensive side when compared to other brands that offer the same coverage and results.
I'm still debating
This does not work. At all.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Finally my eye shadow doesn't disappear after a couple hours! I'm not familiar with eye primer or any kind of primer, so I thought that it was bigger because of the price (that's on me for not paying attention to the fluid ounces listed on the picture of the bottle). Luckily, a super small amount goes a long way, it only takes me a tiny splotch to cover my entire eyelid, which was a pleasant surprise after realizing the size it was. Now on the occasion that I have enough time to put on makeup my eye shadow lasts the whole day. Cruelty free too, which is a nice plus.

Love it! I have very sensitive skin and end up with swollen face/eyes when I try using new products. This pruduct has caused me no irritation at all. Goes on easy. I can use it alone and it looks natural. It is everything I hoped it would be.
I bought this for my daughter.  She loved it, so I tried it and loved it as well.  I'm ordering one for me!
This is the best eye primer I've used! I always have creases in my eyeshadow and hate it! Not with this primer! Best ever
Now I can't use eyeshadow without it! This really brings the color of the shadow out and you only need to apply a tiny amount to your lids, so it'll last a long time for it's price.
It was my second product from this company and I am very impressed once more! I've tried different eye primers and this one is by far my favorite! It blends in perfectly and stays on all day!
This is just what I was looking for, a tinted eyeshadow base that lasts all day.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Loved the consistency and all-day wearability of this primer!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I usually use department store Eye Primer, but when I was offered to test this primer at a discount in exchange for an unbiased, honest review, I decided to try it out. First of all, the color was as expected and blended well in a matte finish on my eye lids. It is slightly thicker than I expected but  I actually prefer the consistency because I have a dark spot on my upper lid of one eye, and this primer seemed to camouflage it better than the department store brand, and didn't appear "cakey." I then applied my eyeshadow over the primer, which held up all day without creasing or flaking. Also, the tube is larger than I expected at almost .3 oz of product, which will last for several months. I have used this product now for several weeks and have had NO irritation. I would definitely recommend this primer to others and would buy again. Great price point!
LOVE this primer!  Repeat buyer here!
I am very happy with my purchase, it's very easy to apply, the eye shadow goes on very smoothly and stay on all day
I never used a primer before but wanted to try it out to see helped my make-up stay on longer, and it does.
Love it!!!!!
Works great! It's super creamy and spreads easily over your eyelid.
"  I love the eye primer! This is my second tube. It works better than any other I have tried  "

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: A must have for all ages!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I can't remember what I did before using this product! I'm 37 and as the years go by creasing has become a real issue for me. I also have oily skin so shadows always seem to crease and fade quickly. I use this primer both under my eyes as well as on my lids. It prevents creasing and helps my concealer and eyeshadow last all day! It comes tinted so it helps to see where it's placed and rubs in quickly. I am light skinned and it's not too dark for me yet seems like it would work well with darker skins types as well. Unlike some primers it doesn't flake off when product is applied over it. I included some pictures which were taken about 5 hours after my make up was applied! I cannot believe how well this product works! I hope my review helped you to decide whether or not this product is right for you. If it has please hit yes below! Thank you!

Seems to work well. New to using eyeshadow primer so not totally convinced of its need. Noticed after about 6 hours of wear the eyeshadow started to flake off, not sure if primer at fault or brand of eyeshadow. Will try with a different shadow and see how that works

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: A little dark for us pale ones
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Coverage is good, but it adds a very noticeable peach tone to my skin when using it. I'm quite pale though (I add literal white to my foundation), and I tend to use more natural colors for my eyeshadows, so it's adding a tint to them as well, darker shadows are fine. I'll use it up, but try something else. Pic one is unblended, pic two is blended, you can see it's a bit extra peachy.

The sides of my eyes are very oily and just beneath the lower lash line I get a lot of smudging. This did not help at all. It also intensifies the crepey skin on my upper lids which went through to my shadow.. Have had to stop using it and went back to a more expensive brand..

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: but does cut grease and makes make up easier to apply but does not stop creasing on my eye or under my eye so I'm a little disap
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Can get a little flaky, but does cut grease and makes make up easier to apply but does not stop creasing on my eye or under my eye so I'm a little disappointed.
Love it as much as my Urban Decay primer potion!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Great primer compared to urban decay primer potion
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is an amazing primer! I use the urban decay primer potion and this is just as good for a cheaper price! I like the way it blends with with skin when I apply it and it seems to be water proof bc when I ran it through water my makeup wasn't smudgy at all! I only had to apply this once throughout the day any my eyeshadow stayed put. This is going to be my new eye primer from now on. I LOVE IT and i hope you do too! I hope you find my video and photos helpful! By the way, this is my first video review! :)I received this at a discounted price for an honest review.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I am a believer! My right eye is primed. So much more shimmer.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Well I have to say I never wore eye primer before this product. However, I'm very impressed with how well my eyeshadow goes on after I apply it. I have taken a picture of the eyelid I did primer on and the one I did not you can see how much nicer the eyeshadow looks on the primed I versus the non-primed.  With the primer I noticed that my eyeshadow stays on much longer and will last a full day without me having to reapply my shadow. Very pleased with this eye primer and this product is now a part of my daily makeup routine.I received this product for free or at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion and unbiased review. Please feel free to message me with any questions.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Cost less, just as good and more product than my name brand
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Radiant complex sells some amazing products and the value is great because the cost is less than my previous primer for more than twice as much and it actually works better than my expensive name brand. This primer really does allow your eye makeup some real staying power and makes it look brighter and keeps it from clumping. It really allows you to blur your makeup well. It goes on smooth and it doesn't take much, a little goes a long way. This good sized tube will last me months so it's really saving me money. After trying this one and anot her radiant complex product I am a believer and I will continue to use them. I am also more than willing and excited about trying any other products by them. Great quality products. I would buy it again with no hesitation.I received this product at a reduced rate in exchange for an honest review but when I run out I will be repurchasing at full price and I'll still be saving money compared to what I was spending

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Not great for oily/hooded lids, but great for others!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This primer comes in a matte black squeeze tube. Unlike other primers I've tried, this has a peachy/salmon tint to it that will help those with dark lids. I am a light/medium tone with very oily skin/lids AND hooded eyes & you can barely tell this is even on my lids.  It dries down to a matte finish.Application, packaging, and use were wonderful....but this didn't keep my shadow from creasing.  Very few primers do actually work for my extremely oily lids.  I'm not saying this didn't work, but about 8 hours after application I noticed my lids had spots of shadow missing.  The rest of my shadow was great, just in the hooded crease/lid area was where I had the problem.I feel this would probably work best for those with normal/combo skin types.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Why did I wait so long to start wearing primers!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I am a newbie at primers and now I wonder why I waited so long to use them! I love this stuff! So I am getting older (over 40) and the eye area seems to show creases more when wearing shadow. With this, there is no crease and it holds my makeup all day, even into the evening. I like that it is neutral color and covers well. There is a lot and since you don't need much, I image this will last a very long time. I was given a discount to try this and give my review, so glad I did, would have missed a great product

This is a good product, providing a dry matte base on eyelids for your liner and eye shadow. It helps keep the liner in place and less creasing of eye shadow. Makeup artists recommend a good base before applying liner and color.

Based on reviews I read, I thought this would be more spectacular than it is. I put a tiny bit on every day before my concealer, but after my moisturizer. However, I still do find that my concealer is settling into the creases of my eyelids. I thought this would prevent that. Maybe it has to do with the concealer I'm using. This goes on well and even though it has a color to it, it blends in with my skin. It does not conceal at all on its own, though I don't think it claims to do that. It's ok, just not amazing for my 43 year old skin.Addendum: I would like to say that the people at Radiant Complex were very kind and helpful. I would recommend buying from this company, as their customer service is truly excellent.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Gold, sparkly. Should be lemon yellow, creamy.
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is actually gold & SPARKLY. It's not lemon yellow! It's really not a proper eye primer. It should be breamy lemon yellow (similar to Benefit's). Sigh, shudder, sigh. Makes a lovely eyeshadow though. Le sigh.

This is a good Shimmery Primer! I love the color, And it makes my eyes look brighter. If you like glitter then order this primer. Haven't wore it all day but it works from what i seen :) And the shipping was super fast! And the price was Awsome :)

This stuff is super dry out of the tube and is a little hard to blend. But it does last all day. I have been looking for a product to replace Urban Decay Primer, this isn't it. But, the price can't be beat and I will just use it as a back up primer.

Good thing this isn't expensive make up. But on a good note the white color does make eyeshadow look brighter.

Sometimes this looks cakey with eyeshadow under it, and the "Pearl" color has a bit more of a pinkish undertone than I would like since my skin has a golden undertone. But I went to a Streetlight Manifesto concert the week I bought this, and my makeup stayed perfectly throughout a long concert and a four hour drive on a rather warm day. I'd say it's a win.
This is a good base for eye shadow to brighten it up a bit and give a little shimmer, but I don't feel like it helps much with adhesion and my eye shadow still creases after the same length of wear.
I received the product and it was empty. A complete waist of money!!
container seems a bit large for the small amount of product .. but I do love it.

I used this eye primer for Thankgiving make-up because i didn't want the heat in the kitchen to mess up anything... IT WORKS AMAZINGLY!!!! It stood up to what i threw at it and my eyeshadow stayed beautiful!!!

this primer is ok, not my favorite though! the white doesnt soak in, you can see it through your eye shadow! i probably should have gotten in clear! i like the e.l.f brand though so i will definitely buy from them again! the delivery was quick and was well packaged

I like this primer because it really helps keep the eye shadow on, but mostly when you stay dry, I've realized if you wanna party and get sweaty, it does rub off a little too easily, but for a regular day, this is the perfect primer.

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I LOVE this stuff!!! I've been using this for probably close to 8 years or so. This is my go to concealer. I've tried creams and sticks before and that stuff goes on so cakey, it's disgusting. This stuff is not liquid enough to spill everywhere but it is not a heavy cream either, it's right in the middle. That makes it highly blendable and easy to make look natural.I don't wear foundation, I just cover any spots or areas with this (the color matches my skin well enough) and I'm done. I can't say it's super buildable - it isn't BB cream or tinted moisturizer light but it's not heavy coverage either. Again, right in the middle.In terms of undereye circles, this stuff does a great job as long as you use proper technique in applying under the eyes (triangle method) and depending on what the skin/terrain under your eyes is like. One of my undereye circles is uneven, with a dip and that makes it much harder to cover the darkness, while the other is perfectly flat, so this concealer does a great job with it.If you're oily or sweaty, it will travel/budge a little but it will NOT be running down your face. Invest in some oil absorbent shine sheets and you will prolong its wear-time. If you get this stuff on clothes, pretty much forget about getting out, it really soaks in very quickly when it touches fabric.One thing that's annoying about the construction of the tube itself is that it tends to crack as the product depletes, I've had many tubes of this and it happens every time. It splits at the very top where the screw tracks are and the product starts to come out of places other than the brush-tip. This can lead to little messy accidents, so be aware. Also, a good bit of product is left in the tube by the time you can't squeeze any more from the tip. Just take the brush tip off with your nails and use something (the other end of a skinny eyeshadow brush ... etc) to get into the tube and get the product out, if you're like me and want to maximize how much you get out of this.It's cheap, not cakey, easily blendable and still lets your skin breathe, get it! I love it.

Very fast shipping! Arrived in less than a week! : ) and the product is shown exactly as pictured. I've tried Almay concealers like this one before and the formula is very good. Very clean coverage that covers undereyes and dark eye circles. : ) Recommended for use with liquid foundation.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: similar to urban decay's primer potion
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: The amount in this product is not 0.55 fluid oz as the name states. It is in fact 0.33 fluid oz. The name of this product when I purchased it was "Coastal Scents Step One Eye Primer, 0.55 Ounce", but Amazon is working on correcting this issue.In terms of the product's quality, I find that the texture and colour are very comparable to Urban Decay's Primer Potion (UDPP). This has less product in it than UDPP's (0.37 oz) but it is still considerably cheaper. So far, I think this is a pretty good dupe for UDPP. I noticed that this had a slightly more of an emollient/moisturizing texture than the UDPP, but it's not greasy. I have read online that some people experience oil separating from both the UDPP and this coastal scents version, but have not noticed it myself. It's probably a good idea to keep the product in a cool area away from direct sunlight, just in case. The product is thick and the nozzle on the tube is perfect for squeezing out the right amount needed.  I swatched this along with the UDPP on my hand with some eyeshadow and it definitely makes eyeshadows bolder, however I noticed that it washed off more quickly than the UDPP as well, which may or may not be a good thing depending on your preference. It has passed my eyeshadow and eyeliner smudge test and kept my eye makeup in place for the 7 hours that I had it on. My skin is relatively oily so without this product it would definitely have smeared all over the place and creased.
This is really light and simple.  Works very well for keeping my every-day liner on as well as shadows.  Very happy I found this!

Consumer_Reviews.review_text: I was looking for a cheaper alternative to Urban Decay's eyeshadow primer potion, which is about $20. Some other reviewer compared this brand favorably. In comparison, the $20 brand lasts for about half a year and works much better, in my opinion.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: ELF Essential Eyelid Primer in Sheer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Okay, so here's the deal: This stuff if pretty amazing.I received my order of the three-pack value, yesterday (Saturday, October 12, 2013), in addition to a Maybelline Eyeshadow palette that I was interesting in trying out. My boyfriend and I were planning on going out with some friends, so I wanted to use this chance to test out the primer! I tend to have oily eyelids, so I thought this was a good product to invest in, without spending too much.I was a bit taken aback by the product. I have never used eye shadow primer before, so I was not sure what to expect. I did not sense any odd smells, and the consistency appeared normal. I applied ELF's Eye Shadow primer and the Maybelline shadows around 5pm. It was rather simple to apply: Dab the product on to the eyelid, blend, and let it set for a few minutes before applying the shadow.So, my friends and I went out, then later decided to come back to our house. At this point, it's about 9pm and my eye shadow still looks like how I applied it! If I were to normally apply eye shadow with no primer, it would have faded -- fast!It was a nice evening, and we all decided to go take a walk. Now, it's about 10pm. Unfortunately, it started to rain while we were walking back to the house. Fast forward, it's about 11pm now. I check on my eye makeup while I'm changing clothes in the bathroom, and it's still there! Granted, it faded A LOT because of the rain, but I'm otherwise pretty impressed that it's still there!It's getting late, some friends leave, while others decide to stay the night (around 1am). I was too tired to go take off what was left of my makeup, so I just went to right to bed. Wake up at 10am, go to the bathroom, my eyeshadow is still there! Okay, okay, it's basically faded off by now, and all that's left is a a hint of brown shadow; but, if I were to normally go without primer, the eye shadow would have been gone by now. Hell, it would have been gone by the time I got home around 9, probably even an hour after I applied the eye shadow.If you're reading this review, and you're interested in trying this, go and buy it! I am NOT disappointed. As I said before, I have not used any eye primers before, so this is my first one and I don't have much experience to compare; however, comparing the primer to no primer at all, ELF's Eye Shadow Primer is fantastic! I'm super glad I bought the three-pack value so I'm stocked for a good while! :DUPDATE (4/12/14): I decided to update this review, and nothing has changed: this stuff is still pretty amazing :). Yesterday, I applied this and my eye shadow around  1pm. The weather was about 80 degrees, with 40% humidity (I live in Maryland, to give you an idea...). I was walking a lot outside, so of course, I begin to sweat. Around 4pm I checked my makeup, and the eye shadow looked as if I had just applied it; no creasing or fading, whatsoever. I went along with the rest of my day, and around 12:30am (so, end of the day for me), I noticed a bit of creasing, but otherwise nothing has, again, changed. While this may be a problem for some, this does not deter my opinion about this product. The fact that it lasted *11 hours* through sweating, humidity, and a long day is VERY impressive to me. I tend to get oily eye lids, and before I decided to get the ELF Eye Shadow Primer, the eye shadow would have faded off AND have developed a lot of creasing after about an hour or two.I.e: BUY THIS!

Considering this product is so affordable, it works really well!! I usually have a lot of creasing with my eye makeup. This is especially true with concealers. I also have dark circles under my eyes, so concealer is a must. With this primer, I can apply concealer that lasts all day and doesn't crease. The only thing that you should be aware of in using this product is that it dries quickly. Be sure to apply and blend back to back. I learned my lesson when I applied the product to both eyes, but when I attempted to blend the second eye, the product had dried on. I haven't had any problems with the product beside that.

I would give this primer 5 stars, because the actual product itself is exactly what I needed. The primer is comfortable and makes a noticeable difference in the wear of my eye shadow. However, I removed one star because of this theme I've found with e.l.f. items, which no doubt is the reason their products are so good, but still affordable: The container is pretty bad. the tip of one of my applicators snapped off within a week(I'm not rough with them, it just popped right off), and one of the other applicator's little plastic ring at the top won't stay on, and usually just hangs out on the stick when I pull the applicator out.Those problems aren't really a big deal since I can still just use my finger to apply it with the one with a broken stick, and the little ring doesn't actually cause any issue at all. Despite these issues, I will absolutely keep using this eye shadow primer as my main primer, because it does it's job well!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Love it and will buy more!!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Having oily skin is a blessing, but on the eyelids with shadow it is not.  I received a sample of a more expensive product and tried it on my eyelids before applying the shadow.  Amazing!  So I bought this product from Elf on Amazon as it advertised as doing the same - keep shadow in place without creasing.  It does exactly as advertised.  Just put a little on your eyelids, pat in place (don't rub because it damages the fragile tissue) and then apply your eye shadow.  It will last all day until you remove it.  Love it!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: This is a makeup holy grail item!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: This is a PERFECT dupe for a more urban and expensive item out there. See what I did there? At a buck a pop you wouldn't expect this to work but it does! I have terribly oily lids and would shy away from makeup other than mascara and a light shadow because it would be gone or creased within hours. This primer keeps everything put! The doe foot applicator allows for easy application and once dry (about a minute or so) your shadow and liner will not budge! Recommend purchasing this in store as it's definitely cheaper but if you like wearing shadow but worry that it will be gone in a few hours you need to have this in your makeup bag!

I can't say I absolutely love this primer, but it's not the worst I've used either.  Lately where I live the humidity has been very high and I've noted that my eye shadow has been creasing more.  It works better when I'm not sweating or when the humidity isn't so high.  It may also be that I'm using too much, I don't know, but will test it again using less and see if there is an improvement.  I bought, in the past a single ELF eye primer and it seemed to work much better, so  I don't know why this time it seems to be working not as well as before save to say again the weather and the hot environment I work in.  On the plus side, again, I have used much worse products, so I'm not saying this stuff is horrible.  It's not.  I just hoped for the same results as before and unfortunately this isn't the case.  Still, it is sold at a great price, and for others seems to work well. Again, I will see if using less helps.

The only eyelid primer that works on my oily eyelids. I have droopy eyelids and my eyemake-up always end up collecting under the hood of my lids. This primer makes my eye make-up stay longer. Highly recommended!

I'm finding this second time around, it seems my primer is running out faster. So perhaps sometimes there's not quite as much in a container, or maybe it's a little old? But the product works great underneath my Avon eye shadow. I haven't tried it under any other shadows. Shadows are not all the same, so perhaps that could play some part in how well your shadow stays on with primer. This primer however doesn't irritate my eyes. I usually put it on right after doing my face primer. By the time I quickly put on my Bare Minerals foundation, it's ready for shadow.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: Wear it with or without eye shadow
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: One of the best eye shadow primers I've used.  I can even wear it alone because it does just brighten your eyes enough to make a nice coat of mascara stand out.

I am one of those unlucky women who gets creases in eyeshadow after only a couple of hours.  I've tried a couple of different primers; this Pixi one is the latest and, so far, the best.There are a couple of things to like about this primer.  It dries quickly and, because it's a little lighter in color than my skin, the pigments of my eyeshadows are quite bright.  Also, it gives my eye makeup more staying power than the regular eye primer from e.l.f. does.  The Pixi primer actually works with e.l.f. shadows (i.e., inexpensive shadows), too, which is something I'd been looking for.  It's non-irritating to my sensitive skin, as well.However, this is not perfect.  I do still get creases by the end of the work day -- though they're less of a problem than they used to be.  Blotting papers applied to the eyelid definitely help.  Also, I don't care for the applicator (I don't like these spongy applicators in general; I find that you lose control of where the product goes).  And there is a tendency to twist the bottom too much and dispense too much product, especially upon first use; it takes a long time for the primer to get to the sponge the first time (it's better on the second and subsequent times you use it).Still, as I said, this is probably the best eye primer I've tried so far.  I can definitely live with the negatives.

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: I do like the eye brightening quality of the primer
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Everything Sneaky Burrito said with one addition: I do like the eye brightening quality of the primer.  This product is really great for a no makeup look, to even up skin tone, cover mild dark circles and prime for eyeliner on those "nude eye" days.  I have had the exact same issues with primers burning or drying out my lids and this one does not.  It helped my lids recover from the elf primer disaster of 2014.  And it DOES extend wear (I have oily, hooded lids that just crease all makeup).  It works better if sealed with a powder before you put shadow on.  I am not crazy about the applicator either.  There's this weird lag, where you twist and nothing happens and then all of a sudden you have a ton of product.  The doe foot is no great shakes either.  I usually end up dabbing and blending with my fingers.  This product would probably be best served by being in a tube and being a few bucks cheaper!

Consumer_Reviews.review_title: best eye primer EVER! Will never go back to urban decay!
Consumer_Reviews.review_text: Best eye primer out there, over urban decay any day.  I have used this for years. Everytime I have branched out to try something new, I end up disappointed and come back to my ol faithful.  Seriously for the price, procduct, and how long it lasts you cannot go wrong. I wear a heavy amount of makeup daily. I am also of darker complexion,  this primer not only keeps my wear all day into the evening,  it's lighter shade makes all my eyes shadows color come through as its supposed to. Without it my shades of eyeshadow  look slightly off or dull. THIS PRODUCT LASTS ME 6 MONTHS! daily wear and weekend evening outings. I am very happy with pixi and hope they never stop making it.

I actually use this product under my eyes to conceal dark circles. I found that one click can provide enough coverage for both eyes, and then I swipe a more liquidy concealer over the primer. This combo keeps my under eyes bright all day, and when I apply it to my lids it helps prevent my shadow and mascara from smearing too. It's definitely a good product for oily skin. My only gripe is that it's expensive for what you get -- the amount inside the pen is miniscule and it's easily the one product I go through the fastest. But it's the only thing I've found that works for me!

I usually love Pixi products, but this eye primer wasn't anything special. It's designed to use on your lids to create an oil free canvas for shadow and help it stay all day. It does improve the staying power, but not any better than any other primer I've used. (For a cheap alternative, I find a stick concealer works just as well.) I can't see that it has any brightening effects really and the texture is kind of chalky. Also it's very light so my shadows looked lighter than usual and it almost gave my eyelids a too-white look when I tried wearing it without a shadow over it.
